name: Sunny room close to beach and parks
description:
Sunny room in a cozy home with a 40 acre park across the street with hiking trails down to a creek which meanders through the redwoods. Radiant heated kitchen floor and fireplace keep it warm and cozy on cool nights. Deck in back overlooks Valencia creek and a view of the forest with no houses in view. The house in near the end of a quiet street with zero traffic and yet quite

The space
Room in solar/powered home with remodeled kitchen and bathroom. Open floor plan, radiant heated kitchen floor, granite counters. Orchard, garden, washer dryer, deck overlooking creek in back. Lovely, peaceful and quiet neighborhood, 3rd house from end of road means almost no traffic. 40 acre Polo Grounds Park across the street with soccer and baseball fields as well as trails for walking amongst the towering redwoods. Popular Rio Del Mar beach a few minutes away. Bicycles available including tandem cruiser. Excellent ping pong table available as well for outdoor games. Apple and
host_about: Easygoing, environmentalist, musician/educator, progressive. Active playing music, gardening, teaching and working on the homestead.

name: Room with Private Entrance.
description:
Bedroom and bath with private entrance in home near Harbor and Beaches. Please read full description before booking.

The space
Small comfortable space with everything you need for a short stay.

Due to Corona virus pandemic, I'm keeping a window of at least 28 hours between rentals. No shared areas.

Coffee and Tea in room. Popular Harbor Cafe with great breakfast is within a few minutes walk. There's also a great little beachfront cafe at Harbor.

Room is in one of two cottage duplex tucked away from the street. Entrance is private, but room is attached to houses so please expect some noice although generally very quiet. There's private parking in my driveway.

Private entrance
Outdoor sitting area
Queen size platform bed with firm mattress
Private bathroom with shower/tub
Hairdryer, shampoo and conditioner
Closet for your luggage
TV with streaming services. Sling, Netflix and Prime
neighborhood_overview: Great location close to Santa Cruz Harbor and beaches (Twin Lake beach is a 10 to 15 minute walk), Midtown and Boardwalk. Downtown Santa Cruz is a 10 minute drive or Uber ride. Room is across the street from Upper Harbor access with great walking path all around Harbor to Lighthouse and Seabright Beach. Also access to Arana Gulch field with great walking paths next to cows grazing and nice view of Harbor.
host_about:
Easy going and friendly I like to think.

I like to garden (grew up on a farm in Sweden.)

Passionate about cooking and eating good, preferably locally grown healthy foods (this may include bacon).

I compost, hang laundry to dry outside when not foggy.

name: Dog Friendly Private Pleasure Point Beach Cottage
description:
*LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION*
Welcome to our Private Pleasure Point Beach Cottage (PPBC). A perfect location, walk out the door and down the street to the waves. Built in 1928 our adorable beach cottage is truly Santa Cruz. The location for Pleasure Point Beach Cottage can't be beat. The cottage itself is so healing, tranquil and cozy. The private hot tub just completes that experience. :-) Yes we allow dogs as well, just please no cats. Thank you

The space
*LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION*
Within the first block to the beach, Dog Friendly Private Pleasure Point Beach Cottage is your own charming beach cottage with private patio and hot tub, gas bbq and more...
Welcome to our Private Pleasure Point Beach Cottage (PPBC). Built in 1928 our adorable beach cottage is truly what old Santa Cruz is about. Quaint and cozy we are located in the best beach location in Santa Cruz (Pleasure Point). Just a block to the beach and surf, wake up and walk to the beac
neighborhood_overview: I love everything about this neighborhood.  I love how I know my neighbors.  I love how walking down to check the surf is difficult just because of the friends you see along the way.  We don't have sidewalks and we like it that way. What we have are backyard bbqs and each other.
host_about: Hey Airbnb folks thanks for taking the time to check out my profile and the Pleasure Point beach cottage.  I've now spent most of my life in Santa Cruz and I am a big fan of keeping the integrity of Pleasure Point, architecturally and as a community. My house was built in 1928 which is a big representation of the history of this area.  As this area was once one of the last "surf ghettos" in California it is known by its sweet beach cottages and community feel.  I pride myself on maintaining my cottage for others so they can experience old Santa Cruz.  Traveling and surfing or maybe surfing and traveling are a few of the greatest loves in my life. There is so much to be learned when visiting other places, peoples and stepping outside our comfort zone.  My love for surfing has taken me across the globe and I've definitely seen there is always an exchange in life:  In order to get respect it is important to give respect.  I've been humbled more than once in the ocean and on land. ;-)  Please enjoy enjoy enjoy Santa Cruz and this sweet little cottage in the heart of Pleasure Point.  Bienvenidos.

name: Guest bedroom in Victorian home
description:
The space
A redwood-floored, sun-filled, shuttered bedroom with arched windows and gabled ceiling in a unique 1860s home in Santa Cruz. My 'Carpenter Gothic' home is one of the earliest houses built by settlers. Both bedroom and adjacent bathroom (shower, toilet, washbasin) are fully remodelled and immaculately clean on the second floor of my home. The guest room is private, quiet, and has its own entrance staircase. It offers panoramic views of the Monterey Bay in one of Santa Cruz's oldest, safest, quietest neighborhoods. Walking distance to downtown through other historic areas. 1/2 acre of mature gardens and an 'orchidarium' surround this unique house on the hill.
The bus line to UCSC has a stop 3 minutes' walk away; the main terminus is a 15" walk - all downhill! Nearby attractions include the Santa Cruz Mission; Mission Plaza park; historic downtown replete with Victorian homes; a large variety of coffee shops and restaurants. The bus goes straight up to UCSC
neighborhood_overview: The West side of Santa Cruz is an extension, uphill, from the historic Mission Plaza.  It is on of the original 'neighbourhoods' in Santa Cruz with many mid-late 1800s homes providing spectacular panoramic views  of Monterey Bay.  My house was an original 'settler' homestead, built in the 1860s in one of the finest locations then and now.
host_about:
I am a phonetician, speech technologist, and linguist. 
Apart from my professional work, I enjoy my unique Victorian house, gardening, growing orchids, cooking and fine wines, antiques, painting, hiking, camping under the stars, international travel, and, most of all, my gorgeous Bengal cat.
This is a quiet, non-smoking, cat-loving house where dogs would have a hard time but cat-lovers will be delighted!

name: Guest Cottage with shared bath
description:
30 day minimum
Tiny garden cottage with a small kitchenette and small sleeping loft with a full futon. This is a very cute, very cozy space -- perfect for a single person or a couple. The loft has a low ceiling -- think ship's bunk. .
Bathroom in main house (the cottage does not have its own bathroom).
There's a 30 night min/max to stay in compliance with County rules but longer stays are also an option.
We have cats and dogs. Visiting pets are welcome but there's a fee.

The space
Craftsman style country home on a sunny half acre just South of Santa Cruz. The property is a ten minute drive from beaches and excellent small restaurants. We are designed for indoor outdoor living. Located 60 min from Silicon Valley and 90 min South of San Francisco in a country setting, we are a beautiful 40 min drive North of Monterey Bay Aquarium. Take a day trip to Big Sur. Or hike in the nearby Redwoods. Bike the local wineries and apple orchards just minute
host_about:
I am an over employed PA in love with the country life. The property is a rambling half acre of flowers, vegetable gardens an fruit trees in the hilly setting of South Santa Cruz County. Large sunny decks flank the main house and invite guests outside to enjoy morning coffee and the New York Times. 
The house has a small downstairs bedroom with shared bath. There is also a much larger private suite of rooms upstairs (that is not listed).  The guest cottage is quite small but cozy and is sited under the trees at the bottom of the rose garden. It has a small kitchenette and shares the downstairs bathroom in the main house. Both the bedroom and the cottage have queen sized futons. The cottage sleeping loft is a short ladder climb up. Either space would be perfect for a couple. We can accommodate up to three couples, with children. Well behaved dogs are also welcome and guests are encouraged to cook in the main house in the country-style kitchen with oak floors and an antique gas stove . 
The outdoor spaces offer benches and tables to sit, read and even eat out doors. And the wood fired hot tub is quite popular. I especially love soaking under the stars....
I serve coffee in the morning if I am home and not working out of town.

name: Strict 30 night minimum! Small room w shared bath.
description:
THIRTY DAY MINIMUM!!!!! The small room is perfect for a single person who does not need a lot of space. It can accommodate a couple as well, but it is very small. The site says "real bed" but don't be confused: all the beds in the house and cottage are futons,
The small room has private access to a shared bath (so it's a private bath if there are no cottage guests) with its own door to the bathroom which means it is right next to the bathroom.
Our cats and dogs are not allowed in the small room.

The space
This is a Craftsman style country home on a sunny 1/2 acre just South of Santa Cruz. Ten min from beaches and excellent restaurants. With large decks, and patios, it is designed for indoor outdoor living.
We are 60 min South from Silicon Valley, 90 min South of San Francisco and 40 min North of Monterey Bay Aquarium. Take day trips to Big Sur. or explore the local Redwoods. Or grab a bike and tour the local wineries and apple orchards on country
neighborhood_overview:
The property is near the top of a low ridge nestled in a country neighborhood At night you'll here coyotes and owls and also bats and a whole assortment of night critters. Because of the dry summer conditions as well as our resident bats, there are no mosquitos.
We are close to excellent mountain biking trails and there's lovely road biking through orchards and local farms.

name: Sunny in nature quiet location
description:
Small but lovely 2 BR solar powered home w/ 40 acre Polo Grounds park across the street! Deck overlooking creek surrounded by 100 yr. old redwoods. Very close to the beach, restaurants and shopping. Nisene Marks State Park, and Aptos beach just minutes away by bicycle or car. Seascape Golf Course 3 minutes away. Remodeled open floor plan with radiant tile floor in the kitchen area. Yamaha Baby Grand piano in the living room for the musically inclined.

The space
Small but lovely 2 BR solar powered home w/ 40 acre Polo Grounds park across the street! Deck overlooking creek surrounded by 100 yr. old redwoods. Very close to the beach, restaurants and shopping. Nisene Marks State Park, and Aptos beach just minutes away by bicycle or car. Remodeled open floor plan with radiant tile floor in the kitchen area. Yamaha Baby Grand piano in the living room for the musically inclined. Orchard and vegetable gardens with hammock for taking afternoon naps. No street lamps or s
neighborhood_overview: Neighborhood is very quiet and safe. The beautiful 40 acre Polo Grounds Park is across the street with a trail going all the way around and down into the redwoods and the creek below. This home is near the end of a cul de sac and there is almost zero traffic, so very safe and quiet. Fruit trees in the orchard next door with pears, apples and figs. All houses on this street have a creek

name: Master Bedroom w/ Soaker Tub
description:
Private entrance, soaker tub and a great location.

The space
Note: The private entrance makes for easy social distancing. No access to the main house including kitchen. If the weather is good, guests are welcome to sit on the outdoor sofa. Outdoor kitchen not set up for cooking during this time.

We have a second master bedroom with a full ensuite bathroom, so we figured we'd give Airbnb a try. That was 2011 and we've now hosted over 400 people!

We are just two blocks from downtown Santa Cruz, yet with spectacular views of downtown, the Santa Cruz mountains and a peak of the Monterey Bay. Walk to the downtown shops and restaurants or take a short drive (or 25 minute walk) down to the Boardwalk, Santa Cruz Wharf or West Cliff Drive. Queen size bed, dual sinks, shower and even a soaker tub are all yours. Desk and real office chair too. Come enjoy the best of Santa Cruz and the Monterey Bay area.

Our house is a short walk down a
neighborhood_overview:
Our house is a short walk down a pretty steep staircase to downtown Santa Cruz. Lots of restaurants, shops, movie theaters, market, etc. all within a few blocks.

The beach is about a 25 minute walk away.
host_about: As a longtime Airbnb host, I enjoy sharing my great town with visitors. Happy to give restaurant, hiking, and other recommendations.

name: Cottage on the Creek - Private Access to Creek!
description:
A framed cabin, PRIVATE access to year round creek running thru a private backyard. Peaceful, tranquil creekside setting in the redwoods. Deck, patio, observation bench & floor to ceiling window to take in the spectacular sights and sound. Spacious (715 SF) with no other homes on the property.

The space
A framed cabin with PRIVATE access to a year round creek running thru a private backyard. Peaceful, tranquil creekside setting in the redwoods. Deck, patio, observation bench and floor to ceiling window to take in the spectacular sights and sound. Spacious (715 SF) with no other homes on the property. San Francisco (1 hour), 20 mins to Santa Cruz. Use as a base to explore area attractions; Henry Cowell, Big Basin, Santa Cruz, etc.

Guest access
Entire home with private access to the year round creek
neighborhood_overview: Set amongst lovely redwood trees with creek running thru it, occasional visits from wild turkeys.   Once you are inside, the A-Frame home offers lots of privacy.  No backyard neighbors in view as there is a steep hill on the opposite side of the creek camouflaged by trees.
host_about: My wife, Cynthia and I are retired professionals from the high tech industry of Silicon Valley.  We love to be with nature, love all creatures big & small, especially our dog, Obi, who is adoringly called my "teddy bear".  Enjoy travels to immerse ourselves in the local culture, and food.  It gives us great pleasure to facilitate an experience for our guests to connect/re-connect with nature during their home away from home stay with us. We love sharing with others the natural beauty of the redwoods, and/or creek-side setting of our homes in the Santa Cruz mountains.

name: Santa Cruz Mtns. Dragonfly Cottage
description:
A peaceful setting in the California Redwoods. Your sweet stay will have you resting on the deck watching a great number of birds. Or maybe staring off into the woods from the hot tub......Dragonfly Cottage is one of a kind.

The space
Dragonfly Cottage is magic. A wonderful stone cottage in Corralitos in the beautiful Santa Cruz Mountains. For travelers this is the best of both worlds. A cozy cottage nestled in the redwood forest, a short distance to HWY 1. HWY 1 is the Pacific Coast HWY, the main vein to Monterey, Carmel-by-the-Sea, Big Sur, Capitola and Santa Cruz and the HWY 101 Corridor.

Please read all the way through the description before making a reservation request.

Or if you are looking for some peace and quiet. A restorative break from your life. This is an excellent choice.

People come from all over the world to experience the Pacific Coast specifically the Monterey Bay area. It is an area rich in history. Here you w
host_about:
I am a woman interested in almost everything. I am married, the mother of five children, ages 21 to 41. I am grandmother to seven. I am a local to the area and love my native California. I make soap and body products and am an avid reader. I have and affinity for people and animals. Thinking is my favorite activity. Talking with thinkers comes next. I love nature and have chosen to live in the mountains my entire adult life. I have traveled to Mexico, Canada, Ireland, Europe and around the States. I look forward to more travels and the good people wherever I go... 
Bless you, Mary Jane

name: Redwood Treehouse Santa Cruz Mtns.
description:
The space
A magical Redwood Treehouse located it the beautiful Santa Cruz Mountains. There is a live tree growing right through the main living area and another in the bathroom! It is simply incredible. It was built by my friend, Randy, a stained glass artist. Everyone who sees it are delighted by it.

Please read entire description before making a reservation request.

It has a delicious high-bed, a kitchen with a small stove and refrigerator, and typical cooking tools. There is a full bathroom with shower and toilet of course.

There is now a hot-tub at about 103 degrees ready for your soak before bed or a morning treat.

The Treehouse is a short walk of a few hundred yards (about four minutes) through the beautiful woods from the parking area.

There is a gas stove for heating. There is a TV and DVD player with many movies to choose from.

For travelers this is the best of both worlds. A wonderful treehouse ne

name: Apple Orchard Cottage
description:
Come experience a peaceful get-a-way above the fog line in the Aptos mountains with a million dollar view! The cottage overlooks natural beauty surrounded by majestic redwood trees. Relax on the private deck overlooking the peaceful valley. Lay around the pool, wander the grounds, walk along the country road. There is something about this little haven that will sooth your senses. Sibyll's Grandmother believed there was a healing energy about this land.

The space
***Please read the description and amenities completely before booking your reservation.***

IMPORTANT ROAD INFORMATION
Due to the heavy storms of the last couple winters, the main county road to our property has damage. There are a few places where the road is slipping into the gulch. Nothing major but part of the road is down to one lane. Stop signs have been put up for safety. You are on the county road for about 3 miles. Once you get to the private road the road is one lane but in be
host_about: I (Sibyll) grew up on this ranch. My grandfather came over from Yugoslavia in the early 1900’s and purchased the ranch sometime in the 1940’s. My mom grew up here and so have my daughters who were actually born in the old farmhouse over 20 years ago. My husband, Jay, and I now reside here with our pets and a couple tenants. We raised 5 children and now are at a new place in our lives. The land is very dear to my heart and a very special place. My grandmother claimed that the land has healing powers. The orchard is dying but the trees are still lovely and produce great fruit. We enjoy sharing our little slice of heaven with others.

name: Harbor Studio Near Beach Boardwalk
description:
What our guests say is that they like a cottage that is not in the host's backyard. Located on a seldom used alley 2 blocks from the beach, harbor, and restaurants. The Santa Cruz Beach Boardwalk is a walk of about 1 1/2 miles or 2 miles driving.
Guests appreciate that the cottage is only used by humans.
Please have all guests read the listing description so all are informed.

The space
No smoking on this property. Inside or outside. Please don't risk your security deposit by smoking. This property is appropriate for humans only. Please be aware that if you park in any of the neighbor's parking spaces my phone will ring. My neighbors are friendly and I like to keep it that way. The cottage is very tight therefore 2 adults, one child, and one infant is the maximum occupancy. The twin bed that pulls out of the couch is good for kids, I wouldn't want to sleep on it.

Come discover why Santa Cruz is such a popular destination. Our stand alon
neighborhood_overview: People are really friendly in this comfortable neighborhood.  You can just park your car and have plenty to do within walking distance.  Or use it for home base and visit Big Sur or the Monterey Bay Aquarium.  There is plenty of beauty and action right here.  Amazing what you will find to do.  Always something happening in Santa Cruz.
host_about: I love my little harbor hale cottage by the harbor.  I keep it clean.  This is a great area for mountain biking and my Santa Cruz Blur works well for me.

name: Charming Cottage Very Near Beach
description:
Delightful one bedroom cottage two blocks from the ocean in choice Westside Santa Cruz. Very comfortable Queen bed in bedroom. Quality sofabed in living room. Patios front and back. Remodeled kitchen, bedroom and bath. Sunny kitchen!
Very private!
Boutique wineries and yummy French bakery nearby.
Note: Very tall people: watch your head when you enter bathroom
NO CHILDREN UNDER 5 years.

3 night minimum for holidays such as Memorial and Labor Day, 4th of July,
Thanksgiving and Christmas.

The space
Lovely 1-BR cottage in choice neighborhood in Santa Cruz California. 5 minute walk to beach. Located in tranquil Westside Santa Cruz between the Lighthouse and Natural Bridges Beach. Very quiet and private. Patios in front and back.

Fenced backyard has beautiful succulent plants plus a lemon and maple tree.

Public transit (bus) on nearby street.

Recently remodeled bedroom, bathroom, and kitch
neighborhood_overview: We love the neighborhood, which is in the choice Westside area of Santa Cruz between the Lighthouse and Natural Bridges beach.  Unlike the noisy and congested Boardwalk area, this is very quiet. The cottage is close enough to the ocean that you can often smell the salt air.  Very private location, set back from the road. SEE COMMENTS UNDER "EXTRA DETAILS."
host_about:
I am a "sporty" retiree who loves tennis, hiking, dance, camping, travel and theater.

I adore my cottage in Santa Cruz, where I can inhale the fresh salt air from the Pacific ocean!

name: Sunny, Spacious, and Modern Home Near The Beach
description:
Bright, Spacious 2500 sq. ft home with 5 beds set up an additional mattress as needed. The kitchen is fully equipped for your cooking, hot tub in the back yard, a park around the block and a 10 min. walk to a large sandy beach.

DUE TO COVID-19, WE ARE ASKING TO LIMIT GUESTS WITHIN 2 FAMILIES OR MULTIGENERATIONAL FAMILIES (grandparents, parents, children).

The space
We have a Sunny, Spacious, and Modern 2500 sq. ft. sunny and updated home for those looking for the entire family and/or extended family. The house is about a 10 minute walk to beaches (small kids may take longer to walk) for surf, boogie boarding, relaxing, etc. We are just a few minutes drive from Crow's Nest Restaurant on the harbor. A five minute drive to world class surf at Pleasure Point break, the "HOOK", "38th", "Sharks", "26th", etc. We are located on a quiet dead end street, with a city park right around the block for kids. It is a 10 minute drive to the wharf and boardwalk (15-20
host_about: Hi we're the Garcia family. We are a fun loving, adventurous family, that welcomes travelers of all kinds. We have traveled all over the world and experienced various accommodations in the process, and love the concept of Airbnb!  We enjoy the outdoors and luckily Santa Cruz is a mecca for outdoor entertainment.

name: Victorian Farm Guest Cottage- Sleeps up to 6
description:
Here at "The Historic Hartman House," you can step back in time in our Victorian, country farm setting and stay in our Carriage House. Harvest fresh fruit and veggies of the season to enjoy in your own kitchen, commune with the farm animals, take a private yoga class, schedule a massage in town...wander, relax, unwind and discover Historic Boulder Creek!

The space
We are a licensed and permitted vacation rental by the County of Santa Cruz Certificate #CO00156.

Just one block from the historic town of Boulder Creek in the heart of California’s coastal redwood forest, "The Historic Hartman House" offers a Cottage that is the perfect place for your dream vacation! The Hartman House property is featured in "Historic Homes of Boulder Creek."

The Carriage House (sleeps up to 6 adults/ 1 QUEEN + 2 FULL sized sofa sleepers) has an open floor plan (see photo #2 for proximity of bedroom area to LR). It is perfect for families or couples traveling on
neighborhood_overview: We love the close proximity of restaurants and little shops to explore within a block, while enjoying a country setting.  It's truly a old fashioned small town experience!  Being surrounded by State Parks (from the mountains to the beach) is a perk too!
host_about:
Hi!  My name is Tamara and I love to experience new places and explore places that are "off the beaten path" or are favorites of the locals.  I am particularly interested in historic towns and sites as well as open space preserves and parks.  
By profession I am a principal in a Landscape Architecture firm ( (Website hidden by Airbnb)  In my "previous life" I was a Veterinary Nurse and spent some time restoring historic homes. I currently reside in a historic town in the Santa Cruz Mountains, where I have a spacious property with Victorian Guest Cottages that I share with travelers.  I grow most of my own organic heirloom vegetables on the property and love to share gardening tips!
What is it like to have me as a host?  I've been told that coming to my property is like stepping back in time and is the perfect place to rejuvenate the spirit.  Guests have also appreciated having their own cottage and the privacy that comes with it.  Because I am very involved in my community, I can also give lots of tips on where to go and what to do depending on the desires of the guest.

name: Santa Cruz, Sanctuary w/ hot tub in bamboo garden
description:
It's a quiet private cottage beautifully landscaped with Japanese maples, fruit trees, summer organic raised bed garden, with a private hot tub in a bamboo garden. There is also a cozy, yet indoor/outdoor feeling with a fireplace for an easy and quiet getaway.

During the Shelter in Place we are hosting emergency and essential workers and guests who are traveling to Santa Cruz to support or assist family livng in Santa Cruz County. Please feel free to inquire and request available dates.

The space
Beautiful home away from home. Enjoy the sanctuary of a quiet cottage walking distance to the beach or downtown Pacific Avenue. Bedroom over looks garden area and is separated by 7 foot wall of Hard wood cherry shelves. Beautiful cherry floors, granite counter tops, new kitchen cabinets, stainless steel appliances, washer/dryer. 2 person slate shower, bamboo garden with hot tub. Out swing french doors open to patio, BBQ, Lavender garden and yard.
neighborhood_overview:
We are in very quiet neighborhood of retired UCSC faculty, local business owners, long time Santa Cruz families and past city council officers. We are a block to restaurants on Mission Street (Cafe Brazil, Burger, Restaranti Avanti etc). The Santa Cruz Boardwalk and Wharf, the beautiful West Cliff Drive and famous surf spots of "The Lane and Cowell's) is within 1.4 mile from the cottage. Please review (SENSITIVE CONTENTS HIDDEN) maps for bus schedule, walking or driving information.

We are also 1.2 of a Mile from Downtown Pacific Avenue which has great restaurants, coffee shops, museums, movie theaters, shopping etc...

We are also 1.4 of a mile from Cowell' beach. 2-3 miles to Natural Bridges, Wilder Ranch, Seymore Marine Lab, Pgonip for hiking, biking, running etc...

You are in a quiet neighborhood, walking or biking distance to everything Santa Cruz has to offer without being in the high traffic tourist spots of Santa Cruz.
host_about: Living and loving Santa Cruz with my family.   We enjoy sharing our cottage retreat.   A peaceful, beautiful Sanctuary, near downtown Pacific Avenue and West Cliff Drive.

name: Walk to everything!  Surf Colony Modern Surf Shack
description:
Comfortable, charming, uncluttered house with all the modern amenities, bikes, surfboards and other toys. Easy walk to the beach and the boardwalk.

City Permit: STR18-0008 | TOT #512-955Q

The space
This stylish, adorable, lovingly-maintained, Westside home is located in a central yet peaceful neighborhood. Ideally located on the corner of Bay & Lighthouse, it’s a short walk to: Cowell’s Beach, Steamer Lane, the lively Municipal Pier and the ever-entertaining Santa Cruz Beach Boardwalk. Take one of our beach cruisers for a short bike ride Downtown, to Mission Street, New Leaf market, the Harbor and beyond. You'll never need to get into your car.

Our well-appointed, but simple home includes an outdoor area that feels very much like part of the home. For a small house, the two bedrooms, loft, kitchen and living room are all quite spacious with loads of natural light. The sunny kitchen is great for entertaining and is outfitted with new applianc
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is surprisingly quiet considering how close it is to all the action. We also get some of the best weather - within the micro climates of Santa Cruz!
host_about: Alan and Brit are originally from Canada but have spent the past 15 years in the Bay Area. Alan is a product designer and Brit works in advertising as a Digital Production Consultant. We're kinda nerdy but LOVE to surf. We have traveled all over the world but think the Bay Area and Santa Cruz are hard to beat. We split our time between SF and SC.

name: Cozy, modern 3 BR cottage by beach
description:
Scandinavian style home with lots of light and skylights, clean, modernized, 3 Bedroom space with back deck for responsible families and adults. Modern appliances-Yard is cozy with BBQ, gas fire pit and hot tub for relaxation. Care for home required!!


Price includes City of Santa Cruz occupancy taxes.

The space
Cozy light airy home blocks from west cliff with 2 queen bedrooms and 1 single bed bedroom with outdoor dining relaxing deck on quiet street on west side. A place for families, couples and mellow getaways. Its an upstairs/downstairs arrangement with a full bath both upstairs and downstairs. Skylights and windows throughout the house bring light into every room. Fully equipped with hot tub, fire pit and outdoor seating area, and relaxed and comfortable dining inside large open kitchen for family and friend meals. Back yard just remodeled with new furniture brand new Weber gas grill and succulents! The house comes with a loveable adorab
neighborhood_overview: Quiet safe friendly neighborhood! Our neighbors are home so please quiet hours after 11:00 pm
host_about: We own and love our home close to the beach. I am a marine biologist for the California Marine Sanctuary Foundation, and travel away from lovely Santa Cruz periodically, and want to share our home with you.

name: Cottage Nestled in the Redwoods
description:
The space
Our one bedroom cottage located in the Santa Cruz Mountains on a gated property, is a beautiful and comfortable place to relax and unwind. It sleeps 2 - 4 people, with 2 in the queen bed in the bedroom and 1 or 2 in the (full size) fold-out hide-a-bed air mattress in the living room.

There is also a single pad with bedding available for inside or outside deck sleeping. Inside the cottage there is a large flat screen TV with cable, a DVD player, and a selection of movies and High Speed Internet. There is also a cd player and a collection of CD's. We have a full kitchen with an antique gas stove, microwave, refrigerator/freezer, an assortment of tea's, coffee, basic condiments, and the tap water from our well is safe and excellent to drink. There is a wood burning stove in the living room with plenty of wood and the walls are adorned with vintage rock & roll posters. On the deck we have a jacuzzi hot tub, a gas barbecue, and patio furniture. There ar
host_about: Jay is an easy going, friendly guy who collects antiques, vintage rock and roll posters, and vintage cars. His interests are producing music concerts, traveling, working with convicts, and being an authentic human being. He also manages a roofing company, a concert promotion company, staffs men's retreats, and works with men inside prisons.

name: Ridge Top Get-A-Way
description:
A quite suite in a beautiful setting. The guest suite (2 bedrooms, spa bathroom & private deck) occupies the lower floor of our hilltop home. Enjoy forest views and quite nights, 20 mins to either Silicon Valley or Monterey Bay beaches. Guest have a private entrance and off street parking is provided.

The space
2 private rooms and a spa bathroom with private deck and entrance occupying the lower level of our home. A ridgetop retreat, peaceful, private, home in the Loma Prieta area of the Santa Cruz Mts. An ideal location for business and pleasure. You can have your toes in the sand on the Monterey Bay or be in Silicon Valley in 20 minutes.

We offer a Guest Suite that is the entire downstairs area of the house, 2 private bedrooms and a big spa-like bathroom. The main bedroom has a queen sized bed, sitting area, private porch, and a TV. The smaller bedroom has a set of bunk beds, a desk and a big deck off of it. For your comfort and convenience there's
neighborhood_overview: What we love about our neighborhood is that we don't live in a neighborhood. Our house sits on a sunny hill top surrounded by the Redwood forest with the closest neighbor's house a couple hundred yards away.  While we live in a rural area, Silicon Valley is 15-20 minutes to the north and the Monterey Bay is 15 minutes to the south, great for business and pleasure. Levi Stadium is 40 minutes away.
host_location: Los Gatos, Santa Cruz Mts, California, United States
host_about:
Favorite quote: "Good looks, wealth and education are often wasted on the slow. Everything in moderation and moderation is the first to go."

Husband, father, avid downhill skier, motorcyclist, frustrated landscape artist and builder/craftsman, I enjoy creating things and the company of others. Empty twisty back roads, a firm suspension, and a good apex makes my motor rev. Uncrowded steeps covered in feet  of fluffy powder, blue sky, and mountain vistas are my favorite things. Hanging out with friends at our outdoor bar, drinking, eating, talking, laughing, enjoying the evening, reveling in the beauty that surrounds us. 

We offer a private guest suite (1 or 2 rooms), in a quite, beautiful setting. A romantic get-away, relaxing weekend, a place at the bar after a day of mountain biking, a family vacation adventure or whatever you choose, we'll do our best to accommodate your needs and style. Join us for a marguerita while watching a spectacular sunset on the deck, or enjoy a bottle of the superb local wines with your lover while watching the sun set in your window. Get to know us, share your experiences and find out what you might want to try while you're the area or have a private evening, just let us know what you desire.

name: 10 MINUTES NORTH OF SANTA CRUZ
description:
OUR LOCATION IS CLOSE TO SANTA CRUZ, BIG BASIN AND WILDER STATE PARKS, ANO NUEVO RESERVE, BEACHES, MOUNTAINS, SWANTON BERRY FARM, HIKES, RESTAURANTS, WINE TASTING, MICROBREWERY, FARMERS MARKET SHOPPING, 1 1/4 HR TO SF OR MONTEREY Check out our you tube video "Davenport Beach Airbnb"

The space
We are located in Davenport 10 minutes north of Santa Cruz, directly on HWY 1 next to the
Whale City Bakery. We have a 1 and 1/2 bedroom ( one pull out couch).Kitchen with eating area and bathroom remodeled with tub. Very comfortable cozy space for 3 or 4 people. Huge front deck overlooking the ocean with an up stairs whale watching deck. From these places you can see the Bonny Doon mountains
behind us and the Pacific ocean in the front,quite nice. This area is a gold mine of things to do. You might find yourself grabbing some local roasted coffee and a hand made pastry in the mornings right next store from us. You could look for beach glass on the beach across t
neighborhood_overview: Taco Tues. & Thurs with live music, Some very good acts.
host_about: Hey there folks, my name is Michael. I operate a small villa with a front private house, and a one bedroom bungalow. They are both fully self contained. We usually have an eclectic type of person that stays here, mostly artists, musicians, and alternative, progressive thinkers. These interesting  people are drawn to this electric area maybe because we have giant redwood trees behind us and the Pacific Ocean in front of us. I live here and it's my job to make sure everyone is happy. Some nights the whole place will be full of travelers eating together, playing music, and telling story. Other nights a quite family of four arrives just to get away from the New York winter. In Davenport with a population of three hundred you get to know everybody quick. The local pub and bakery have two community events every week its quite a hoot. I'm 40 and love the area , born and raised in these hills and know every great hiking trail, every great surf spot, every great and marvelous thing to do and see in this area. We have a fun basket of toys and game equipment thats been donated by travelers and has accumulated over time , so we have wet suits and surf boards to frisbees and golf clubs.  My days are full  tending to the traveler and everyday I'm grateful to have the opportunity to share with people the villa space and all the beautiful things this area has to offer. This has taken almost half a life time to attain. I have traveled the world and lived in other places but I always find myself back in the Santa Cruz area. I know it, love it, and have this great job of sharing it. If anyone out there wants the front line tour, I can accommodate or if you just choose  a cozy private night by the fire i can accommodate that. Like the beat of the ocean outside the villa, we march to our happy places that pull us away from our everyday grind, and I believe, this is the marching grounds for peace, happiness, well being, and adventure....  see ya soon   Michael

description:
Self contained efficiency studio with private bath and entrance. Small refrigerator, coffee, and High Def TV with Netflix and Amazon video.
Active 4 and 7 year old in main house. People can usually hear their noisy selves, often in the a.m.

The space
Self contained efficiency room located in a safe and quiet neighborhood. The room comes equiped with a microwave, coffee maker and refrigerator with use of laundry, Wi-Fi and TV with Netflix. Private entrance and private bath with plenty of parking. Just blocks from New Brighton Beach and State Park, Capitola Village, Soquel Village and Nisene Marks Forest. 10 minutes driving to Downtown Santa Cruz. Studio is furnished with a queen size bed but will accommodate up to 3 people if you get creative with sleeping arrangements. We can provide floor mat and blankets/pillows for extra guest. Hardwood floors with nice view of bamboo garden leading to sunny backyard.

*2 night minimum for weekends*
*Sorr
neighborhood_overview: Quiet residential neighborhood walking distance to great restaurants and coffee
host_about: We are a friendly and welcoming family with two happy and energetic kids. We are active and athletic and love spending time together as a family. We love meeting new people and appreciate people from different cultures and different walks of life. We enjoy a nice balance of social and quiet times.

name: Santa Cruz Private Bedroom and Bath
description:
This is the perfect gateway for all that Santa Cruz has to offer - including world class surfing, sailing, kayaking, fishing, cycling, golfing, premium wine tasting and breweries, CA State Parks, the Historic Santa Cruz Beach Boardwalk

The space
Stay in a restored Private Master Bedroom with full Bathroom in a 111 year old beach cottage. The master bedroom has it's own separate entrance around the back of the cottage. The beach cottage is located in Santa Cruz, California, within the award winning Seabright neighborhood.

Some Key Features of this AirBnB:

- One mid-weight cruiser bike to ride
- Wireless internet, Mac friendly.
- New full size mattress, four pillows, and sheets.
- New Kolher bath fixtures and faucets
- On demand water heater, great for a nice hot shower or bath.
- Use of high efficient washer and dryer
- No Smoking on the property.

Guest access
-Private use of the bedro
neighborhood_overview:
A safe, quiet family neighborhood, where you can hear the waves crashing on the beach at night. Everything about the location is just right, close to the best restaurants, coffee shops, beaches, hiking, biking, and music venues in Santa Cruz.

Seabright Beach (also known as Castle Beach) is part of Twin Lakes State Beach. It was voted #1 by the locals, and is a top rated, five star beach in National publications. It is a wide strand of beautiful, soft sand that is bordered on the west by the mouth of the San Lorenzo River and Santa Cruz Boardwalk, and to the east by the Santa Cruz Yacht Harbor. It is excellent for family outings, beachcombing, jogging, swimming, body surfing, skim boarding, volleyball, evening bonfires and viewing incredible sunsets
host_about: I could not see myself living anywhere else, Santa Cruz is home to me.   I rebuilt half the cottage myself and the other half, the existing 112 year old beach cottage will be here to stay.  It's perfect living for work, but on my days off I'm vacationing!  In my spare time, I like to putter around the house, hike, bike take my boat out on the ocean, photography, etc...

1 mile to WestCliff Dr. surf, wonderful beaches, Boardwalk, downtown Pacific Ave.

Beautifully remodeled craftsman home with 3 bedrooms (King bed, Queen bed, 2 Full beds), office (full pull out) and 2 baths walking distance to Mission Street restaurants, parks and a mile to Cowell's beach, Boardwalk, Wharf, and downtown Pacific Avenue. Enjoy living a quiet neighborhood in Santa Cruz walking distance to restaurants off Mission Street and Trescony Park for the kids.

We are a 10 minute
neighborhood_overview: We are with in a mile from downtown Pacific Avenue restaurants, movies, shopping, coffee shop, museums etc.     West Cliff drive, the Santa Cruz wharf and boardwalk, and the Cowell' beach and surf spots are 1.3 miles. name: Bali-by-the-Beach...time for you!
description:
It is sublimely restful at Bali by the Beach. I can't think of a place I would rather be. It's sunny, airy, and spacious, with spectacular ocean views and ocean sounds to lullaby you to sleep. I love the beach! Please come--you will be glad you did.

The space
Time for you...Bali-by-the-Beach is the perfect seaside retreat! Home has every comfort and convenience, 2 Master bedrooms, each with its own full bath, Queen bed, and exotic furnishings.

Expansive windows in the Great Room, upstairs, reveal spectacular whitewater ocean views and a vast, luminous sky. Here you'll find lovely living and dining areas, a fully-equipped kitchen, and a half bath, plus a flat screen HD TV with DVR and cable (including HBO, Showtime), and easy access to a sun-drenched deck.

At the end of the day, when you've had your fill of stargazing, slip downstairs and let the waves serenade you to sleep. The ocean's lullaby can be heard from two spacious bedrooms, each o
neighborhood_overview: I love the beach, the views, the weather, the relaxed ease of it all. It's just a very happy, comfortable, wonderful place to be. When I'm there, I never want to leave (and neither do my guests).
host_about: I enjoy spending time with my family, going for long walks on the beach with my husband or cheering for the kids in their various sports events.  My favorite activities are surfing, swimming, and hot yoga/ pilates.

name: Opal Cliff Beach House-Ocean View-19 YEARS
description:
Opal Cliff Beach House is a 3 bedroom, 3 bath home on Opal Cliff Drive.
Located in a quiet neighborhood, but close to all the fun things! Views of the ocean across the street. Privates Beach just a few doors down and the Hook Surf Spot and Pleasure Point at the corner - several sets of stairs. Lovely 15-minute walk to Capitola.
One of the oldest vacation rentals in Santa Cruz - 19 years! Many repeat guests.
Super well supplied. Luxury, comfy accommodations. Perfect spot!

The space
With all of the amenities of home, your stay at the Opal Cliff Beach House will be comfortable and relaxing. Three bedrooms, three baths and an additional bed in the family room downstairs. Perfectly located 5 miles from Santa Cruz Beach Boardwalk, 3 miles from Santa Cruz Harbor and less than a mile to Capitola, it sits in a quiet neighborhood. No overflow beach parking and noise, but close to all the excitement.

We want your stay to be easy and relaxing whethe
neighborhood_overview: Slide right into the Monterey Bay lifestyle in this beautifully decorated and easy living home. With plenty of room for 8 adults, peaceful decks and patios to relax on, walking distance to beaches and the quaint Capitola Village. This is a Santa Cruz vacation rental to return to year after year.

name: cabin overlooking Soquel Creek
description:
The space
Charming large one bedroom cabin with sleeping loft on one hundred fifty acres, four miles from Soquel & Capitola. Features include wireless internet, cable T.V., well equipped kitchen, outdoor pavilion with BBQ, hot tub under the redwoods, hiking trails; this is one of the nicest properties in Santa Cruz County

****** We have a 2 night minimum on weekends ******

$100.00 cleaning fee included in reservation total

Guest access
During periods of heavy rain access to the property becomes unavailable. If the reservation needs to be canceled for this reason we will arrange for Airbnb to provide a full refund.

Other things to note
Winter access to the cabin can be problematic; the driveway includes a creek crossing that becomes impassable during periods of high precipitation.

name: Secluded Santa Cruz Beach Hideaway
description:
Quiet cottage tucked away on a side street with the best beach access. Very close to surf, restaurants, shopping. Wifi/cable/dvd/bikes/boards, pets OK.
http://www.sfgate.com/travel/article/A-day-in-Santa-Cruz-s-ultimate-surf-centric-7249096.php

The space
Secluded little cottage (500sq ft) 200 steps from the ocean on a quiet street, sleeps 4-6 people with a double bed in each bedroom plus a queen size sofabed in the living room. 2br 1ba, large dual head shower, fully equipped kitchen, washer dryer, wifi, cable, flat screen tv, 2 bikes, boogie boards, surf board, more beach gear and lots of other cool stuff. 2 minutes off of East Cliff dr down a practically private alley with next to no traffic. Walk to world class surf spots at Pleasure Point and Opal Cliffs, or just chill in the cozy comfortable environs. Short easy walking distance to good coffee surfshops icecream pizza sushi bbq natural foods taqueria burgers and anything else you may need.
No n
neighborhood_overview: This neighborhood is what Santa Cruz was like years ago- quiet, mellow, active, lots of folks enjoying the outdoors and the amazing access to the ocean.
host_about: Longtime California residents working in the music and natural foods fields, we love having a space so close to the water. As a professional musician I'm in several groups playing several styles, my wife is a nutritionist and loves to learn. When we're at the hideaway we spend alot of time outside hiking biking swimming surfing eating etc. We've spent a goodly amount of time in the tropics especially the Caribbean, this is as close as we can get to that here on the mainland!

name: Sunny Bedroom in Aptos Home
description:
The space
WELCOME

Kim and Claudia welcome you to their home in rural Aptos. You will stay in a large bedroom at one end of the house which adjoins one of our two bathrooms. We are located 5 minutes from stores; and 5 minutes from the beach and (in the opposite direction) 5 minutes from the Forest of Nisene Marks. We are located 10 miles south from downtown Santa Cruz.

AMENITIES INCLUDE:

~ Full size bed for two
~ Four large windows, and a shade for each window
~ Adjoining semi-private bathroom
~ WiFi
~ Use of our kitchen
~ Iron and ironing board
~ Your own parking place
~ Our one-acre property that adjoins a large open space area
~ Our road is on a bus route that takes you to Aptos Village, Cabrillo College and Santa Cruz

ABOUT US

We are both long-time local residents who can provide you with directions, fun ideas and a multitude of Monterey Bay Area informatio
neighborhood_overview: We live in a rural area that is 3/4 mile from Hwy. 1 and 5--6 minutes by car to stores and the beach.
host_about: Claudia and Kim are lovers of nature, art, music and travel. We have traveled most extensively in North America and Latin America, but our favorite destination, to date, is the Cinqua Terra coast & villages in Italy. Kim speaks Spanish. We have both studied Spanish abroad. Claudia just obtained her dual citizenship--USA & Italy. Professionally, Claudia is an accomplished artist, specializing in botanical painting. Kim is an environmental planner and owns his own consulting business. He also occasionally teaches English-as-a-Second-Language classes. Nature is our "spiritual guide". Kim is an avid long-distance runner and mt. biker. Claudia is an avid gardener. We love hiking, backpacking, kayaking and back-country telemark skiing. But we also enjoy World music, art and a relaxing walk on a nearby beach.

If you have members of your party with mobility issues, please be aware the house has an inverted floor plan. The living area, kitchen and master bedroom are upstairs.

The Ocean Rose is a modern, unique family home with amazing ocean views situated just steps from Seacliff beach in Aptos. This beautifully furnished vacation home has vaulted ceilings, hardwood, slate and carpeted floors, lots of windows, two ocean view decks, indoor and outdoor dining, and beautiful landscaping. The home has beautiful ocean views from almost every room and you can hear the gentl

The neighborhood is quiet and peaceful; a perfect relaxing getaway. You will find plenty of shopping and restaurant options within walking distance including Manuel's Mexican restaurant, Sno-White's Drive Inn, Pizza 1, Ambrosia India, and Marianne's Ice Cream!

We are steps away from beautiful beaches and 5 minutes from the hiking and biking trails of Nisene Marks Forest.

5 min: Capitola

name: The Coop
description:
Cozy and comfortable 3 BD, 2 Bath, house in the Seabright neighborhood on the east side of Santa Cruz. Just a short walk to the beach, downtown and shopping. Full complement of appliances. Great for a couple's weekend away or a family vacation.

The space
The Coop is a three bedroom, two bath home located on our block in the Seabright of Santa Cruz. The home can host up to 5 folks -- two bedrooms (full & single) downstairs with a shared bath and the light house queen bedroom upstairs overlooking our Windham tree and rooftops as well as eucalyptus heron sanctuary with its own private bathroom. If necessary a queen size aero bed can be used to accomodate up to two additional guests.

The bedrooms are cozy and the beds are comfy -- high quality linens, pillows and towels (of course!) and memory foam toppers (bien sur!)

Filled with natural light, the open floor plan boasts a well appointed kitchen, perfect for the gourmet in you, and dining
neighborhood_overview: The house is in a quiet neighborhood consisting of primarily detached single family houses.  The house is about 3/4 of a mile from Seabright beach, less than a mile from downtown Santa Cruz, about 1 mile from the Santa Cruz Beach Boardwalk.  Ocean View Park, with swings and slides for kids is within walking distanceThere is perhaps no place in Santa Cruz better for shopping:  within walking distance are:  Shoppers' Corner, Whole Foods, Staff of Life, Grocery Outlet, and a Safeway.
host_about:
Professor of Mathematics at University of California, Santa Cruz.  I have traveled a lot, some for work and some for recreation. This includes trips to UK, France, the Czech Republic, the Netherlands, Italy, Belgium, Sweden, Norway, Denmark, Germany, the former Soviet Union, Nicaragua, South Africa, Thailand, Cambodia, Fiji, Brazil, Guatemala, Australia, Belize.  I am an active person.  Favorite movie:  Casablanca.  Favorite TV show:  West Wing.  

Since I want comfort and convenience when I travel I try to make that possible for my guests.

Capitola is a small beach community about 5 miles south of Santa Cruz. My house is located on the Soquel River which runs directly into the ocean which is about 200 feet from the house. The area has shops and restaurants that you can walk to.

The space
Capitola is a quiet beach area south of Santa Cruz California. Our beach house is located right on the Soquel River, but only a very short walk to the beach and shops. There are some restaurants and bars at the beach

It has 2 bedrooms and 1 1/2 bathrooms, a kitchen and large open living room.

name: Beautiful Cabin in Redwoods
description:
The space
Our house is an all Redwood cabin set in the Redwoods of Ben Lomond. The property is on the San Lorenzo River with a nice view of the water. The cabin is fully functional and clean with four bedrooms, two bathrooms and a nice kitchen. There is a wood stove to heat the cabin and a couple of floor heaters to help out when its really cold. Lots of firewood available on the property. One of the bedrooms is a dorm of sorts that is great for your kids to bring along their friends. The place will sleep 4-10 depending on your family/friend configuration. The inside is all redwood -- walls, floors and the ceiling. The house is also surrounded by redwood decking, providing lots of space both inside and outside the home. There is even a horseshoe pit outside.

The location is near both Felton and Ben Lomond. Its about 15 minutes from downtown Santa Cruz and the beach. Its a great hangout for a golf weekend with your buddies as there are local courses like

name: Sweet Market Street Farm House
description:
Located in the banana belt (if there is sun in the sky, it will be shining here), this is a perfect house to enjoy good times with friends and family. 45 Minutes from the Monterey Jazz Festival! 10 minute drive to UCSC.
Come enjoy the kitchen, the deck, the fire pit and the Tiki bar. Bikes, wetsuits and beach gear!

The space
Ours is a sweet old Victorian Farm house built in 1878. Located in sunny Santa Cruz on the Central coast of California just an hour south of San Francisco and an hour north of Monterey, it's a great location for exploring the surrounding areas. Amenities include a full newly remodeled kitchen, a party deck with a hot tub, two bicycles, and all the beach supplies you will need. Each of the three bedrooms has a queen size bed. The two upstairs bedrooms share a European style bath with shower, and the master bedroom has its own bathroom. There is an additional half bath with washer and dryer off the kitchen. Amenities for Children-: 2
neighborhood_overview: I love the diversity in my neighborhood. I love the beautiful gardens, and I love that it is within walking distance to downtown.
host_about: We are a couple of young at heart empty nesters who love to travel and share our love of Santa Cruz with others.  We love to entertain and help to create traditions among our friends and family in Santa Cruz.  Married for forty seven years, we have two beautiful daughters and six grandchildren.  Our home is in the Santa Cruz Banana belt which means that when the city is bathed in fog- our front yard may be warm and sunny! We love to make our place available whenever we are away-whether for a weekend or a few weeks.

name: Zen Eco Cottage Near The Beach
description:
Our space is inspired by our travels around the world. We have created a tranquil and warm environment to enjoy and relax in, both indoors and out.

The space
We have a really cute stand alone "eco-zen condo" with 2 bedrooms and 1 bathroom, roughly 1 mile from the beach, located on the east side of town, near Pleasure Point. One bedroom has a queen size bed and the other has a brand new full size futon, both with memory foam toppers and VERY comfortable. Our home includes the following features:

-Recent upgrade! NEW HOT TUB!!!!
-Bamboo floors in kitchen and living room spaces
-Carpeted bedrooms (with recycled materials)
-Beautiful remodeled bathroom
-Recently remodeled kitchen fully stocked
-Beautiful garden out front with year round fresh veggies
-Brand new remodeled patio area with tiki bar, gas fire table, water fountain and hammock
-Solar panels
-Compost tumblers
-Wi-Fi access
-26" TV in extr
neighborhood_overview: Close to beach, shops, restaurants, etc.  Everything you need within walking a biking distance.  Great location. House located on a bit of a busy street at times.
host_about:
Hi! I am Dee and I’ve and married to my wonderful husband, Daniel, for the past 12 years.  We have new a beautiful and sweet 1 year old Border Collie mix.  By day, I work part time as a registered vet tech for the veterinary dermatologist and I run my own home pet care business and my husband teaches environmental science to 5th and 6th graders in the Santa Cruz mountains.  During our free time, together we enjoy traveling, snow boarding, rock climbing, scuba diving, music festivals and camping.  My biggest passion in life is horseback riding and I enjoy meditation, being in nature and learning how to be a better me.  My husband is a die hard surfer who also enjoys working in the garden and relaxing in his hammock while listening to reggae tunes.  We are both very passionate about the environment and doing our part to reduce our footprint on this planet. 
 We love traveling and seeing the world and we make an effort to travel out of the county as often as possible.  We have been to places such as Indonesia, Thailand, Malaysia, Costa Rica, Panama, Nicaragua, Hawaii, Europe, Philippines and Sri Lanka and upcoming New Zealand.   When we travel, we travel without any specific agenda and let life guide us to where we belong.  All we need is our trusty Lonely Planet guide book and we find ourselves at great hostels and air bnbs where like minded travelers gather to share stories and experiences.  We enjoy good company and fun positive people that inspire us to become better individuals.  We are fortunate in where we live and the beautiful home we live in and we would be blessed to share it with others while we are out on our own life adventures.  Our motto in life: "Find what you love and love what you find."  -Namaste

name: A Calm Getaway,Voss Gardens of Delight,Room A
description:
This spacious room features a private entrance, garden access, 1/2 bath,(shower down the hall) queen bed with roll away for extras, unique art and hand craftsmanship. Very quiet, complementary coffee/tea/ treats. Shared home in A RURAL MOUNTAIN LOCATION, 4 miles from Scotts Valley. If country living is not your cup of tea please consider another location.

The space
If you're looking for respite and inspiration,
Welcome to Voss Gardens! Or as our guests call it "Foodie Heaven!"
We are casual and rustic chic here in the Santa Cruz Mountains. Perched in the redwoods, our home is an architectural wonder built by our family of engineers and artists back in the eclectic seventies. Over the years an assemblage of art, antiques and curios has charmed its way into the spacious rooms and lofts. We offer 6 acres of quiet ambiance for guests and business travelers. Surrounded by redwoods and wildlife, our year round Organic Gardens provide robust greens for t
neighborhood_overview: You'll revel in quietness and the natural beauty of the mountains, 10 minutes to the beach, 1 hour to San Francisco. There are numerous hiking and biking trails in several state parks within 20 minutes. An old growth redwood is a mile stroll from the house. We are surrounded by trees and wildlife. Many of our neighbors have horses. The old stagecoach route from SF to Monterrey runs right through our property and the oldest bonded winery in California was started next door. We feel safe, and people are friendly. "Town" with great restaurants and conveniences is 4 miles away.
host_about:
HAPPY GUESTS MAKE ME HAPPY!
Label me a work in progress...
wearing many hats along the way...
one step at a time... 
Mother, grandmother, wife, educator, hostess with the most-est, yogini, artist,designer, world traveler, stand up comedian for first graders, proud member of the All In Good Time Ukulele Orchestra. 
I am a self taught home chef and have been growing organic food for over 30 years, love to cook and amaze my guests with gourmet cuisine featuring select produce from my terraced mountain garden. 
"You may call me a dreamer, but I'm not the only one."
Voss Gardens is now on (Hidden by Airbnb) !!  Our guests are sharing the magic @ #vossgardens

name: Hidden Gem Close to Downtown, Beach and Boardwalk
description:
Enjoy this secluded oasis from your wrap around deck and colorful courtyard! A five minute stroll to downtown and centrally located to biking on West Cliff, the Mission Santa Cruz, surfing at Steamer Lane, UCSC and only a 15 minute walk to the Wharf and Boardwalk. Perfect setup for remote working.

The space
1-bedroom apartment with private kitchen, bathroom, living room and off-street parking. The apartment is attached to the main house but well separated. The apartment has a private entry, wrap around deck and courtyard and 150MB WiFi. The living room has a flat screen HD TV with Roku and Chromecast proving robust streaming options. The bedroom has a queen bed and the living room has a full sized sofa sleeper. The house is nestled in a tree-filled oasis in the historic Mission Hill District of Santa Cruz.

There are two 110 Volt outlets in the very private parking area for slow charging your EV.

Short-Term Rental Permit Number 006-402-21
neighborhood_overview: This is the perfect space for two people to enjoy the downtown charm of Santa Cruz. A pull out bed in the living room provides an additional full bed for one or two guests. Use it as a launching point to explore downtown restaurants and the boardwalk or for a surf weekend with its close proximity to the beach or visit your student at the UCSC. The house is nestled within Santa Cruz's historic Victorians. This is a true Santa Cruz neighborhood with convenient access to the best the city has to offer. It's a very quiet neighborhood. We're also close in to world class mountain biking and surfing.
host_about: We're Michael and Mary Kaye. We're active hikers, bikers and surfers and love meeting new people. We love to walk downtown to hear local music and see the latest movies after enjoying one of our many restaurants. We respect your privacy and your private entrance will allow you to seek us out if you want to learn a little more about the area or want to borrow a bike or surfboard.

name: Santa Cruz Beach & Hike Launch Pad
description:
Calling all Santa Cruz day-trippers! If you want to enjoy all the coast & mountains have to offer - beaches, hiking, biking, dining and shopping - but crave a quieter and less populated place to rest in the evening - this place is for you.

The space
Spacious with lots of light, this 1-bedroom apartment is located in a quiet residential area in Scotts Valley. Grocery shopping, coffee shops, a library, movies, tennis courts, and dining are all a traffic-free 5-minutes away by car or 15-20 minute walking distance.

This 2nd floor granny apartment is attached to our main home but has a private entrance and cozy outdoor deck area. The apartment is single-occupancy only.

The apartment is newly carpeted (Oct. 2014) and features:
-- a large living room with digital cable TV
-- free reliable wifi
-- a fully-equipped kitchen (stove, oven, microwave, pantry, refrigerator, coffee maker, appliances, dishes, pots and pans etc.)
-- a la
neighborhood_overview:
Scotts Valley is a quiet town far enough away to leave behind the hub-bub of traffic and congestion of more populated areas - but with great freeway access to launch daytrips to the North or South. We have 3 full size grocery markets, drug stores, coffee shops (Peets, Starbucks and Surf City Roasters), a renowned skatepark and a fabulous seasonal farmers market on Saturday mornings. Though there is not really much "night life" in our fair city - there is a fabulous calendar of music at Don Quixotes in Felton (less than 10 min away) You can find the calendar with your favorite web search tool. Felton also has the Roaring Camp steam train, great hiking and a zip line park as well.

Our neighborhood is quiet and well-kept, with very little thru traffic and our home has several fruit trees and vegetable patches to enjoy seasonally.
host_about: I am a Silicon Valley marketing professional who takes any opportunity to unchain from the desk and hit the great outdoors - which could include anything from picking wild berries in my neighborhood to backpacking the John Muir Trail in the Sierras.   I love indoor pursuits just as much - cooking, baking, sewing and decorating with vintage fabrics.  I am spending a bit more time away from the home  so may not always be onsite, but my son Nick who lives in the home is also very willing to help out if I am unreachable for any reason.

name: Victorian Beach House Santa Cruz
description:
We love the old 1876 Victorian for its funky charm and great location.
Downtown Santa Cruz is bustling with shops and restaurants.
We can bike to the beach and not deal with traffic. Run or ride a bike on West Cliff Drive. Lots to do!

The space
Downtown Victorian in Santa Cruz. Beach house style. Close to shops and restaurants.
Near pacific street where all the restaurants and shops are fun to explore.
Six blocks to the Boardwalk and Cowell's Beach - premier spot for surfing lessons.

Three bedrooms - master with queen bed and two smaller bedrooms ,one double beds room and one twin with twin trundle bed.

Great backyard with picnic table, bbq and outdoor shower. Fully equipped, eat in kitchen with Wedgwood stove. bathroom with shower over bathtub.
Bright rooms with high ceiling. No dishwasher but supply paper plates if don't want to use dishes. Fully stocked kitchen.

Family friendly -- park across the
neighborhood_overview:
The greatest thing about being down town and blocks from Boardwalk is you don't have to drive to get food or entertainment. You can walk to beach or ride a bike and don't have to deal with the weekend beach traffic. The park is great for kids! across the street.
There is a yoga studio down the street, Bagel shop, and a great jazz club! Well within hot tubs and spa close by.
host_about: I grew up in Santa Cruz. I am an Interior designer in the bay area. My husband is from Bay area as well and loves to surf and snowboard. We have two kids 16 and 13 . They love what Santa Cruz has to offer. We are close to beach and downtown shops and restaurants. We love to travel as a family. We also host a house in Alpine Meadows Ca.

name: Estate Guest House on Vineyard
description:
Pacific Oaks Vineyard Estate is pleased to offer our guest house for your serene and private get-away in an idyllic setting. The vineyard is located on a ridge 3 miles above Aptos Village and the beach with views of Monterey Bay.

The space
Pacific Oaks Vineyard Estate is pleased to offer our guest house for your serene and private get-away in an idyllic setting. The vineyard is located on a ridge 3 miles above Aptos Village and the beach. The guest house, on a second floor, has a stunning panoramic view of Monterey Bay and the Redwoods.

The guest house has recently been completely renovated with a new bathroom, wood flooring, beautiful furnishings, small kitchenette and wood burning fireplace. The studio is flooded with light from the numerous windows and vaulted 20 foot ceiling. A large deck is attached which overlooks the vineyard and is surrounded by old growth oak trees. A gas barbecue is included for your favorite steak or fish from Monterey Bay
neighborhood_overview: This is a quiet country setting with rolling hills surrounded by apple orchards, redwoods and vineyards.
host_about:
My husband and I have an active organic working vineyard on the property. We take care of all aspects of the vineyard and winery. I prefer to view the vineyard chores as a zen-like experience rather than labor pruning and maintaining the vines. 
We produce a wonderful estate bottled Pinot Noir wine.
Our 4 children are grown and living away from home now. 
You will see families of deer, wild turkeys, bunnies and occasionally a coyote on the property.

name: Quiet and Serene in Santa Cruz!
description:
This serene space is excellently located within walking distance to the Seabright neighborhood restaurants, cafes, live music venues, and shops. Only a 5 minute drive to the Beach, Boardwalk, or Downtown. 10 minutes to UCSC-THIS LOCATION IS GREAT!! You can easily bike anywhere in Santa Cruz from here.

The space
This quiet retreat has a large bedroom with a queen size bed, full kitchen, full bath, nice patio, and a washer and dryer. Stay for a weekend, or stay for a month-welcome! Enjoy everything Santa Cruz has to offer from this nice, quiet space. The Seabright neighborhood has some of the best cafes, amazing live music at the Crepe Place, fun (and funky!) bars, family style restaurants, as well as fine dining. This is a perfect getaway for a couple, you can hop on your bikes and explore from this great central location. Small and quiet pets allowed only with $125 pet fee (we love our neighbors, so no barking dogs please). This is a single level apartment with
host_about: I have lived in Pleasure Point for  over twenty years and I love it!! I am very active, and love being a block from the ocean, as well as within biking distance to some epic trail rides in the Santa cruz mountains. I have travelled all over the world, and I always love coming home to my sweet little neighborhood by the beach:)

name: Cozy bed + bath with ocean view
description:
Cozy queen bedroom w. wood shingle wall, open beam ceiling, natural decor, spectacular ocean view when it's clear out. Comfortable California-style home. Hike/bike in nearby redwoods, drive to coast, valley, or local wineries. Relax on spacious deck. 20 mi to Santa Cruz via Hwy 17 South. 13 mi via 17 N to town of Los Gatos. Full bath (shower in tub) next to bedroom, for your private use. Share kitchen. Good choice for attending nearby events or wine tasting without having to drive to a hotel.

The space
On a ridge in the Santa Cruz Mountains, private bedroom with a queen bed, cotton sheets, and comfortable furnishings, that looks out on a spectacular coastal view of Monterey Bay. Bathroom with tub and shower is right next to bedroom in your own wing. The four-acre property is close to walking trails that take you deep into a redwood forest, bike trails in the Soquel Demonstration Forest, or a 20-minute drive to the Santa Cruz coast. Wineries within a few miles in
neighborhood_overview:
Want to get away from traffic, urban noise, pollution? You'd never know you are within reach of the SF Bay Area and Silicon Valley, even though you can get here easily. This is a quiet, natural setting with spectacular views, peaceful neighbors, and entertaining wildlife - birds, including wild turkeys sometimes, deer, next door chickens, owls hooting at night. Nice place to hang out or as a base for attending weddings or other events in the mountains or at the coast. You will not be hearing traffic, city noises, loud neighbors. Space to breathe. Easy 40 minute hike among redwoods within walking distance. Cyclists and hikers also enjoy the Soquel Demonstration Forest, nearby. Wineries are open on weekends, some of them during the week as well. Good to call ahead for specific wineries as some of them have limited tasting room hours.
You'll find a restaurant list for the area in the guest room, along with brochures and maps about local towns. Everything from casual to world-class
host_about:
Relaxed, professional mountain homeowner, in my own business, flexible hours. I have a cat, like the quiet of the mountains, follow world news and ideas. Friends and interests all around the world. I like to take walks in the woods nearby my house. Taste in music: blues, rock, soul, jazz, nature, birds. Good friends in the neighborhood make home even better. 
(I say I speak French...that means, limited in vocabulary, can speak with you a little).

The space
The house has a great room that opens to a deck for watching the sunrise, ocean, surfing and sometimes whales from your living room.
The kitchen is at the front of the great room and is well supplied with all necessary cooking amenities.
There are three bedrooms--one upstairs with a queen bed, and two downstairs--one with bunk beds and a twin with a pull out trundle,(so 4 in this room) then the third bedroom with a queen bed. You can sleep 8 in the bedrooms.
There are 2 full bathrooms-one upstairs and one downstairs.
In addition, you have access to wireless internet, Chromecast, flat screen TV with DVD and cable channels and a washer and dryer for your use. Two permitted street parking pa

name: Seacliff bungalow - 2 bedroom, 1 bath house.
description:
My place is in the Seacliff neighbor of Aptos, a block from the bluff overlooking the Monterey Bay. Considered a quiet, nice, and safe neighborhood, with Seacliff state beach just a 15-20 min. walk away from my house. It’s situated in between both Seacliff & New Brighton State beaches.

The space
It’s a 1930's beach bungalow, that’s cozy and welcoming. It’s a comfortable and relaxed environment with all the amenities you’d hope for (basically a home, not an empty rental).
Front & back porch with fenced in backyard. 2-3 car driveway along the side of the house.

Guest access
Use it as your own. Kitchen with gas stove, dishes & appliances, (eat/drink what’s around but please within reason, I’ve had guests eat/drink $30 worth of stuff on a one night stay); living room with wood burning fireplace; bathroom with shower stall, toiletries, backyard with outdoor shower, books, games, maps/guidebooks, magazines, speakers, record player, and wash
neighborhood_overview: Chill, relaxed, beautiful and friendly. A block away from the bluff overlooking Monterey Bay. Walking distance to a convenience store, gas, resturants, a skate park. A 20 min walk to grocery, library, bus and stores @ Soquel & State Park Drive. Nisene Marks State park (redwoods/trails) is a 5 min. drive away near Aptos Village (shops, resturants, etc.), Rio Del Mar beach (parking and a few resturants), Seacliff state beach, and New Brighton state beach are all within a 5 min. drive of the house. Seacliff beach is a 15-20 min. walk from the house. The Village of Capitola (beach area) is a 8 min. drive away with lots happening (surfing, sup, bars, resturants, shops).
host_about: an artistic, nomad, enjoying life and sharing it with others

There are huge glass accordion doors that open the house to the outdoor living area, which includes a concrete patio and a large grass area, a fountain, fire pit, hot outdoor shower and small barbecue. The backyard is fenced in and private. Upsta
host_about:
We love our house but also love to travel.
I work in education so I have all the summers off, my children are off to college so my time to travel has come. Our house is available now if you live in the area and is looking for a home office space, bigger home to retreat or stay for a week or month during this time.

500 Yards from beach - flat 5 min walk

Aptos is small beach town just south of Santa Cruz. Our cottage is a 5 minute walk to Rio Del Mar Beach, Cafe Rio Restaurant, Pixies (best breakfast burrito around) and a local market. We love our time in Aptos, but when we are not using it we love to share the experience with others. Here are some highlights:

The space
Beach House:

- Master bedroom (Queen Bed)

name: Eco Haven "Garden" private room
description:
Our house is powered by the sun! All aspects of it were designed to be ecological and beautiful at the same time. The Garden Room is 1 of 2 bedrooms downstairs. The bathroom is between the bedrooms.

*NOTE ON COVID-19:
WE USED TO RENT 2 BEDROOMS TO SEPARATE GUESTS. SINCE THE CORONAVIRUS, WE NO LONGER HAVE 2 BEDROOMS AVAILABLE (UNLESS YOU NEED A SECOND BEDROOM FOR FRIENDS). THIS REDUCES THE CHANCES GETTING COVID.

WE ALSO WASH DOWN THE SURFACES SUCH AS DOOR KNOBS AND FAUCETS WITH ALCOHOL.

The space
ADDITIONAL PROTECTION FROM COVID-19 VIRUS:
WE DO NOT RENT THE ROOM UNTIL 3 DAYS HAVE PASSED BETWEEN GUESTS.

The rest on the space:
The Eco Haven's Garden Room has an outside entrance to a garden area in back of the house. It has a table and 2 chairs so that you can enjoy the view and have breakfast. The room has a queen-sized bed, refrigerator stocked with breakfast items, microwave oven and a coffee maker. Both bedroo
neighborhood_overview: The house is on the end of a cul-de-sac with nothing but "sand islands" next to it.  Sand islands are protected area with 13 species of plants and animals which are endangered.  The house is a haven for deer, many kinds of birds and other wildlife.  Beautiful Loch Lomond is just a 15 minute drive away. Paddle boat, row boat, and canoe rentals, fishing for stocked trout and indigenous bass, picnicking, and hiking trails. Loch Lomond is open from March-September. There is the famous Roaring Camp Railroad attraction.  Cowell, Fall Creek and Big Basin Redwood parks are close by. Mt. Hermon Conference Center is 10 minutes from here.  Santa Cruz is a 20 minute drive.  Kayak rentals and tours go all around the bay. From town, it just a short hike to the Lime Kilns and University of California. Near the border of Scotts Valley and Santa Cruz lies the Mystery Spot.
host_about:
Roger is in the solar energy business.  Roger sold the business  but he is still active in a new venture.  I like photography, hiking, gardening and figuring out ways to do things differently.

Nancy's  has retired at the University of California (Santa Cruz). She wants to spend more time with the grandkids, doing water aerobics, visiting with friends and gardening.
