name: Country home near the sea
description:
My country home has the Californian rustic exterior yet modern stylish interior attitude all set on a 5 acre country setting just outside of downtown Santa Cruz by 6 minutes. With the world famous Mystery Spot only a mile a way and the Boardwalk being 12 mins away. Its a perfect place for couples, solo adventurers, business travelers, families (with kids), big groups, and furry friends (pets). Don't hesitate to reach out and ask me any questions you may have about my place and the surroundings.

The space
The home has an incredible feel with a modern mixed with country feel. Eclectic mix of art on the walls and in nice settings around the house. The back yard patio facing a sweet hillside full of oak trees. The outside fire pit and teak table and chairs set the scene for a very relaxing setting..
neighborhood_overview: Set in the incredible area known as Happy Valley of Santa Cruz County. A very tranquil and gorgeous area that has the perfect mix of coastal cool weather and warmth from being just inland enough.

name: Hacienda Almar in West Santa Cruz
description:
The space
Gorgeous, contemporary two bedroom, 2 bath house welcomes guests to Santa Cruz. Completely remodeled in 2012, the home features a private, tropical courtyard patio, and enclosed backyard. Inside you'll find brushed fir floors, Israeli Limestone bathrooms and reclaimed redwood detailing throughout. The light-filled kitchen features a Blue Star six-burner range, Bosch dishwasher, and Limestone countertops.

Downstairs, the beautiful Master suite features a custom built California King four- poster bed decked with a plush down comforter and oversized down pillows. Picture windows, writing desk, and a large walk- in closet complete the room., The attached Israeli Limestone bathroom has a large soaking tub with shower and heated towel rack.

The open, light-filled modern farmhouse dining area features 18 foot ceilings and an extensive dining table which expands to comfortably seat 14 people. Matching sofas flank our beautiful wood burning fir
host_about: I am  a school teacher and my husband, Bill, is a building contractor. We have lived in Santa Cruz for 35 years. We love to travel and we love coming home to Santa Cruz. It's a pleasure for us to share our house with others.

neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is truly one of the best beach neighborhoods in Santa Cruz. The beach is long and very wide. You can sometimes walk all the way to the wharf on the sand when the tide is low.

name: Cute Cabin in Santa Cruz Mountains
description:
Cozy cabin located on horse ranch in the Santa Cruz mountains. Large outdoor space with horseshoe's, fire pit and BBQ available for use. Access to Soquel Creek. 5 miles to Capitola
*Please read entire description before booking!

The space
On a horse ranch surrounded by oaks and redwoods. Private trail access to Soquel Creek with several swimming holes and seasonal catch and release Steelhead fishing. One bedroom, one bath, with comfortable queen size bed. Just minutes to Capitola and New Brighton Beach

*Important note, cell reception is spotty at best and although we do have WiFi, our internet service can be unreliable.

Guest access
Access to our property is via a paved one lane private road. We ask that you respect the posted 10 mph road speed and our 5 mph driveway speed. There are several turnouts if needed. We do have two very friendly dogs, two cats, several horses, goats and chickens.

neighborhood_overview: Close to town, but feels secluded.  No city lights nearby, means great stargazing at night!  Quiet and peaceful. Wildlife you may see, Deer, Quail, Owls, Hawks, Turkeys, Coyote, Bobcat, many varieties of birds.
host_about: We love the outdoors, camping is high up on the list when we have the time. We also enjoy traveling to new places. So far all of our travel has been in the U.S., but we are hoping to someday make a trip to Italy. We're new to hosting and are looking forward to sharing our property and meeting new people.

name: 5th Haven: A Beachside Chic Cottage
description:
Welcome to 5th Haven! Our goal is simple, to offer you a place of tranquility, of rest and repose. Remodeled a few years ago, this beautiful beachside cottage was built with serenity in mind. Walking distance to the beach, Santa Cruz harbor, restaurants, live music, surf/paddleboard/boat rentals, beach volleyball, fire pits.

The space
Careful attention to detail was made remodeling the home to give this small slice of heaven a cozy beach feel. It will comfortably accommodate 6 with indoor & outdoor living space to relax and enjoy the Santa Cruz sun.

Guest access
Guests are welcome to all amenities in the home including kitchenware, free WiFi internet, cable TV, hammock and beach toys!

Other things to note
The home is on the corner of Eaton street with local traffic that can be heard from outside. The home is insulated, so inside is quiet.

The home is 3 blocks from the beach and 2 blocks from the harbor, ab
neighborhood_overview: Located on a quaint one-way street, 5th Haven is far enough from the downtown Santa Cruz tourism to unwind, yet close enough to visit. The Twin Lakes area of Santa Cruz has water on 3 of its 4 corners. Santa Cruz harbor to the West, Swan Lake to the right, and Twin Lakes beach out front.
host_about: Born in So-Cal, found home in the Bay. Moved here in 2008 and fell in love with the people, places and slightly more definable seasons. I work for a surgical robotics company with technology that helps people daily, making my job an enjoyment since I started. When I’m not travelling for work I enjoy fitness activities with my beautiful other half Denise. Any weekend we get to sneak away is spent in Santa Cruz relaxing and enjoying the beach, and on the occasion we get a free week we love to expand our view of the world and explore the amazing people and cultures on different continents.

name: Private Cabin/beach house!
description:
The feel of a safe secure home while being surrounded with some of the county''s largest Redwood trees. The luxury of a short 5 min walk to the beach (Rio Del Mar) makes any day a perfect day.

The space
The Cabin-Beach House has been in the Niboli family for over 50 years and is very private. Through out the years we have taken pride in our up keeping of the home. We have given love and and care to every room in the house, and we hope you do the same.

The feel of a safe secure home while being surrounded with some of the county''s largest Redwood trees. The luxury of a short 5 min walk to the beach (Rio Del Mar) makes any day a perfect day. The Cabin-Beach House is located in Aptos, CA, on the 1Hwy off State Park Drive Exit. It's only a short 5min drive to beautiful Capitola Village, and a 15min drive to the The Santa Cruz Beach Boardwalk!
host_about: I am very easy going and respectful. As an entrepreneur, I work together with non profit organizations and small businesses of the community to have Fundraisers. I create unique events that give you an authentic taste of delicious food, music, art, and culture of the bay area. I also work in music education with The ONE Smart Piano and host a wine festival in Napa Valley that brings together the community.

name: The Garden Room @ Redwood Croft
description:
Redwood circles, songbirds, lawns, verandahs, hammocks, starry skies.
We have two private guest rooms. Microwave/mini fridge/coffee maker in each room. Room with Outdoor jacuzzi spa or indoor roman tub, high ceilings, fireplaces - Private Entrances, Choice of Queen (The East Room) or Full bed with additional twin bed in loft (The Garden Room). Pet-friendly. We are very Green-conscious in all that we do.

The space
Located in beautiful Bonny Doon. Drive to Big Basin State Park, Henry Cowell trail head, UC campus, uncrowded north coast beaches (Davenport Landing tide pools), historic Felton (Roaring Camp RR) and a short walk from our door is Bonny Doon Ecological Preserve.

Guest access
You have a private room with Bath and Patio to yourselves. Enjoy the property's Verandah, native gardens and meadow. Birdwatch, Listen to Nature's Chorus, Jump on the Trampoline, and play Ping Pong.
neighborhood_overview: No sidewalks, but plenty of beautiful walks.  The "center" of our Neighborhood is the country school and church - the school bell chimes through the arbors on weekdays.  On Sunday Morning, the little Church bell calls. 2 mi walk to the Beauregard Vineyards and tasting room.  Close by Bonny Doon Ecological Reserve is 200 acres of both easy and challenging hikes.
host_about:
I am artistically inclined, in fact the property is my "canvas" -- I am very dedicated to living with respect for nature, and  admire brilliance wherever I  see it. I have worked with a jazz trio as a singer around Santa Cruz.  I love dogs for the amazing qualities they've developed through eons of living close to humankind.  I am married to Dale, and we have raised 3 children.  
-- I get a kick out of people having a good time at our place, interested in such a variety of things, coming together serendipitously at Redwood Croft.  Of course, quiet retreats are invited, too. This could be my motto:  "Stay open; Stay responsible."

name: Private Home - Capitola, California
description: Enjoy your December stay in a charming 1940's Spanish-style home just minutes walk from Capitola Beach and Capitola Village's many restaurants, shops, galleries, and cafes.  A 15-minute drive to Santa Cruz Beach and Boardwalk and downtown Santa Cruz's Pacific Avenue. Our moderate climate offers year-round activities and sports - surfing, kayaking, paddle boarding, cycling, hiking and long beach walks. Holiday season doesn't get much better!!
host_about: A resident of Santa Cruz County for 40 years, I love our great hiking trails, walking along the beach cliffs, and our amazing art and theatre community. I enjoy traveling internationally, especially in Spanish-speaking countries. And I’ve probably dined in every restaurant in the County so I’m happy to provide recommendations!

name: PrIvate Seabright Garden Apartment
description:
Beautiful quiet separate apartment with lovely patio, fruit trees and organic gardens. Fits two w/private full bath. Easy access to east/west cliff surf spots. 5 minutes to beaches, the wharf, harbor or downtown.

The space
The apartment has a private entrance and a full private bath. It is cozy! Measures about 180 square feet and is thoughtfully laid out. There is a closet to put your stuff and a fold out wall desk with two upholstered chairs. We don’t have a TV in the room but we do offer a strong dedicated Wi-Fi signal for guests so that you can stream movies on a laptop or iPad. There is a full size (double) bed with a BRAND NEW MEMORY FOAM MATTRESS made of natural latex, AND NEW BOX SPRINGS, new pillows, sheets and a down comforter. The bathroom is new and immaculately clean. The apartment has just been freshly painted with non- v.o.c. paint. There is a mini fridge, hot water kettle, and coffee or tea. Just outside the apartment door is a café table a
neighborhood_overview: This neighborhood is known as the banana belt because it's the sunniest spot in Santa Cruz!  We are located in easy walking distance from several great local restaurants like the Crepe Place (best place to see live music most nights of the week) and Lillian's (Italian restaurant, extremely popular).   There's also great sushi (Akira) and Thai food (Real Thai-delivers!).  It's a 5 minute walk to the Buttery Bakery (amazing pastries, coffee, brunch) and to Shopper's Corner grocery.  It's a quiet residential neighborhood but still with quick and easy access to beaches, boardwalk and downtown.
host_about: We love the outdoors, hiking, cycling and camping.   We are musicians and enjoy living in Santa Cruz with all the arts and music that it offers.

name: Case De Weeks
description:
The space
We have a new Construction as of 2013 solar powered 3 Bedroom 2 1/2 bath craftsman style house perfectly located in between Capitola and Santa Cruz.

Our listing is located right down the hill from the Chaminade Resort. If our house does not accommodate everyone in your party you have a resort within a mile for any additional guests.

Also we are only 2 miles away / five minute drive to the Harbor beaches as well as Capitola Village.

There are many wonderful hiking trails that are in close proximity.

We have a spacious dining area as well as charming breakfast nook.

Casa de weeks is stocked with the basic things that you would need. Laundry
detergent,shampoo, towels, fresh linens, ETC.

The kitchen is fully equipped and has everything you would need for entertaining. The outdoor patio is equipped with a gas grill & comfy chairs for relaxing!

We have a spacious master Suite located
host_about:
I am an electrician focused on renewable energies. My company W3 Solar focuses on the installation of solar electric "photovoltaic" Systems & 
Electric vehicle charging equipment. 

My wife Meredith and I were born and raised in North Carolina. We relocated to Santa Cruz, California 18 years ago. We have a six-year-old daughter named Ashby and we love living in Santa Cruz. 

We enjoy the beach, the mountains,hiking, biking, skiing, snowboarding, camping, art,music, domestic and international travel. Also spending as much downtime as possible with friends & family.

name: Peace and Quiet in the Mountains, Room B
description:
Unwind from a business week in SF or Silicon Valley. Arise from your queen bed to a sunny deck overlooking organic gardens, redwoods and mountains. Stroll to a giant redwood, the hidden treasure of our neighborhood. Rustic charm close to urban centers. Shared bath down the hall.

The space
We have several rooms in our home. This is "Room B". It is cozy, spacious with lots of light and a sliding door to a private deck. The full bathroom is shared and down the hall.
We are casual and rustic chic here in the Santa Cruz Mountains. Perched in the redwoods, our home is an architectural wonder built by our family of engineers and artists back in the eclectic seventies. Over the years an assemblage of art, antiques and curios has charmed its way into the spacious rooms and lofts. We offer 6 acres of quiet ambiance for guests and business travelers. Surrounded by redwoods and wildlife, our year round Organic Gardens provide robust greens for the Culinary Artist at
neighborhood_overview: You'll revel in quietness and the natural beauty of the mountains, 10 minutes to the beach, 1 hour to San Francisco. There are numerous hiking and biking trails in several state parks within 20 minutes. An old growth redwood is a mile stroll from the house. We are surrounded by trees and wildlife. Many of our neighbors have horses. The old stagecoach route from SF to Monterrey runs right through our property and the oldest bonded winery in California was started next door. We feel safe, and people are friendly. "Town" with great restaurants and conveniences is 4 miles away.
host_about:
HAPPY GUESTS MAKE ME HAPPY!
Label me a work in progress...
wearing many hats along the way...
one step at a time... 
Mother, grandmother, wife, educator, hostess with the most-est, yogini, artist,designer, world traveler, stand up comedian for first graders, proud member of the All In Good Time Ukulele Orchestra. 
I am a self taught home chef and have been growing organic food for over 30 years, love to cook and amaze my guests with gourmet cuisine featuring select produce from my terraced mountain garden. 
"You may call me a dreamer, but I'm not the only one."
Voss Gardens is now on (Hidden by Airbnb) !!  Our guests are sharing the magic @ #vossgardens

name: Escape to Paradise in the Redwoods!
description:
A charming, relaxed retreat in Boulder Creek; in the heart of the Santa Cruz Redwoods. This is the perfect place to call home base for adventures in the local forest hiking, biking, railroading, and zip lining. Only 30 minutes to Santa Cruz for beaches, surfing, shopping and the world famous Santa Cruz Beach Boardwalk. An hour and a few minutes more will have you at the Monterey Bay Acquarium, Carmel, Pebble Beach and on to Big Sur. San Francisco is just a little over an hour the other way.

The space
Treetop Haven is a large upstairs studio apartment with a private entrance. Sleeps four people comfortably with one Queen-sized bed and a futon couch that folds out into an over sized double bed. Visit our web (email hidden).

Private bathroom. All towels, wash cloths, soap, etc. furnished.

Mini-kitchen with fridge, sink, microwave, induction cooking burner, toaster and electric kettle. All cutlery, dishes, glasses, pans and kitchen towel
neighborhood_overview: We live in a developed, hill side neighborhood that has the rustic campiness of the woods.  Lots of unique properties around Boulder Creek.  It is a friendly, relaxed place to wander in.
host_about:
We are actually a couple - Jim & Judy.  We've lived in Boulder Creek for 16 years - just a couple of blocks from our daughter and her husband and our 2 grandsons!.  We are native Southern California and loved it there. Now we cannot imagine moving away from the Monterey Bay area, the Redwoods, and our proximity to both Monterey and Carmel as well as San Francisco and San  Jose.  When you visit us you'll see why we love it here.

We are meticulous hosts.  Your comfort and convenience are our primary focus.  The studio apartment is large, white glove clean, completely supplied and comfortable.  People rave about the beds up there!  We are available, friendly and "hands off" with our guests.  Children and pets are always welcome.  This is a perfect get-away from the city!

name: Eco Haven "Vista" private room
description:
Our house is powered by the sun! All aspects of it were designed to be ecological and beautiful at the same time. The Vista Room is 1 of 2 bedrooms downstairs. The bathroom is between the bedrooms. If both rooms are occupied, the bathroom is shared. We have a upstairs bathroom as backup when needed. Check with Airbnb on the Garden Room availability if the Vista Room calendar shows that it's full.

The space
The Eco Haven Vista Room has a queen-sized bed, refrigerator stocked with breakfast items, microwave oven and a coffee maker. Both bedrooms look over a canyon with lots of birds. A guest saw a Peregrine Falcon resting in the trees and we recently saw wild turkeys right outside the bedroom.

We don't have dogs or cats and we request that travelers do not have pets. We are sensitive to people's allergies

The house is on the end of a cul-de-sac with nothing but "sand islands" next to it. Sand islands are protected areas with 13 species o
neighborhood_overview:
Santa Cruz is a 20 minute drive. Kayak rentals and tours go all around the bay. From town, it just a short hike to the Lime Kilns and University of California. Near the border of Scotts Valley and Santa Cruz lies the Mystery Spot, where the rules of gravity are seemingly altered..

And, speaking of Santa Cruz County: Locals know that the Santa Cruz Mountains Appellation is one of the oldest wine-growing regions in the United States. Family-owned wineries here produce stellar lots of pinot and chardonnay, and the area has been compared to a younger Napa Valley. Near here are Hallcrest, Zayante and Beauregard Vineyard. Twenty minutes south of Santa Cruz, in a temperate valley of redwoods and olive groves, the Corralitos Wine Trail winds its way to Alfaro Family Vineyards, owned by a former artisan bread maker, and Windy Oaks Winery, with views of Monterey Bay. At the top of the Santa Cruz Mountains, the Summit to Sea Wine Trail passes Loma Prieta, a vineyard that produces the
host_about:
Roger is in the solar energy business.  Roger sold the business  but he is still active in a new venture.  I like photography, hiking, gardening and figuring out ways to do things differently.

Nancy's  has retired at the University of California (Santa Cruz). She wants to spend more time with the grandkids, doing water aerobics, visiting with friends and gardening.

name: Sunny room with deck near the beach
description:
The space
Your bedroom has a comfortable queen sized bed that sleeps two. There's a sliding door that opens to a private deck in the back yard, as well as a private bathroom with a tub and shower. Hear the ocean while you sleep! Close to Hwy. 1 bike route.
Please note below the county transient occupancy tax of 11%. This fee is separate from Airbnb fees and is now collected at the time of your booking (by Airbnb) and paid to SC County. Certificate number CO00238, County of Santa Cruz.

You'll have your own room and bathroom with tub and shower. There's a door that opens to a deck and back yard. Nearby is a park with a trail leading to the beach. In a few minutes you can walk to restaurants and to the resort that has a very nice bar (with live music sometimes) and restaurant.

You have access to the downstairs bedroom, bathroom and outside deck. Free parking on the street.
Your room includes coffee or tea and a continental breakfast.
neighborhood_overview: Proximity to the ocean and walking trails
host_about:
I'm a French and English teacher, with 2 grown kids and a husband.  Now that the kids are living elsewhere, we have room to welcome happy travelers.  I love to hike and bike in the area.  We enjoy the farmers' markets and produce stands, and I can safely say that my hobby is cooking, baking, collecting and making up recipes.  
When not working, I'm probably traveling.  The world is a big place, endlessly fascinating and worthy of the effort and expense it takes to experience it!
When home, we enjoy the local jazz scene; my husband sings jazz.

name: Spring Break Avail Ocean Front Family House
description:
Modern ocean front beach house on West Cliff has been a vacation rental for 20 years. Three bedrooms, 4th bedroom is on the detached garage. Sleep 8 people. Fully furnished with everything a home would have. Walk along West Cliff to the light house 1 mile south Natural Bridges. Owners live near by and are constantly up-keeping this property and making sure everything works inside the house for our guests.

The space
Ocen front House, 3 bedrooms in main house and a 4th bedroom attached to detached garage. The 4th bedroom has twin beds, a plug in heater and heating blankets. There are two bathrooms in the house. Includes everything a home would have. , the monthly rate of $6,500 applies to September through May.

Guest access
linear walking/bike ocean front path, Natural bridges beach is 1/2 mile north and the light house is 1 mile south.

Other things to note
Sleeps 8 people including kids. Host needs to know ages of y
neighborhood_overview: We are in a neighborhood with many of the ocean front homes being second homes to the owners.  There are wineries, bakeries and coffee shops and boutique shopping  in an industrial area about 1/2 mile away. Santa Cruz Beach Boardwalk is 2 miles south from this property. West Cliff has a linear walking path along the ocean for miles. Good people watching from this property.
host_about: tennis instructor, property manager for My ocean front vacation rentals on West Cliff Dr. Santa Cruz, CA, Kona Hawaii, Los Gatos, active, graduated from culinary  school A.S degree,  married to a awesome husband

name: Private room, bath and own entrance
description:
Private entrance, come and go as you please.
Come relax, work or play. In the heart of Scotts Valley walk to shops, restaurants, the park or public transport. This is a very comfortable private room on the ground floor with private bathroom (shower) & queen bed. Entrance through patio. Parking at this time is not on premises.

Note: The patio is a shared space, but the hot tub is not for the use of our AirBNB guests at this time. We may only use the patio/hot tub between the hours of 10a-7p.

The space
The room is located in a townhouse. It is on the ground floor with its own private bath and entrance. There is a mini fridge and microwave, bowls, coffee/tea mugs and spoons. The entry is private through French doors and the outdoor patio. You can come and go as you please without concern of disturbing us.

Guest access
Private entrance with access to bedroom, private bath, and patio only.

Other things to note
neighborhood_overview:
Scotts Valley is a really neat small town. It is a gateway to the Santa Cruz Mountains and Santa Cruz itself. We are conveniently located within short walking distance to restaurants, shops, and a movie theater.

We are a short walk, run, bike, or drive to Henry Cowell Redwoods State Park. It is actually less than 2 miles to a trail entrance off Graham Hill Rd.
Other area highlights:
Santa Cruz Beach Boardwalk......15mins
Wilder Ranch State Park.....18mins
Henry Cowell State Park Big Trees Entrance....9mins
Roaring Camp Railroad.....12mins
Big Basin State Park....36mins
host_about: My wife and I are nurses. We enjoy running, biking, hiking, and anything outdoors. We are pretty low key, but like to think we have fun! We really enjoy traveling. We spent half a year in South America, half a year in New Zealand, and a few months in Central America. We have also traveled quite a bit in the US.

name: Walk to the Beach From an Elegant Vacation Home With a BBQ
description: Enjoy a backyard patio oasis & hot tub for 6 —or discover a romantic table for 2 on a bedroom balcony. Wake up & cook a family breakfast in a chic gourmet kitchen. Push open stacking doors in good weather to double the main floor seating options.
neighborhood_overview: The house is in Santa Cruz, and is within a 3-block walk to the beach, Yacht Harbor, bars, and outdoor dining. Take walks on the beach, listen to seals playing in the harbor, build sand castles with the kids, and cruise East Cliff Drive on a bike.
host_about:
I purchased Casa de Alta Loma in 2013 as the fulfillment of a life-long dream to live close to a beautiful beach, in an environment that soothes the soul. I have lived in and around Santa Cruz for a decade now and finally decided on just the right spot (Live Oaks) and the perfect home (Alta Loma). I use it often and enjoy the environment tremendously.  For example, Stand Up Paddle in the harbor and out to sea is one of my favorite things to do - The SUP shack is minutes from my doorstep and if you're lucky, you'll see all sorts of marine life (whales too!). It's such a unique place - we even have a Saturday morning Ukelele sing-along down on the beach.  We usually get coffee at the Kind Grind (right there on the beach) and just listen.  My 4 yr. old niece has even played along with the crowd.  (Don't expect skilled musicians but do expect friendliness and old time sing-along songs.) We have a Live Oak Farmer's Market on Sunday which is fantastic too!

I love to entertain my friends and family from the East Coast at the beach house - they just cannot get over how idyllic life in Santa Cruz can be. I was born and raised outside of Boston, MA and relocated to the West Coast to work in the Software Industry. I hope you come enjoy Casa de Alta Loma and all it has to offer.
The location is ideal. You can hear the ocean, the sea lions, and the gulls but not the young neighboring renters who are right down on the beach.  It's a 3-5 minute walk to the harbor where you will find a favorite restaurant -- Johnny's Harborside.  It's a 5 minute walk to the beach which is wide and long. I often run the entire stretch from my beach down to the Santa Cruz Boardwalk all on the sand (at low tide!). It's about 13 minutes walk to the east entrance of the famous Santa Cruz Beach Boardwalk.
Driving gets you to a lot of popular destinations: E.g., Shadowbrook restaurant in Capitola is 3 miles away and SF and Big Sur are each about an hour and a half away, in opposite directions.

name: Fanti-Sea beach studio with a view!   OCEAN VIEW!!
description:
Amazing ocean view from King size bed, private fenced yard. Access to beach 6 to 8 blocks away, on Beachgate Way. This is a private studio on the first floor of a 3 story home. You have the entire backyard all to yourselves. It has all the amenities for your comfort. Close to everything. Unsurpassed, unimpeded panoramic, ocean, bay, cement ship & whitewater views! This home has been on the Annual Symphony League Home Tour two times, and the local newspaper called the Fanti-Sea house.

The space
Moments to Seacliff Village with famous Manuel's Mexican Restaurant, Marianne's Ice Cream, Hwy 1 Pizza Plus within a mile & so much more! Private backyard overlooking ocean. Not suitable for children.

Guest access
Unobstructed Panoramic views of the entire Monterey Bay from Santa Cruz to Monterey, from this private beach studio and private yard. The entire fenced yard is for your use only. There are no better views in Santa Cruz. Check out is at
neighborhood_overview: This is a great neighborhood for walking and bike riding. Lots of trails for hiking nearby. Beach access is on "Beachgate Way",  about 6 blocks down the street. You can park by the access stairs, or walk.  We have boogie boards for the ocean. This home has been on he Annual Symphony League Home Tour two times, and has been in the local newspaper, as the "Fanti-Sea House".  One of the most breathtaking Pacific Ocean views in Northern California. It makes you feel like you are on a cruise ship in the middle of the ocean, yet it is a short stroll to the steps that will lead you down to Seascape beach and the cement boat at the end of the pier.
host_about: I have lived in Santa Cruz County for over 40 years. Very active in sports.  I am licensed to care for foster children, and have been doing this for over 8 years.

name: Downtown Santa Cruz Adventure
description:
Open street level space with garden courtyard in the heart of downtown Santa Cruz. Our eclectic "clubhouse" is the perfect getaway to enjoy and explore the music, food and unique vibe that is The Pacific Garden Mall. Unit is set up for self check in.

The space
THE SPACE
Double check the address and description in the house manual if you book. It will help for a smooth self check in. Our manager lives on the property. Please be honest about the number of people in your group.

Our unit decor is always changing. We do not re photograph the unit after moving furniture, adding artwork or changing bedding style. We invite artists to draw on our walls. Please contact me if you see anything inappropriate that our team may have missed. Otherwise, the photos you see here are to give you an understanding and feel of our space.

PLEASE READ DESCRIPTION THOROUGHLY. THIS FLAT IS OUR SURF SHACK, IT IS AN OPEN STUDIO, IT IS BROKEN DOWN AND IN AN OLDER
neighborhood_overview: We LOVE downtown Santa Cruz! The farmers market is directly across the street every Wednesday afternoon along with a fantastic flea market the second Sunday of every month. The music venues at the Catalyst, Moe's Alley and Kuumbwa Jazz Center are legendary and diverse. The studio is 1/2 block off of Pacific Garden Mall the main street of this town and it is alive with movie theaters, shops, food, wine bars and street music galore.  The  Beach Boardwalk is 1 mile away with world class surfing all along the coast.
host_about: Coastal Californian. Lover of travel, design, art, music, film, garden, food and many other forms of creativity. We design and build for a living in Pacific Grove between Monterey and Carmel. Weekends are spent hiking in Big Sur or Marin, exploring San Francisco, surfing in Santa Cruz and annual trips to the Sawtooth mountains in Idaho to ride Peruvian Paso's with family friends. Hard work pays off.

name: The Joy of Coastal Mountain Living!
description:
Plush 2-Bedroom Cottage in the Santa Cruz Mountains, with beautiful gardens and private patio/BBQ, wood burning stove, full kitchen, cozy dining and living rooms. Surrounded by forests, orchard, meadows and a pond. Near winery, parks.

The space
Enjoy healthy mountain living in a park-like setting -- ten acres of native forests, meadows, a beautiful garden and a pond! Relax in our charming two bedroom cottage, with a newly-remodeled, fully equipped kitchen, two comfortable bedrooms (one with queen sized bed, the other with two twins), a new bathroom with shower, and cozy living and dining rooms. We provide linen on the beds and four sets of towels.

You get your own private garden patio next to the forest, with gas BBQ and 6-seat outdoor table. Your entrance is a nice new porch with rocking chair.

Our water is tested clean -- delicious well water from our property.

For our cool mountain nights we can heat the cottage using
neighborhood_overview:
We are next door to the tasting room for a good local winery, and there are many more wineries in the area. 1 mile up the road is an ecological preserve with great hiking. It is 3 miles down the mountain to a nice beach. The roads around us don't have a lot of cars so the area is great for bicycling. Go north on Highway One and you are at Davenport, an old whaling town with a nice restaurant and another nice beach. Just further north on the coast is Ano Nuevo State Park, where the giant elephant seals raise their babies on the beach each spring. Also close by are Big Basin State Park (with old growth redwoods), Henry Cowell State Park and many other great parks.

And of course, we are only 13 miles north of the wonderful town of Santa Cruz.
host_about:
Hi, I'm Howard, the owner of the property.  My day job is investing in technology, and I do a lot of consulting business in China.  But my wife and I also have a magical place in the Santa Cruz mountains, amongst the redwoods, next to a great winery, and only 3 miles from the beach.   We have our own pond, and we have surrounded ourselves with fruit trees and floral gardens, which we hope you will enjoy.  When we are not around, our caretaker, Ed Olson, takes care of our guests.  

We hope to create a Shangri-la feel for our guests.  Totally relaxed in the mountains and nature, but with all the comforts of home.  We are also frequent travelers, so we know how important it is to feel at home when staying in new accomodations.

name: Christine's Cottage
description:
Christine's Cottage is a cozy and very quiet space. It is 1.3 miles from the ocean and has a queen-sized bed, full bath, small but full kitchen, patio and a private entrance. Strong Wi-fi, Directv and Netflix streaming service are included - and dogs are welcome!

The space
Everything here has been upgraded for your convenience and comfort.

The queen-sized bed includes cotton bedding and extra pillows and blankets.

There is an armoire to hang and store clothes, shoes, etc.

The setee expands to lounge or sleep.

There is a flat screen HDTV equipped with DirectTV and streaming Netflix through DVD player.

The small kitchen is well equipped and has filtered water, a Nespresso machine, coffee maker, toaster, microwave, sink, oven and burners. Dishes, glasses, utensils, linens and cleaning supplies are provided.

The kitchen will be stocked for your convenience with coffee, tea, milk, sugar, spi
neighborhood_overview: The studio is in a beachy, residential neighborhood 1.3 miles from Pleasure Point and 1.3 miles from the Capitola beach.  You can easily walk several blocks to Trader Joe's, Target, Whole Foods and other local shops and cafes.

name: Private Getaway Beach Cottage
description:
This bright and cheery studio cottage is a great getaway escape for Santa Cruz. Perfect for couples or singles, steps from the Yacht Harbor and Twin Lakes beach. Spacious back deck and hot tub (shared) available for your enjoyment as well. Come stay with us!

The space
The studio cottage is set back beyond a private decked yard and feels like an oasis of sunshine in an already quiet and peaceful part of Santa Cruz. Light streams through the skylights and you have everything you need to stay and enjoy the beach and surroundings for a while.

Santa Cruz County Approved Vacation Rental Certificate number: CO00265

Guest access
Cottage guests have access to a great backyard oasis complete with hot tub, dining, and BBQ facilities. The space is shared with the main house or owner.
neighborhood_overview:
The house is a 5 minute walk to the beach. A 3 minute walk to the Yacht Harbor (or less!) and a 5 minute walk to the Crow's Nest (restaurant, bar, great outdoor dining), Palomar (mexican bar & restaurant), Kind Grind (coffee), and Johnnys (great seafood restaurant). Aldo's restaurant is a fun, free boat ride across to the other side of the harbor. Probably takes 10 mins.

We are about a 15-20 min stroll to the Beach Boardwalk over some lovely sea walls and bridges.
It takes about 10 mins (1 mile) to get to the Seabright Brewery and restaurants on Seabright Ave. There is a pizza place, Italian pasta place, and adorable cafe over there on Seabright.
The house is also a 4 min walk (or less) to Harbor Cafe which is a great place for brunch and mimosas.

name: Hidden Treasure Surf Shack Near Lighthouse Field
description:
Take an early morning stroll and enjoy the cool breeze at the Lighthouse State Beach Park. Wander around by the Santa Cruz Wharf or Beach Boardwalk, then head back for a morning coffee at this urban-chic shack with a suspended loft bedroom.

The space
Why don't you take a break and unwind at this stunning cottage close to the beach? The house was lovingly built with stoned floors, high-beamed ceilings and rustic details for a charming ambiance.

The loft bedroom was designed to give a cozy feel with a little star gazing activity at night! The house is located near a Lighthouse Point and Field State Beach, a locals-only spot with unspoiled beauty. Explore the nearby Beach Boardwalk with warm sand and cool surf and Santa Cruz Wharf known for fishing, boat tours, viewing sea lions and gift shops.

Although Downtown is only a five-minute drive, the area feels peaceful and secluded.

Guest access
Feel the exclusivity of the p
neighborhood_overview:
Neighborhood is just great! Nice and peaceful. Neighbors have their own private front yards. You'll see neighbors walking their dogs or see them bicycling.

Conveniently located close to downtown and tourists spots!

We are located minutes from the UCSC campus as well! We have plenty of parks nearby, beaches and trails.
host_about:
I am easy going and friendly.  I love to play, cook, travel, hang with my family and spend time outdoors.

When I travel I have loved staying at other peoples "casitas" seeing and learning how others live.  I think it's the best way to see what the town has to offer.  There's nothing better than getting information from a local!

I live in the main house with my husband and 2 kids.  We are very respectful of you and your space, and require the same from our guests.  We are often outside playing and enjoying the day.  

We look forward to meeting you!

name: Coastal Mountain Recharge
description:
Our large sunny studio is in the Santa Cruz mountains above Hwy 1. Opt for a quiet weekend on the property or venture out for easy access to wine tasting, biking, hiking, surfing or playing on the rugged north county beaches.

The space
Each day as we drive up the mountain to our home we feel the rest of the world slipping away. If you are looking to get away to a quiet, rural location where you can easily access trails for riding or hiking, north coast beaches, wine tasting and dining - this is your spot. We live on a 1.5 acre property that is open and sunny, at the edge of the redwood forest. The studio you will be staying in has it's own access and is over 450 square feet.

The studio is heated and contains:
• King size bed
• Full bathroom
• Futon couch - not suitable for sleeping
• TV & DVD player - no cable
• WiFi
• Closets & dresser for clothes storage
• Dining table and chairs for two
• Small ref
neighborhood_overview:
We live in a small rural neighborhood where all of the lots are at least 1 acre. At night don't be surprised to hear coyotes or owls, and when it's clear with no moon the stars are bright and you can see the Milky Way. The neighborhood is quiet, and we ask our guests to be respectful of the quiet and the overall environment.

Our larger neighborhood includes Davenport and many beautiful and rugged beaches along Highway 1. If you would like to hear about local hikes and beaches please ask us.

Easy access to State Parks:
• Fall Creek ~5 minutes
• Coast Dairies ~10 minutes
• Wilder Ranch ~15 minutes
• Big Basin (Waddell Beach) ~20 minutes
• Ano Nuevo - under 25 minutes
host_about:
We are a multi-generational family that loves cooking, gardening, surfing, hiking, biking and playing at the beach.  Favorite travel destinations include: Big Sur, Pt. Reyes National Seashore, Yosemite, Vietnam, Thailand, Italy.  A couple of favored authors: Steinbeck, Tom Robbins  A few favorite musicians: Tom Waits, Bjork, Neil Young, 

We are a social family but are also respectful of quiet and privacy. We think we live in a beautiful area and would be happy to share it with others.

name: Santa Cruz Simple - Queen
description:
Just one and a half miles from East side beaches and Capitola village, a quiet home nestled in a culdesac. There is a shared bathroom in the hallway.

The space
My home is a sweet place to stay. It is a comfortable, clean, homey visit in Santa Cruz. The location lends itself to easy and quick access to many sweet spots in Santa Cruz and Capitola. I enjoy the patio in the backyard on mild mornings and it 's especially enjoyable on summer evenings. UCSC is a little farther away, approximately 20 - 25 minutes without traffic.

Guest access
Please be prepared to share the bathroom.

Check-in during week nights is after 5 pm due to my work schedule. Sometimes I can provide flexibility with advanced notice.
neighborhood_overview: My neighborhood is quiet. And I love that I am located with easy access to Eastside and Capitila Village. The house is located about 5 miles from downtown Santa Cruz.
host_about:
I enjoy the outdoors in my free moments - presently hiking and the beach. I have a sweet pup who will try to make friends with you if you come to my place. I love travel!!! I'd really like to spend more in Europe, but for present my travel includes going to see my three young adult/teenage children who have all moved away in the last year and a half. 

As a host,  I will make myself available if possible and alternatively can easily disappear if you just want solitude. I understand travel can be some of both!

name: Sunny redwood forest cottage
description:
Located in Ben Lomond half way between Big Basin State Park and Santa Cruz Beach Boardwalk, our redwood forest cottage has a queen bed in the bedroom and a double Murphy bed in the living room. Jacuzzi and outdoor shower available. Dining on deck for up to 10. Beautiful & tranquil.

The space
20 mins to the beach, approx 1.5 hr south of San Francisco and 1 hr to the Monterey Peninsula.
sits among a California redwood forest with a fully equipped modern kitchen and outdoor picnic tables

Guest access
Jacuzzi and outdoor shower, TV, wifi access,laundry, 2 BBQ, fire pit, children's swing set, redwood tree hammock 🙂

Other things to note
Since this property is in the redwoods, be careful of the sometimes uneven walkways. The driveway curves, so caution is recommended when backing down to the road.
neighborhood_overview: Surrounded by many beautiful redwood trees with a sunny private back yard.
host_about: I am a  retired RN who owns a little vacation home in Ben Lomond. It is a small town in the Santa Cruz mountains a few miles away from Santa Cruz beach and boardwalk.  I love the redwoods that surround my little cottage and relish the tranquility and peace they provide.  My family visits Ben Lomond quite often and now I’d like to share the pleasure with others.

name: Cozy guest room in Zen Eco-Cottage
description:
I have a spare room in my 2 bedroom, 1 bathroom cottage home available during the summer months. We had dogs that once lived here so not an allergy free home. I am friendly and super clean. Come hang out!

The space
I have a small cozy cottage/stand alone condo about 1 mile from the beach in a nice part of town. One shared bathroom that has recently been remodeled. There is a nice roomy kitchen that is fully stocked that has also been remodeled and a comfortable living room with lazy boy recliners to hang out in. The home will be shared with myself while my husband is away working his summer job. I am preferably looking for a single female guest to share my space with. I may consider couples if for a short term stay. NEW HOT TUB!!!! Propane fire table and very relaxing outdoor space with tiki bar and water fountain.

Guest access
I have some extra bikes that guests can have access to by request. Guests will have access to the whole ho
neighborhood_overview: We do live on a pretty busy street but we have created our own little oasis for our comfort and pleasure.  Our side patio area is brand new and a sunny and beautiful space to hang out in.  There is a tiki bar, gas fire pit and hammock to relax and enjoy.  We are hoping to get a hot tub soon as well (and may even have it by the time you book). Ear plugs provided for sleeping.
host_about:
Hi! I am Dee and I’ve and married to my wonderful husband, Daniel, for the past 12 years.  We have new a beautiful and sweet 1 year old Border Collie mix.  By day, I work part time as a registered vet tech for the veterinary dermatologist and I run my own home pet care business and my husband teaches environmental science to 5th and 6th graders in the Santa Cruz mountains.  During our free time, together we enjoy traveling, snow boarding, rock climbing, scuba diving, music festivals and camping.  My biggest passion in life is horseback riding and I enjoy meditation, being in nature and learning how to be a better me.  My husband is a die hard surfer who also enjoys working in the garden and relaxing in his hammock while listening to reggae tunes.  We are both very passionate about the environment and doing our part to reduce our footprint on this planet. 
 We love traveling and seeing the world and we make an effort to travel out of the county as often as possible.  We have been to places such as Indonesia, Thailand, Malaysia, Costa Rica, Panama, Nicaragua, Hawaii, Europe, Philippines and Sri Lanka and upcoming New Zealand.   When we travel, we travel without any specific agenda and let life guide us to where we belong.  All we need is our trusty Lonely Planet guide book and we find ourselves at great hostels and air bnbs where like minded travelers gather to share stories and experiences.  We enjoy good company and fun positive people that inspire us to become better individuals.  We are fortunate in where we live and the beautiful home we live in and we would be blessed to share it with others while we are out on our own life adventures.  Our motto in life: "Find what you love and love what you find."  -Namaste

The space
The home comes fully furnished with towels, linens, dishes, kitchen supplies, furnishings. Master bedroom with new Cal King and daybed w/trundle (acts as a sofa/sitting area if extra beds aren't required) and attached master bath (Master bedroom can sleep 4). Guest access

Ot
neighborhood_overview: The Beach Hill neighborhood is made up of many beautiful homes and is often considered one of the nicest areas in Santa Cruz. It is a quiet hill, but has walking access to many of the attractions Santa Cruz offers.
host_about: Hey I’m Laura- I was born and raised in the San Fransisco Bay Area... when I’m not traveling I enjoy living between Santa Cruz and San Jose with my daughter, husband, and our two pups Dutchy and Ruffles. I'm an avid tango dancer, party planner and am always on the lookout for the next real estate purchase. I’m a third-generation real estate investor and I love the opportunity to host and engage with guests from around the world.

name: Spectacular Aptos Home / Steps From Beach / Clean!
description:
Come spend Presidents Day & Valentine's in our "Casita", located in a private neighborhood close to Rio Del Mar, near Aptos Creek. We know you'll enjoy the home's quiet neighborhood, quality construction, amenities and the delightful 5-minute walk to the beach. Shops, restaurants, entertainment, sightseeing and hiking are all nearby. The house is free of personal belongings and clutter. Thanks!

The space
There are several properties to choose from in Aptos, however few are nicer than ours... You will love with the home's timeless charm, and quickly realize that our neighborhood is truly a very special spot. We eagerly anticipate helping you create wonderful memories on your next Aptos extended stay or vacation!

If you're looking for a knock-around, indestructible, beach house rental - please look elsewhere. However if you are interested in a nicely furnished guest-home then we hope that you will consider our listing! We don't want to sound
neighborhood_overview: We love the location of our home.  It's part of a small group 35 - 40 homes that are very private, yet close to everything that makes Aptos and Rio del Mar so special!  We have gotten to know and enjoy our neighbors, both full time and seasonal, and most of the year the area is extremely quiet - while summer's a bit more active and count on the 4th of July as being full of booms and bangs (but don't miss community breakfast followed by worlds' smallest parade).
host_about: We are Scott and Andrea and have been Walnut Creek residents for almost 35 years, and we love our City!  Scott's a semi-retired General Contractor who specializes in construction of new homes; Andrea is a retired Cal State East Bay professor.  We both love to travel (most recent big trip was in 2019 to England, Ireland and Scotland) and we enjoy piloting our own plane to various stateside destinations.  We have been actively involved in residential real estate for over 40 years, and we've had a great time making both our Aptos Vacation Home and Walnut Creek Studio Cottage available to Airbnb guests for many years.  Our motto: "What's important in creating the perfect visitor experience?"  Answer: EVERYTHING!  We strive to make all guests feel comfortable and as if they are a welcomed part of the neighborhood.

description:
3 BEDROOM, 2 bath, comfortable home in small quiet neighborhood. Woodsy feel, surrounded by mature oaks, yet only 3 blocks to Rio del Mar beach. Enjoy a large deck off open living room/kitchen, with gas grill and wood burning fire pit.

The downstairs bedroom is more of a den in that it does not have a door on it. It does have a blackout drape for privacy.
It has a trundle bed which is 2 twins which can be raised to the same level or not.
host_about:
We've literally grown up with this house.  Originally purchased by our parents in the early 60s, we were lucky enough to have it passed on to us.  We love the beach, and all share in the house's use and upkeep.  Since a recent remodel, we enjoy it more than ever.   Our small neighborhood is wonderfully quiet and only 3 short blocks to the beach.

We hope you enjoy it as much as we do.

name: The Cowgirl Room at FlipJack Ranch
description:
An exclusive BnB restricted to just six guests! A place where you can unwind away from it all. The Cowgirl room is our most private room and features a private patio, luxurious king bed, corner gas fireplace, mini fridge, and ensuite bath. Let us pamper you with fresh flowers and homemade brownies. Bask in the hot tub under the stars, or toast marshmallows at the campfire circle, then wake up to a coffee tray delivered right to your room! Savor a farm to table breakfast , relax in rustic luxury.

The space
We have high hygiene standards at our very small 4 room BnB. In response to COVID-19, we are following best practices of increased cleaning and disinfecting from the CDC, Santa Cruz Health Department and the California Hotel and Lodging Association. We use approved CDC cleaners and steam sanitization of soft goods like pillows and comforters. Public spaces are disinfected frequently during the day. Guestrooms and entries are widely separated and breakfast servic
neighborhood_overview: Historic Bonny Doon (Santa Cruz Mountains) is a sleepy rural mountain village set among redwoods, wineries and pastures. Some of the best beaches in California are just three miles away. Enjoy the peace and quiet, or drive to civilization just 3 miles away.
host_about:
My love of food, cooking, wine and art has lead me on a lifelong journey. Years ago, I was a restauranteur in Chicago, then a full time studio potter, then a career in corporate sales and marketing.

I've traveled extensively, usually on a quest to find indigenous, traditional regional foods. Desert beans in India, grilled squid from a street vendor in Hong Kong, fresh rambutan in Thailand, black mole in Mexico, and hay soup in Austria are just a few memorable tastes. I am inspired by these experiences and I cook with international flavors.

A few years ago, I began to dream about having a farm where I could produce more of the foods, meats, and wines that I love. That dream came true when we bought FlipJack Ranch. Ranch life suits me, waking up to gather fresh eggs, cuddling the baby chicks and baby bunnies,  walking out to see the garden with a cup of coffee in hand. The whole 'farm to table' thing is real here on the ranch and the sustainable, organic and free range food products are my inspiration for daily menus. I love to forage too, here or nearby,  bringing back mushrooms, salad greens or mussels for the table. 

As a traveler myself, I value warm hospitality and those little things that make a stay memorable. I love it when I can go to a place and just unwind, assured that everything is there and I can just relax. I hope to make your stay with us memorable.

name: Sunny Cove BEACH house! Starbucks, WiFi, kid fun!
description:
*6 adults+4 kids Max. NO Parties, NO PETS & NO Smoking anywhere on property! (Owner allergic, no exceptions). 100 yds to beach! Family friendly, comfortable 1500sq.ft home: 2 BR + "3rd" BR/liv rm w/ pocket doors close for a 3rd BR. 2 full baths, hot outdoor shower, WIFI, TV (Family and both bedrooms), gas/charcoal bbqs, game room, beach toys!

The space
Sunny Cove beach 100 yards from front door! "Ansel's Getaway" 2 bdrm 2 ba , 1 bonus rm/bd. Great family home beautiful, relaxing neighborhood between Capitola and SC Boardwalk.
WALK to several beaches, Starbucks, restaurants, East Cliff microbrewery, Sunday Farmers’ Market, mini mart and the gourmet deli.
**1 week minimum peak season / holidays.
**Add additional 11% SC county tax, to be added in special.
This is NOT a party house. Quiet neighborhood with full time residents that call sheriff if loud parties taking place.

Beach house on same block as Sunny Cove beach! located
neighborhood_overview: Sunny Cove beach is located in the Santa Maria Cliffs neighborhood in the Live Oak area of Santa Cruz.  It is one of the best neighborhoods in Santa Cruz!  Many full time residents make it quiet with beautiful, well - maintained homes.  STARBUCKS just opened around the corner, there is a great Sunday Farmer's Market across the street, several good restaurants in walking distance.  New, gourmet mini mart / cafe "Black's Point" just two streets away.
host_about:
Beach home owned by three families that love the Santa Cruz community,  water sports, and all the wonders the ocean has to offer!

We wish we lived here full time but work has us anchored to the other side of the hill for now.   When time allows, we are lucky enough to call this a home away from home.  We enjoy surfing, boogie boarding, sailing, fishing, and just relaxing at the beach with our families.

FUN History:  The house was nicknamed  "Ansel's Getaway" as ANSEL ADAMS was friends with the original owner of the home, John Bei.  Ansel and John would hang out in the basement smoking cigars and discussing leather tanning projects.  At the time, Ansel and John worked together at a local leather tannery shop creating camera cases of course!  According to the Bei grandchildren, Ansel was quite a character and a frequent visitor of the home.  

We have had a few artists visit Ansel's Getaway that have been artistically inspired during their stay.  Their work is displayed at the beach house.

name: Seabright Contemporary Studio
description:
Immaculate furnished 500 square foot independent studio. Queen sized bed. Hardwood floors, clerestory windows. Full kitchen with 18" dishwasher. NO disposal. Near Harbor and Seabright Restaurants. Bath has shower only. No pets or smokers. Ten day minimum.

The space
This wonderful open space is filled with light. There is a full stereo system with a tail for an iPod. The furniture is modern and contemporary. The house is a short distance from the back of the harbor and has a private patio with French Bistro table and chairs.

There is no longer a garage available for bike storage. There is an area under an awning where guests can store a bike or surfboard. This is a high theft area for portable objects, but we have not had a problem with this.

If you read the reviews, you will see that during the months of August and September 2019 there was construction going on. That construction is completed now.

Guest access
The c
neighborhood_overview:
My neighborhood is quiet and surprisingly, at the back of the yacht harbor which is six blocks away. There are great local restaurants, bakeries and shops as well as the Rio Theater nearby. There is even a Roller Rink, which also has Jazzercise. Pacific Cultural Center is two blocks away, with Yoga and Feldenkrais classes available. The “Bicycle Trip “bike shop rents bicycles and is near by. It is easy to get to downtown, and everything is close by bike. We are not far from eight art movie screens and there are an additional 13 movie screens in town. The Rio Theater and Crepe Place have live music and are a short walk away! The Kuumbwa Jazz club downtown presents world class acts.

DO not leave valuables in your car...there is a lot of pedestrian traffic and you don’t want to invite theft!
host_about:
I love to garden, travel and enjoy good food. I love music ( our local Jazz club, the Kuumbwa is amazing!)  I am also a dancer, and love to move in many ways. Paris, Prague, London, Florence and Sienna are favorite places abroad, NYC , Portland, Nashville are good in the States.

As a hostess, I am pretty hands off... will love to show you on a map, our local farmer's markets, where the good local restaurants are and how to walk to the harbor ( four blocks from the house) and beach. I like things clean and simple; prefer the outdoors or a big city. There is no TV in the house, but a great sound system...I speak French fluently, can get by, barely, in German, Italian and Spanish.

description:
About a two-minute walk to the Santa Cruz Main Beach, Wharf, volleyball courts and Boardwalk. 8-minute walk to fabulous downtown for shopping and dining. Make memories in this roomy, light and bright 1887 Historical Landmark Victorian. This is an upper level flat with a separate unit below. Wifi, beach towels, boogie boards and games add to the fun. Follow us on Instagram @santacruzbeachvictorian.

City of Santa Cruz Permit Number: STR 18 - 0280

The space
1887 Victorian Historical Landmark on Beach Hill. Beautiful 4br/2ba that is the UPPER LEVEL flat of an Eastlake style DUPLEX. There are full-time tenants in the flat below.

Approximately nineteen-hundred square feet of space. Multiple hand blown original glass bay windows, very bright and cheery. Lovely hardwood floors throughout. Beautiful trim details, doors, original hardware, amazing chandeliers, fantastic deck etc. See it on the cover of “The Sidewalk Companion to Santa Cruz Architec
neighborhood_overview: So close to everything that is going on! Free movies on the beach Wednesday nights and free concerts on Friday nights. You are close to great restaurants, casual or fancy and fun shopping abounds.  Of course all ages will love fun on the beach and the famous Santa Cruz Beach Boardwalk.
host_about: Our family likes to travel and we hope that you have a lot of fun at our beach house!

description:
Sweeping ocean views of the entire beach from a sun drenched deck. Just a short walk to the beach. Remodeled single level 2 BR/2 BA condo. Travertine tiled floors, granite counters and fabulous lighting throughout.

The space
Floor to ceiling windows in the living room leads to a deck with spectacular ocean view and a vast, luminous sky. Modern and comfortable living and dining areas, a fully-equipped kitchen, and two full baths. Large Flat screen HD TV with DVD Player and Surround Sound in living room with HD TV in the master bedroom.

Rancho Del Mar Shopping Center, close by, has shops, pizza, ice cream, many restaurants, grocery store, movies, and gas station
host_about:
Hi I am Sundeep and I live in San Francisco. I am always terrible with these describe yourself things but I enjoy traveling, watching sports, beer tasting and meeting new people. 

My favorite travel destination is Germany but I also like those friendly Canadians and the next place on my travel wishlist is Thailand as I love Thai food. I also enjoy being near water specifically the beach and hearing the crashing of the waves. 

I would make a great host because professionally I work in real estate and know how to manage my properties and make my residents be it short or long term happy. I also love food and am always willing to give a dining recommendation.

My life motto can be summed up in this quote about positivity;

Success is failure turned inside out–
The silver tint of the clouds of doubt,
And you never can tell how close you are,
It may be near when it seems so far;
So stick to the fight when you’re hardest hit–
It’s when things seem worst that you must not quit.

Fully equipped kitchen,bikes,up to 4 max

Spacious one bedroom house- sleeps 4, only one mile from the beach, harbor, boardwalk & UCSC...Ideal for small families, or couples retreat.
COMPLETELY private from main house, separate entrance.

1 large master bedroom with full bath and walk-in closet, high ceilings.

Extremely comfortable twin bed.

Apple TV in master bedroom.

Living room:
Extremely comfortable futon...opens into a full size bed.
Full size couch(non-pul
neighborhood_overview:
Our Seabright neighborhood is a very quiet residential area. We have a small park 1/2 block away from our home, great for kids, and pups!
We also have a legal off-leash dog park, Frederick Street Park, less than 1 mile walk away. The park is right above the harbor, and provides a very large fenced in open space for lots of pups!

We are only 1 mile to the harbor, Seabright beach, the Santa Cruz Beach Boardwalk, and UCSC. Arana Gulch, a 40 acre open space is only blocks away, walk it or ride on the bike path, over to the Harbor, Crows Nest, the beach!
FUN!
We've got an assortment of great grocery stores within walking distance, and lots of yummy restaurants.(Staff of Life, Whole Foods, Shoppers Corner..and there is also Safeway and Grocery Outlet)
The Buttery (yum!) is within a mile away, as is the Seabright brewery, Akira sushi (3 blocks away!)La Posta Italian restaurant, Tramonte..delicious pizza, Lillians Italian Kitchen, Linda's Seabreeze Cafe (breakfas
host_about:
My life motto is CARPE DIEM!
Life is too short, we must embrace one another, eat well, live well, and play hard!!!
I love to create! Metalsmithing, watercolor painting, and photography. I'm a huge dog lover, hike everyday, we have the good fortune to live here in paradise.
I also enjoy traveling to Hawaii, Alaska, Europe, and anywhere I can go!!!!
We love to cook and entertain.. The ocean is my sanctuary, and I visit it almost everyday.
If I'm not at the ocean, I'm in the redwoods, hiking a trail, and enjoying the peace and beauty of nature.
Since I've become a host with AIRBNB, I've been honored to meet amazing people, and many I now consider friends.
It's an honor to host, and I'm always looking forward to meeting my next guest!

name: La Selva Beach Getaway
description:
Manresa /La Selva Beach Getaway 3 Bedroom, 2 1⁄2 Bath Town-home
A short walk to the beach, this 2300 sq/ft home features ocean views from the large outside deck,and main floor
Tennis courts on the property, heated pool, and hot tub located in the community for guest use.

Close proximity to Seascape Resort, Capitola,Aptos, Santa Cruz, and the Boardwalk. Short drive to Carmel, Monterey Aquarium, Pebble Beach, 17 mile Dr.

The space
- Ocean views from the 500 sq/ft large outside deck
- Tennis courts, pool, and hot tub located in the complex for guest use.
-Large living room and family room with, flat screen tv. and amazing ocean views.
-Large gourmet kitchen, fully equipped with everything necessary
- Seated bar (for 2) and dining room table (for 6)
- BBQ and 2 tables on outside deck. 10+
- All bedrooms are located on the lower floor.
- Sleeps 6 in beds...plenty of room for bags and blow ups...max of 10 t
neighborhood_overview: Our home is located in a small community known as  Cañon del Sol. There are 98 units, and ours is a luxury end unit (often noted as the best unit in the complex by our neighbors). The complex has private Tennis, Pool, and Spa facilities accessible by a provided key. Hours are 9am-10pm.
host_about:
My wife Renee and I enjoy travel. We travel within California, Hawaii and Europe most years. Like many we enjoy the charm of smaller places off the beaten path, and really enjoy gaining the local knowledge from our hosts.
We have a daughter who works in San Francisco and a son in college.
We have decided to share our beach house with others after seeing so many wonderful weeks missed due to our busy lifestyle.  
We will be happy to help you learn about the area prior to your visit.
neighbourhood: La Selva Beach, California, United States

name: Sunshiny Moments Retreat
description:
Your rooms are sheltered under magnificent redwoods on a quiet street beside a creek in the San Lorenzo River Valley. Your private bedroom and bathroom are original to this 1949 mid-century modern split-level home.

The space
Only 1/2 hour to Santa Cruz beaches, in a single day you can frolic in the waves at Big Sur, enjoy the splendor of the Monterey, Santa Cruz and San Mateo coastline and then retreat to the redwoods to enjoy our quiet, small town hospitality.

We are only 1 hour from Levi Stadium for Super Bowl 50 in 2016 and Silicon Valley. If you're interested in visiting San Francisco, allow 2 hours to drive up the coast or along the top of the Coastal Range.

Your bedroom includes a queen-size bed, picture window framing redwoods, an antique tri-mirror vanity, comfy seating, built-in closet and drawers.

Your bathroom has original 1949 cabinetry and fixtures---except for the updated shower head and a low-flow toilet, to help w
neighborhood_overview: Walking is a favorite past time with our neighbors, since our lane doesn't have much vehicle traffic. We are a short 15 minute walk from the restaurants, antique stores, spas and more in downtown Boulder Creek.
host_about:
Privileged to live in one of the rare places on Earth, I enjoy sharing Sunshiny Moments Retreat and local information with travelers. Our Santa Cruz mountains are filled with unique critters, wondrous beauty and California history. 

Snickers (the cat) and I enjoy hosting travelers---those interested in really being in new places---and providing a quiet retreat from bustling journeys.

name: Quiet oceanside condominium
description:
This condominium is a fully furnished, 2 bedroom, 2 bath apartment in a quiet complex walking distance from the ocean. The second smaller bedroom is not part of this rental, and is my private space. This is a peaceful, sunny home, with wonderful neighbors and a patio for out door dining. My condominium complex requires a minimum of a 30 day stay. I often travel when someone books my home, so you will have private access to the entire condo for yourself, excluding my smaller bedroom.

The space
This is a 2 bedroom, 2 bath condo on the second floor of a quiet condominium. The second smaller bedroom is my private bedroom, and is not offered as part of this rental agreement. Due to the CC&R restrictions for this condominium, guests can only be accommodated for a minimum of 30 days. My condominium association requires that I give them the name(s) of anyone staying in my home, and that by booking here, you agree to abide by the CC&Rs of this condominium. (Document p
neighborhood_overview: My condo has a wonderful location on the Westside of Santa Cruz.  It is in walking distance to restaurants, coffee shops, a stellar organic market, wine tasting and the ocean.   It is also only a 5-7 minute drive to the heart of Santa Cruz. It is a 10 minute drive to the University of California at Santa Cruz.
host_about: I am a high school science teacher in a Waldorf School, and teach yoga on the weekends.  I also play music and love to garden.  I am a world traveler who has spent a lot of time in India and Nepal. My home is a sanctuary and I hope you will treat it as such.  It is a quiet and peaceful place, near to all the fun that Santa Cruz offers. I am trusting and hope to share my home with responsible, honest and friendly folk. If I am your host, you will have a private and very comfortable stay.  Please call me if you have an questions!

name: Aptos Forest Retreat with Hot Tub & Breakfast
description:
If you want to stay longer than 2 nights send me a request and I will open my calendar. Currently I only have weekends open.

Our studio features a stone patio & hummingbird garden with a hot tub, fire bowl & bbq upon request. Guests have both a private entrance & private bathroom. There will be no shared spaces. This is a hosted rental, we will be home when our guests visit. Thank you, happy travels!

The space
We are off the beaten path, centrally located in the Monterey Bay & only 15 minutes from Rt. 1. A continental breakfast is provided for two guests their first morning. Enjoy the patio seating areas surrounded by granite rock walls, views of the redwoods and salvia gardens frequented by hummingbirds.

The private bathroom has a skylight, combined shower and bath tub, plenty of fluffy towels, and all the necessary toiletries. The view from studio is of towering trees, hillside gardens and guests will hear the natural sounds of life in t
neighborhood_overview:
Our home is located in Mangels Gulch next to Nisene Marks Park, our home is in the woods facing south with plenty of sun exposure. You will feel as if you are miles away from the rush of life. In reality, you will only be two miles from the Village of Aptos, where you will find a few interesting shops, cafes and a variety of restaurants. You can also walk out your door and be surrounded by coastal redwoods!

You may notice my rates are slightly higher than other similar AirBnb accommodations. The reason for this is simple, my guests not only have a sweet place to sleep, but they also are able to have an EXPERIENCE!

A mini vacation where guests are spoiled. The fires are prepared for them, they can cook on the bbq, use the private hot tub and enjoy the evening by the fire. All your dishes are washed for you and returned for further use. Staying here is a complete experience, you will be pampered and catered to during your stay. Your privacy will also be respected
host_about:
In our lifetime there will be constant change, we will experience love and endure loss.  We will have the opportunity to choose our personal adventures and follow our dreams. I prefer to surround myself with people who have positive intention. Every person we interact with creates a memory, a thread that may last a lifetime.

It was not a dream of mine to open a guest studio, but the idea gave me an opportunity for a personal adventure. I have created a beautiful space for guests to have a pleasant experience. With every guest there is a story to be shared and a chance for me to complement and enhance their experience by doing things I enjoy. This gives me great personal pleasure.

name: Modern & Cozy Cottage in Seabright
description:
This newly remodeled one bedroom home is located in the heart of the Seabright area within biking/walking distance to everything! Created with comfort and relaxation in mind; ideal for couples or for business travelers looking for a home on the road.

The space
The Cottage on Caledonia is a charming one bedroom home in a classic and friendly Santa Cruz neighborhood. It has been renovated from top to bottom and, though it be small, it has all the amenities one would need for either a quick getaway or an extended vacation.

The Cottage is also an ideal space for the weary business traveler looking for accommodations that are cozier and homier than a hotel. With free wi-fi and plenty of space to work, the business traveler will find The Cottage very accommodating.

As you enter this very private retreat, a bottle of wine and sparkling water will greet you upon arrival.

We love beautiful, small spaces that live large and this cottage
neighborhood_overview: The Seabright area is a quintessential Santa Cruz neighborhood full of friendly people and quaint shops and restaurants. From The Cottage you can bike or walk to just about anything...the Boardwalk, downtown, the beach, Seabright Brewery...the list goes on and on. You are in the heart of a great area! When you check in, you will find a detailed guide we put together regarding shopping, eating and other things to do or see in Santa Cruz.
host_about: We have lived in Santa Cruz for 20 years and feel blessed to call it home. We have a passion for old homes and love saving what most people would consider a lost cause. Such is the case with The Cottage on Caledonia. Over a year and half we lovingly restored this quaint cottage and infused it with modern day charm. It was a labor of love and we are thrilled to be able to share it with you.

name: Sea Otter Cottage in Santa Cruz!
description:
This quaint cottage, just a block and a half from the beach, was built in the early 1900's yet lovingly updated to maintain Old World Charm. Take a short stroll to the beach, quaint restaurants, shopping or the harbor. Enjoy provided paddle boards, cruiser bikes & boogie boards or have a bonfire in the backyard before ending your day with a relaxing soak in the hot tub!

The space
The master bedroom features a comfortable Eastern king with adjustable head & foot positioning. Other features include a large flat screen TV, DVD, plenty of drawers/storage, mirrored closets, vaulted ceilings and a french door that opens to the lush rear yard - convenient access to the hot tub!
Wifi throughout the house. Full sized washer/dryer closet off the hall which offers a folding counter as well as cupboards with beach and bath towels as well as linens for the beds. The kitchen is well equipped with high end reverse osmosis drinking water system at the sink, coffee mac
neighborhood_overview: We are beautifully nestled between the Santa Cruz Beach Boardwalk & eclectic Santa Cruz downtown and the quaint & vibrant village of Capitola.
host_about: I LOVE LOVE LOVE to travel! Especially when I can experience how others live by staying in homes vs. hotels! I also love hiking, biking, baking, snowboarding, decorating, and being as close to the sea, nature & God as possible!

name: A Room in a CoHousing community
description:
The house is part of a cohousing community of 16 households, near UCSC on the upper west side of Santa Cruz. The beach is about 1.5 mile or a 27 minute walk away. We have a grand piano, and especially welcome visiting musicians.

The space
The bedroom is part of a 5 bedroom house. I live here with 2 renters who occupy the 3rd floor. The room is on the 2nd floor, and shares a bathroom. There is another half-bath on the first floor.

Guest access
Guest will have access to the room, the shared bathroom and the living room and kitchen.

Other things to note
I have a cat. If you are only mildly allergic it's probably OK, because my house has mostly wood flooring, very little carpeting. Also, parking is available only on the street, and restrictions are in effect on weekdays while school is in session. If you need to leave your car parked while restrictions are in effect, I have a parking pass you can use.
neighborhood_overview: Our co-housing community is a safe, friendly place to live. The upper west side of Santa Cruz features lovely views of the Pacific ocean, and lots of great walks / hiking trails.
host_about:
I'm an empty-nester with 2 kids in college. I work a full-time-plus job. In my free time I enjoy choral singing, gardening, hiking and I volunteer for the local youth symphony. I generally enjoy unstructured time on weekends, and like a quiet house.

Because I'm so busy, I am a pretty hands-off host - I do best with guests who are independent.
