Big outdoor area with a private entrance to a cozy, small bedroom/bath, your own large outdoor private enclosed shower & outdoor kitchen area in a garden setting in Aptos, Seacliff area. It is a room with it's own entrance at the back of our house. Hot tub, sauna, fire pit, BBQ, organic garden. 15 min walk to beach thru an open meadow, secluded yet close to everything.

The space
No pretense, just a sweet spot near the beach in Aptos. Large outdoor area has an entrance to a cozy bedroom ( queen-size bed) and tiny bathroom, with a large outdoor enclosed (private) shower. It is in the back of our house. The outdoor kitchen area has a refrigerator, sink, microwave, bbq, hot tub, fire pit, all for your use exclusively. Quiet peaceful surroundings with lots of amenities. Beautiful 15 minute walk to the beach through state park land to the beach between the Cement Ship (Seacliff State Park) and New Brighton Beach.

Guest access
neighborhood_overview: Yard with open space views in Aptos.  Seacliff State Beach and New Brighton State Beaches in short (15 minute) walking distance. Capitola Village is 2 miles away. Santa Cruz is 5 miles away.
host_about:
Love this area. Enjoy gardening, cooking, traveling and especially beach days,  who doesn't. 
Kevin and I love entertaining and doing projects together,  we like to travel and stay in places away from the crowd,  yet close to everything.  We discovered Airbnb and it is a perfect fit.

name: Modern Harbor Side Oasis
description:
Comfy modern space with private entrance, perfectly situated one block from Harbor with street parking. We offer a spacious 1 bedroom, 1 bath, w/patio, outside shower - perfect for fun and sun. Walk to beach, harbor, restaurants, nature. Bring flip flops. Ideal for a couple.

The space
Ideally located: across the street from the Harbor, close to all the action yet far away from the hustle and bustle, making this a perfect oasis for rest and relaxation and leisure. Comfortable and spacious for one or two people with a spacious bed room for sleeping, with a desk and chair plus full luxury bath for refreshing your soul and rustic outside shower for refreshing your mind. Private entrance leads to your own private patio ideal for relaxing. You are renting a bathroom with walk-in shower and bedroom with queen bed and patio.

Guest access
The property is located on a corner lot with it's own side entrance. You have access to your own parking space
neighborhood_overview:
The neighborhood is quiet and friendly and within a few minutes walking distance to some very good restaurants: Aldo's (seafood, italian, lunch, breakfast), Crow's Nest (breakfast, lunch and dinner), Cafe El Palomar (Mexican faire, margaritas, dinner), Jonny's Harborside (breakfast, lunch, dinner), Harbor Cafe (breakfast, brunch, bloody marys). A little further in the Seabright area and within 10 minutes you can walk to La Posta, The Brewery, Linda's Seabreeze Cafe, Engfer Pizza Works.

Beaches: Three excellent beaches are within a 10 minute walk: Twin Lakes, Seabright and Santa Cruz Main Beach at the Boardwalk. We are so close you will notice the changing sounds of the ocean in the evening and late night when mother earth is getting ready to sleep. Come home to seagulls and roaring sea lions.

Things you should experience:
1. A bike ride (two simple functional bikes on site provided for your pleasure).
- Bike along East Cliff and over to 41st Avenue
host_about:
We moved here for a purpose. It's peaceful, different, fresh and magical to live near the ocean. And you never look back when you make a decision like that. We enjoy the outdoors, movement, technology, traveling, the arts, music, festivals, exploring new cultures and learning. Both our children are grown and thriving in Los Angeles and San Francisco.

Hotels are nice, but they don't get you closer to a city's heart and culture, which is how we like to travel. Hosting with Airbnb is fun and fulfilling for us. We enjoy meeting new people, sharing wonderful experiences, learning about places they have visited and making connections. We use our space as a medium for this exchange.

We are blessed in this location. This vortex they call Santa Cruz which is the world's best little kept secret. Take a walk along the Harbor or just sit in the front yard and pause and smile at someone and you will find out what we are talking about. It's a small friendly coastal town with great sounds, views and people. Come and explore and work on your shine.

host_about: Hi , I’m Stephanie. I really feel fortunate to have my property in Scotts  Valley , CA. This area allows me to enjoy the mountains and the ocean . Love to kayak , paddle board ,and hike all my favorite mountain trails with my loyal and loving jack Russell Terrier . I often travel with my very well behaved dog and find that I have to pay exorbitant prices to have my dog with me .. I love sharing my property and allowing  people to travel with their animals and not charge  extra. I enjoy sharing my unique spot and keeping it affordable for everyone .

name: Spectacular Ocean Front Luxury Home
description:
Enjoy panoramic views of the Monterey Bay from every room in the house, & walk only 1 block and stairs to downtown Capitola and the Beach. Shops, wine bars, and surf await you. Patio faces ocean with several seating areas and fire pit. Living decor is chic. Modern mixed with glam. Kitchen is fully stocked with everything you need for entertaining.

The space
House sits on the bluff, and every room is designed to take advantage of the spectacular views. The indoor-outdoor lifestyle is fantastic. name: Wonderful House in Pleasure Point
description:
Located in the heart of Pleasure Point, our spacious home allows guests to enjoy all that the area has to offer - just a quick walk to surf, beaches, and 41st Ave restaurants and shops. The comfortable rooms inside are seamlessly connected by two decks to the beautiful outdoor patio and garden. The outdoor shower and hot tub are perfect after returning from the ocean.

The space
As surfers, we have set up the back yard so that it is perfect for surfing. House bikes get you to 8 named surf breaks in the Pleasure point area, all of which are with 1 mile or a 5 minute bike ride. Surf racks in back yard are capable of holding as many as 10 boards, and the carefully designed outdoor shower is a perfect ending to a great surf session! Guests are allowed to borrow a 10' Liquid Shredder (a great board for a bigger person, but fun for anyone in small waves) and an 8' Wavestorm foamie. The outdoor shower has hooks for wetsuits, towels and bathing suits, as well as a bench f
neighborhood_overview:
From the website http://www.santacruz.org:

With colorful surf shops, charming beach cottages, and a shoreline teeming with surfers and beachgoers, Pleasure Point is the kind of quintessential beach community that enlivens Hollywood movies and lures envious tourists to California’s sunny shores. Situated on Santa Cruz’s east end, this seaside neighborhood is one of the most vibrant surf destinations along the California coast. The easy going ‘hood earned its hedonistic name from Prohibition-era shenanigans, but you’d swear it’s because spending a day here is such a joy, no surfboard required!

One of Pleasure Point’s biggest draws is East Cliff Drive, a dazzling waterfront promenade—part of the Monterey Bay Sanctuary Scenic Trail—that winds along coastal bluffs overlooking the sparkling Monterey Bay. Join the parade of beach cruisers, skaters, and board-toting surfers as you enjoy vistas of quiet beach coves and thrilling surf breaks.

You’ll spot a crowd

Pets by request only please. Dogs are NOT allowed on the beach. TWO people maximum on the property at any time. There is only parking for ONE car. NO SMOKING

name: Sunny Corralitos Private Room/Bath
description:
Love to have you visit this small country village. Enjoy our beautiful queen master bedroom and bath with private entrance off a large deck.

So close to beaches, redwoods and towns. So much to do and see, or just relax and do nothing at all!

Santa Cruz County Permit: 181366

The space
We are offering a very large private queen bedroom with a sitting area, closet, chest, very spacious shower bathroom off a large deck that is private for your stay with us.

There is a fountain just outside the room where birds splash, surrounded by gardens.

With a small refrigerator, microwave and coffee pot, you can snack or eat at the small table in the room, or on the deck.

Please pick and enjoy the raspberries, veggies in the garden if they are ripe when you visit.

Of course we have free wifi. Please ask for the password.

Guest access
Private Entrance over the Deck. Key to lock the
neighborhood_overview:
We are located in sunny, Corralitos Village across from public tennis courts and park, around the corner from the famous Corralitos Market (fabulous sausages, local fruits and veggies.)

There are picnic tables in front of the Market where bicyclists and hikers may drop in for lunch or snacks.

A block further are both a tacquiria and pizza parlor. Drop in to eat at their picnic tables or take your food with you as you wander the country roads.

The roads are fairly quiet, flat with the odd hill. You will ride through old and new orchards, go by the berry farms that Driscoll has planted along Corralitos Road.

You may want to stop at Alladin Nursery on the corner of Corralitos and Freedom. They have a unique gift shop, fabulous flowers and plants owned by the same family for several genertions.

Roses of Yesterday down Brown's Valley Rd is an old, 1920's, family owned, peaceful, multiacre heritage rose garden. They host a special

name: 1.5 blks.to beach, Hottub Firepit, Best Location!
description:
Comfortably sleeps 10 people in beds. Entertain in the full sun tropical backyard, BBQ, relax in the hot tub & roast marshmallows in the gas fire pit. Best location in town! 1.5 blks. to Natural Bridges State Park Beach & a 2 mile path along the ocean called 'West Cliff" Less than 10 minute drive to Boardwalk, Wharf, Downtown & Derby park. Large collection of beach, bikes & baby gear for your use. The house is very clean and well maintained. I want to give you the ultimate vacation experience.

The space
You will love this beach house. The vacation house is very comfortable and beautifully decorated. Plenty of room for all. Full sun facing backyard. After each guest, the home is thoroughly cleaned and sanitized with a very experienced vacation rental cleaning crew. Self check in.
Entertain your family and friends by barbecuing, relaxing in the hot tub, roasting marshmallows in the gas fire pit while being surrounded by beautiful mature tropical landscapi
neighborhood_overview:
The vacation rental (110 Quintana Ct). is located on the lower West side of Santa Cruz. It's a easy close walk to the beach and a 2.5 mile ocean bike/walking path. Located in the most desired part of town. The backyard faces south which means it gets full sun. People love the hot tub and firepit.
Close by to the house is the Swift Street court yard. It's a classy collection of six wine tasting rooms, Santa Cruz Mountain brewery, Kelly's bakery and one of our favorite restaurant's The West End Tap & Kitchen. There are many great supermarkets, restaurants and coffee shops close by.
The neighborhood is not congested like the east side of Santa Cruz and Live Oak. You can park your car at any hour and not have to worry about finding a spot. No permit or metered parking.
Located in a quiet small court. It's more private, less expensive and safer for kids than ocean front homes. You don't have cars and people constantly going by.
host_about: I moved to santa cruz in 95 because of the great outdoor activities. I love living by the ocean and the redwoods. I lived in the vacation house for 15 years and had some of the best times of my life. It's close to the best of Santa Cruz. Once I had my own family I wanted more of the country life. I moved to Bonnydoon located in the santa cruz mountains 15 minutes away.

For convenience and walkability, it's a hard location to beat! Go to the Beach, Boardwalk,

description:
Newly updated & refurbished for 2021! Fabulous beach bungalow w/ open floor plan, total remodel in 2016. 3 bedrooms & 1.5 baths, outdoor shower, near new coastal bike path, blocks to famous surfing spots and beaches, ~1 mile to boardwalk and Natural bridges Beaches. Miles of hiking, biking, beaches nearby. Excellent wineries/brewery/restaurants/grocery and farmers market in walking distance. Great 4 families & friends to come together in a relaxing home w/all you need for a great beach getaway!

The space
This wonderful completely remodeled (2016) modern classic Santa Cruz beach bungalow , packs a lot into its nearly 1000 sq feet. It's a great space to rest, relax, gather with friends and family, head to the beaches or enjoy the many activities that Santa Cruz has to offer. Please be aware we have a RING video doorbell facing the front entry door only. You will walk into an open, comfortable living room with flat screen tv that is open to the kitchen and eating s
neighborhood_overview:
Quiet residential relaxed laid back classic Santa Cruz. Breweries, wine tasting, bakeries, restaurants and beaches within walking distance. Stroll or bike along west Cliff Drive. Near UCSC, Natural Bridges, Wilder Ranch, downtown santa cruz, hiking, mountain biking, beaches, surfing, and the Boardwalk.
We have a pedestrian path lined with grassy knolls across the street that lead directly to West Cliff Drive and beaches in both directions. Hwy 1 is a few blocks away, and leads to more northern coastal beaches and farms (seasonal berry picking/pumpkins/etc) The Santa Cruz Beach Boardwalk is approximately 1.5 miles south and Natural Bridges State park and Wilder Ranch 1.5 miles north.
The neighborhood is uniquely filled with breweries, wine tasting rooms, coffee shops and some terrific restaurants . Old school Santa Cruz surf shops that have been creating custom boards for surf legends have been here for decades. Easy 2 miles to downtown Santa Cruz filled with shops and
host_about:
I love the ocean and the mountains, and all they have to offer. Proud to offer you 2 wonderful homes in California : one in Santa Cruz , 4 blocks from the beach-and one in North Lake Tahoe 1 block from the lake near the slopes.  My goal is to provide extremely comfortable , very clean, well stocked, super-organized , cozy,  vacation homes in wonderful areas,  that make you feel you are on. vacation but have all the wonderful amenities of being at home. 
I am also a full-time nurse, mom to 3 teens, went to UCSC, have been coming to Lake Tahoe for too many years to mention, grew up in Marin.

name: The Hummingbird Haven
description:
In your own little oasis, enjoy the hum of hundreds of Hummingbirds flying outside your window and the beautiful view we offer from your large private patio or from the deck. The Hummingbird Haven is alive with nature yet very peaceful. It is a wonderful place to recharge, relax or have a retreat.

The space
If you are familiar with the Mushroom Dome Cabin that we offer through airbnb, then you will have an idea of the wonderful place we live.
Because of the extra cleaning, we now require a 2 day minimum reservations. For weekends, please make it from Friday to Sunday (or more) as we need to have at least one day a week free: we don't want people to arrive on Saturday.

The Hummingbird Haven is a unique space with plenty of privacy yet with expansive views that look south and west with wonderful views of the tree covered ridge across the canyon and our little fruit tree orchard below.
Outside is a covered patio with a fountain and garden, a
neighborhood_overview:
The guests that we have had in the Mushroom Dome Cabin are amazed by the quiet and peaceful nature of our area. At night, you will hear lots of crickets, maybe an owl or a tree frog and sometimes the ocean waves crashing in the distance. In the summer, you can see the Milky Way as we are far enough away from city lights that, on a clear night, you can see quite a lot of stars.
The Monterey Bay is one of the most vibrate marine sanctuaries in the world - sometimes hosting the largest gathering of marine mammals in the world. We have various whales here year round with whale watching tours daily. Check out our reviews of the Mushroom Dome Cabin to get feedback from our guests of our property. (airbnb.com/rooms/8357). If you plan ahead, you can have a larger group here by reserving both spaces.
host_about:
We live on 10 beautiful acres of sun, oak forest, redwood groves and gardens with 2 goats, a parrot, 2 cats, a small dog, 5 chickens and from 200 - 500 hummingbirds - depending on the time of year..  

I have been hosting on airbnb since July, 2009 and really love what this company has made possible. I have met so many wonderful people from around the world that I would never have met if I hadn't had this opportunity with airbnb! Some of our guests (especially the ones from Europe) have never seen a hummingbird before and here they get to see them up close - just a few feet from them as the birds "hum" around the feeders.

We welcome you to come experience the peace and tranquility that our wonderful land has to offer.

Our beaches are located 200+ yards away from public entrances. Lot's of room. Very few people.

name: Pleasure Point Beach Bungalow
description:
Our fully contained hideaway is located a block from the Pacific Ocean and some of California’s hottest surfing spots. The unit is completely separated from the house with its own kitchen, full bath, cable, wi-fi , entrance, and covered parking.

The space
Welcome to our bungalow-the ocean is at the end of our street! After check-in, why not take a beverage down to the ocean, breathe in the pure air and such sit and relax on "Camma's" bench. See if you can spot a whale or other marine life. There are a number of other beaches in the area. They are either left or right on East Cliff Drive; the quaint and ever popular Capitola is a favorite. Turn left on East Cliff and it is only a short distance. One is sure to suit your purpose. Do you surf? Well you have struck pay dirt! 26th, the Hook, Privates, and Capitola, Cowell's and Steamer's all call Santa Cruz home. Not to mention Maverick's. About the unit, it stays climate controlled most of the time. Open the wind
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood consists mostly of owner occupied homes, many of which  have had the same owners for 20 years or more. There are a few new homes that have been built over the past few years and even the smaller older homes are well kept and being a block from the beach maintain high values and pride of ownership.
host_about: Hi, Karen and Wilder here. We love our beach lifestyle and enjoy sharing it with others, including our two French Bulldogs, Lola and Napoleon.When not working, we enjoy the beach, sports, painting, exercising, and hanging out with friends and family. Its fun to stroll along East Cliff Dr, watching the surfers and marine life as we head to our destination. Capitola is loaded with fine restaurants,unique shops, and wine tasting . We take advantage of it all. We walk past the Hook to witness some of the best surfing on the West Coast. If we're in the mood for a movie or need to go to the Mall its a short walk in the other direction. Take in the sunset at the end of our street where you can also see Steamers Lane, the Boardwalk, and Monterey across the bay.We welcome you to join us and experience the beauty of this special place. AND-great place to stay if you're heading to the Super Bowl. Make your reservations now!

description:
Close to everything but at a price you can afford. Private bedroom & bath with great separation of space, the bedroom & bath are located downstairs, with the host living quarters up stairs. The house is situated in quiet neighborhood with quick access to the Pacific Coast Highway One. Centrally located, Watsonville is 20 miles south Santa Cruz and 35 miles north of Monterey and less than 4 miles to beach.

The space
Downstairs bedroom & bathroom are clean & private. Room has TV, with Netflix & Hulu, internet access, queen size bed, small frig, keurig coffee maker.

Guest access

Other things to note
Please look at photos on this page to fully understand the workings of the keyless entry.
neighborhood_overview: The house is located in a quiet family orientated neighborhood walking distance to Elkhorn Slough one the premier bird watching sites in the western United States.  You will be staying 4 miles from the Pacific Ocean, Sunset & Manresa State beach are minutes away.  Watsonville is centrally located between everything you’ll want to do while visiting the central coast.  We are 30 minutes away from picturesque Monterey/Pacific Grove, historic Cannery Row and the Monterey Bay Aquarium. 20 minutes away from The Santa Cruz Beach Boardwalk an oceanfront amusement park. Founded in 1907, it is California's oldest surviving amusement park and one of the few seaside parks on the West Coast of the United States. Stay here and you will be staying 15 minutes from the quaint village of Capitola.  If you’re interested in visiting Big Sur you can drive there in just over an hour. Centrally located makes Watsonville an ideal spot to visit everything within a couple hours of your home base.

name: Seabright Cottage
description:
AVAILABLE ONLY for CZU EVACUEES.
You must have 3 prior reviews on Airbnb.
2 people maximum (kids are people too). No smoking and absolutely no pets.
The cottage is available from August 25 through August 31 (7 nights only).
You must be able to prove residency in the evacuation zone.

This renovated 1918 carriage house is a short walk to the beach and restaurants. The small home is in a quiet family neighborhood. It is a sunny and peaceful retreat.

The space
The entire carriage house consists of a 535 sq ft apartment that sits on top of two carriage bays. If you were coming down from San Francisco in 1920, you would keep the horse and carriage in the bays, then go out to hear music, sit by the roaring beach bonfires, then return to your cottage to rest.

This cottage is just four blocks from Seabright Beach, nestled between the Boardwalk and the Harbor. It is in the perfect location!

Guest access
The
neighborhood_overview:
The Seabright neighborhood is perfectly located between the boardwalk and the marina. Both are just under a mile from the cottage. It is warmer and sunnier than the rest of town and therefore called the "banana-belt" of Santa Cruz.

Seabright beach is your "classic beach". The wide sands stretch beneath the bluffs. The facilities are decent with flush toilets and an outdoor shower. Lifeguards keep you safe during the summer season. There are fire rings for evening bonfires.

There are a handful of restaurants in the heart of Seabright, and you are only 1.5 miles from all the shops and eateries on Pacific Street, downtown. You are in the middle of everything, yet living on a quiet neighborhood street, perfect for peaceful evenings at home.
host_about:
I love to travel. I've been to 3 continents, 17 countries, 39 states.
I like to count things :-) I take a lot of pictures.
I work as a software designer for Intuit. 
I am both a guest and host at AirBnB. 
I am quiet and respectful.

name: The Pine Tree Studio - quiet & cozy
description:
Fall asleep to the sound of the waves & drink your morning coffee as the fog clears over the Bay. The studio is perfect for one or two on a weekend getaway or a peaceful business-trip retreat. The kitchenette is compact & fully stocked. There are 2 induction units & the microwave oven also bakes and roasts. You have a full bath, private entrance, a private deck plus a shared deck with a gas fire pit & off-street parking. The steps to the beach are an easy 5-minute walk from your door.

The space
We call this space the "cottage" because it's a 375 sq.ft. (35 sq. meter) studio attached to the main house. There is an entirely separate entrance, though, so you will have plenty of privacy during your stay even if the main part of the house is rented to other guests.

If you're bringing a friend or child with you, the ottoman is a Castro convertible twin bed.

Guest access
The cottage entrance is on the north side of the house (next to
neighborhood_overview: 19th Avenue is in the midst of the Santa Cruz County Live Oak District.  The Pine Tree Cabin and The Pine Tree Studio are at the ocean end of the street and sit atop the cliff about 50 feet (15 meters) above the beach.  We are the only private residence on the street and are surrounded by the catholic retreat and chapel.
host_about: Our family calls California home.  We were raised on the coast and in Silicon Valley and have lived in Rhode Island, Florida and Kansas before returning to our hometown and family.  The saying “there is no place like home,” is true for us.  We truly enjoy sharing our home with you and your family and friends.

description:
Come, sit, and stay a while.... Watch whales & sea otters frolic as you drink your morning coffee on the balcony then fall asleep to the crash of the waves & the light of the moon through the pine tree. The beach is a 5 minute walk away. Perfect for two vacationing families.

The Pine Tree Cabin sits atop the cliff at the end of 19th Avenue about 50 feet (15 meters) above the beach. It is the only private residence on the block & is surrounded by the Villa Maria del Mar Catholic retreat.

First and foremost, this is our family home which we are glad to share with you. We hope you will make yourself comfortable

name: Lovely Room in the Gorgeous Santa Cruz Mtns!
description:
This space is nestled on ridge in Scotts Valley with lovely views overlooking Santa Cruz. While only 15 mi from Los Gatos and
20 min from SC, you can experience the ocean nearby combined with the solitude of a quiet mountain retreat. Private "apartment" attached to a house (please see "The Space" for detail). Outdoor staircase and short sloping path lead to combo lock entrance to apartment area. Comfy queen bed. Small patio area for drinks and snacks! Santa Cruz Mountains with many views!

The space
Serenity galore! Laid back small family in large home. 4.5 acres. Gardens, walks, bike rides. Explore Santa Cruz/Carmel to San Francisco.
The apartment is attached to house. Private combo entrance from sitting area opens to hall with 3 rooms off it that will be yours - kitchenette with washer/dryer, double bath with tub/shower off it, and finally bedroom with beautiful views. Apartment is doored off from rest of house. Very private. Only shared
neighborhood_overview: Skypark (in town), Crow's Nest Beach and the Beach Boardwalk all offer free music in the summer that's fabulously fun.  In Scotts Valley - restaurants, groceries, gifts, coffee, all choices.Between Scotts Valley and Santa Cruz one could even hit the Bigfoot Museum!
host_about: My husband and I are pretty laid back people.  We both work, but enjoy our time off working our 4.5 acres or enjoying them, traveling, listening to good music, playing outdoors or enjoying good comedy.  We love meeting people but can also sense when people would rather have privacy.  Faves - Book - The Four Agreements, Movie - Christmas Vacation, Food - a giant salad with everything, Music - most all, and travel destinations...........just returned from the Bahamas (lovely), Mexico, Hawaii (all islands except Molokai), British Columbia, and in the next couple of years want to make it to Peru/ Machu Picchu.  I would love to take a tour of Sacred Sites around the world.  LIfe motto - recognize the light within everyone I meet.

name: Chalet Apt. in Santa Cruz Mountains
description:
Secluded Apt. nestled among tall Redwoods but only 4.5 miles from Scotts Valley and just 30 minutes to Santa Cruz beaches. Big Basin and Henry Cowell Redwoods State Parks just minutes away. Short walks to historic sites start right across road from Apt.

The space
We have recently introduced the Google Assistant to the Chalet Apartment. At this time you may use it for directions to local restaurants, markets or attractions. Our guests may ask Google Assistant to wake them up the next morning or to set a timer or reminder for anything. A "Hey Google" command may be issued to turn the Floor Lamp on or the Loft Lights off, among many other things. Enjoy.

Guest access
Guests are invited to enjoy all three of the outdoor decks that surround the house. Because of steps down from the parking area and up to the Chalet, wheelchair use is not recommended. Access to the Loft sleeping area is via a pull-down stairway.

Other things to n
neighborhood_overview: We are at about 1000 ft. elevation deep in the Redwood Forest. The property has 52 Redwood Trees growing around the buildings. Please look at the photos for a better description of this Airbnb.
host_about: Born in Santa Cruz California, a former Puppeteer at Santa's Village in Scotts Valley, CA. Lake Arrowhead, CA, and East Dundee IL. Also at KNTV 11 (Hocus Pocus Show) and Happy Hollow Park in San Jose, CA. Now retired with my wife and still working and selling puppets through our Puppet Gallery website.

name: Cozy 3BD Pleasure Point Bungalow
description:
Tucked away down a private lane, our home is light & bright with loads of charm, a private oasis with a big lush private yard. Beach, surfing, shops and restaurants all within a 10 minute walk. Capitola village 1 mile away. It's a charmer!

The space
We have brand new furniture throughout the house so you get the perfect mix of modern and classic bungalow. It's incredibly cute. We love our home, and we hope you will too! It is an old home, and not a party pad. Please treat it with the same respect you would your own home.

The house sits at the end of a long driveway off of 35th Ave. shared with our two neighbors. Being at the end of the lane and far from the street makes our house a quiet and private escape. We're on the north side of Portola, which means you are just as close as all the vacation rentals (we're a 9 minute walk from the beach - we timed it, surf board in hand!) but without the high price tag!

The backyard is an oasis f
neighborhood_overview:
Pleasure Point is a surfer's paradise! We are just over the line (known as Portola Rd) from the dense vacation rental space. We love it because it means you're just as close but in a quieter, more residential area.

Unlike the West Side, where you're in a much more suburban area, we are just minutes from great shopping and dining so you get the best of both worlds!

Whole Foods, Safeway, Target and Macy's are all just a short 5 minute drive away. Capitola Village is a beautiful 1.5 mile stroll from our house - great for morning walks!

Check out what the SF Chronicle Travel Section had to say about the neighborhood!
A day in Santa Cruz’s ultimate surf-centric neighborhood
(URL HIDDEN)
host_about: Ian was born and raised in Southern California, went to school at Princeton University,and now works at a startup.  Colleen grew up in San Jose and went to UCLA and is now a lawyer in San Francisco. We love to travel and have been to over 50 countries; love meeting new people!

Amazing Beach House-Clean and Comfortable!

Designed with guests in mind with an eye-pleasing, super clean, large and comfortable floor plan for relaxation and enjoyment at the coast with family and friends. County Whole House Vacation Rental Permit #191189.

This is not your typical rental; this is our loved and cared vacation home. Relaxation is the name of the game! We respect your privacy but have a family member available should you have any questions.

Your enjoyment is our goal!!!

The space
Amazing Beach House - Super Clean and Comfortable! To visit is to fall in love!

Decorated with guests in mind, the home provides an eye-pleasing, super clean, large comfortable place for relaxation and enjoyment at the coast with family and friends. Great care has been taken with an eye for detail making the home feel comfortable and cozy from the minute you walk in the door. Guests have full access to the home. The beach is l
neighborhood_overview:
Davenport is the hidden gem of Santa Cruz County; a small town of approximately 120 homes filled with friendly people and magnificent views.

Once in town just park your car and walk everywhere you need to go. The beaches, food, store, church and post office are all within a three minute walk from the house. Feel like a great cup of coffee and fresh pastry during your morning walk on the beach? Davenport has the best bakery around! Craving a four star dinner to celebrate? Davenport can deliver! Wish to enjoy live music several nights of the week within a two minute walk? Again, this is available within walking distance. Is a wine tasting adventure on your list today? This is also available with just a short walk to the end of the block!

Sunsets are amazing and ocean waves can often be heard while you sleep! If you are looking for a quiet place to relax with all of the coastal perks, Davenport is the place for you! For those seeking adventure, wind and kite

name: Sunny, modern/contemporary one-bedroom.
description:
Sunny, modern/contemporary one-bedroom in a duplex on a quiet street. Walk to the yacht harbor, Seabright beach, brewery, coffee & restaurants.

Newly remodeled; beautifully furnished; fully stocked gourmet kitchen; tiled bathroom; hardwood floors; WiFi, cable. No pets.

Easy street parking.

Note: The Transient Occupancy tax for rentals less than 30 days in Santa Cruz is 11%. This additional charge will be added to your total due, upon acceptance of your booking request.

The space
Completely remodeled/refreshed space. Queen bed, plus comfortable Queen size sofa/bed. Tri-fold mat for an extra kid, if necessary. No smoking in or around the unit. No pets. No loud music or partying after 10 pm out of respect for close neighbors, including other duplex occupant.

Guest access
Check in BETWEEN 4 PM AND 8 PM.

Local management – contacts provided upon booking.

Other things to note<
neighborhood_overview:
An easy walk can take you to a neighborhood park with direct access to the yacht harbor, leading to the picturesque Seabright beach breakwater and lighthouse, with glorious sunset views of the Santa Cruz pier and boardwalk. Continue along the beach back into the neighborhood and you're soon home again.

Minimum 3 night stay.
Special week/month rates.
host_about: Love travel, music, wine, history, and scenery.

description:

Covid related cancellations must be done at least 1 week before check in for full refund. Check the city of Santa Cruz website for updates on closures and ordinances*

Newly built, private, light-filled 2 bedroom cottage. All the amenities of home. Minutes to UCSC, great hiking and mountain biking, downtown and the beach.

The space
A few blocks from the base of UCSC, above the fog, yet 10 minutes drive to downtown and the beach, with ample street parking (permits provided). Sunny cottage is clean and comfortable with eclectic and reclaimed details.
A private, honeysuckle lined walkway leads to a large patio with shaded dining area. Bright with high ceilings and large skylights, Two comfortable bedrooms with queen beds and a mix of 100% cotton and organic bedding. A fully stoc
neighborhood_overview:
The upper westside is quiet, beautiful, safe and close to everything Santa Cruz has to offer.

***We ask that guests keep voices to a whisper if out in the patio after 10pm***

Please note we are not within walking distance to the beach; downtown is a 30-40 minute walk.
host_about: We are a vegetarian family of 4 who loves exploring new places. We have had wonderful experiences as Airbnb guests and hosts. We love design and creating beautiful spaces!

name: Safe, Steps To Beach, Spa, Near Harbor, Pets Okay!
description:
This unique beach house is 1 block from Twin lakes beach, the best beach in Santa Cruz! It is a 2-story, designer home with an open floorplan, gridwork of glass to allow in plenty of light and offers ocean peeks.
Perfect for families & beach lovers.

The space
Santa Cruz Ocean View Home: Located only one block from the beach, this is a two-story, designer home with an open-architecture style and cathedral type ceilings. Big windows and a gridwork of glass allows in plenty of light.

This home sleeps 6 with two bedrooms, a large open living space (living room & kitchen), one large bathroom and plenty of patios. The living room has a sofa and a comfortable chaise that can double as sleepers.

The upstairs bedroom opens to a private deck that gets the late afternoon sun. Here you can lay on a long couch, read a book or take a nap. In the evening, you can enjoy a glass of wine as you watch the sunset.

Downstairs, a large wraparound
neighborhood_overview: This property in a quiet, sought-after neighborhood is only a block from Twin Lakes, perhaps the best beach in Santa Cruz. Visit the nearby Monterey Bay Aquarium and stroll to the Yacht Harbor and well-known eateries like Crow's Nest and El Palomar.

In the heart of historical downtown Santa Cruz, our spacious family friendly home is only a few minute stroll to the beach, the Boardwalk, many restaurants, bars, and cafes! It's the perfect destination for an escape to paradise. There are two floors so the kids can have their own upstairs space and the adults can relax downstairs.

The space

neighborhood_overview: My spacious downtown vacation art filled vacation house is great for any occasion -- whether you want to spend a few days at the beach with your family, go hiking in the beautiful local redwood forests, ride the Giant Dipper and enjoy a funnel cake at the Boardwalk, see the Monarch butterflies nest at Natural Bridges State Park, have the perfect weekend getaway with your special someone, get a seafood dinner with an ocean view on the wharf, take a stroll down the beautiful backdrop of West Cliff Drive, or would just like to enjoy some peace and quiet in a serene environment-- you've come to the right place! Walk to the farmers market  on Wednesdays and make yourself a gourmet meal in the large fully equipped kitchen. Everything we mentioned is in walking distance, you won't even need to rent a car! The home is located in the heart of downtown Santa Cruz, but you wouldn't even know it! So peaceful and serene, it is extremely quiet, so much so, that if you listen hard enough you can some
host_about:
Hello, I am Rex Solway! I have lived in Santa Cruz my entire life and know the town like the back of my hand. I enjoy traveling, fine dining, photography, and the ocean -- I wouldn't be able to live far from the beach! I would like to call myself an avid sushi lover, die hard Survivor fan, adore cats (but no worries if you have allergies, no kitties live here!), and often find myself critiquing the films and shows I watch with friends and family. I worship the sun, but thrive under the moon and the stars when it's dark outside. I’m always looking for the next adventure that awaits around the corner. 

I am personally dedicated to providing the best possible experience for you and your family, and will do my best to create a unique experience you'll never forget!

name: Views of Monterey Bay from a Tranquil Guest Room
description: Sit on the covered porch drinking a glass of estate Pinot Noir with views of the vineyard and ocean. The spacious room has a French door entrance with a relaxing blue tiled bathroom. It has access to a shared indoor pool with a vaulted skylight roof.
neighborhood_overview: The private room is located in beautiful natural surroundings at a house in Aptos. It's set among 15 acres of private land filled with oak trees. An organic working vineyard is on the property.
host_about:
My husband and I have an active organic working vineyard on the property. We take care of all aspects of the vineyard and winery. I prefer to view the vineyard chores as a zen-like experience rather than labor pruning and maintaining the vines. 
We produce a wonderful estate bottled Pinot Noir wine.
Our 4 children are grown and living away from home now. 
You will see families of deer, wild turkeys, bunnies and occasionally a coyote on the property.

I am personally dedicated to providing the best possible experience for you and your family, and will do my best to create a unique experience you'll never forget!

name: Spacious Downtown 2+ BD Walk to Beach & Boardwalk!
description:
Please carefully read all info below about the space before booking our home!

In the heart of historical downtown Santa Cruz, our comfy 2 bedroom family friendly flat is only a few minute stroll to the beach, the Boardwalk, many restaurants, bars, and cafes! It's the perfect destination for an escape to paradise -- come see for yourself!

The space
1. **ATTENTION! VERY IMPORTANT TO READ THIS BEFORE REQUESTING TO BOOK!**

Airbnb collects occupancy tax for different areas of Santa Cruz, and on other listings you will see the tax on the check out line when you book. However, because of my location in the city limits, I must collect it and remit it myself. I so wish that Airbnb could collect it for me like the other listings but the city will just not allow it. Thus, I am forced to request it directly from you after you make your booking. The Transient Occupancy Tax (TOT), is 11% of the nightly rate (before fees) for each night you stay. Per
neighborhood_overview:
***Please check out our Guidebook below on the map at the bottom of the page***
Our spacious downtown vacation home is great for any occasion-- whether you want to spend a few days at the beach with your family, go hiking in the beautiful redwood forests our town has to offer, ride the Giant Dipper and enjoy a funnel cake at the Boardwalk, see the Monarch butterflies nest at Natural Bridges State Park, have the perfect weekend getaway with your special someone, get a seafood dinner with an ocean view on the wharf, take a stroll down the beautiful backdrop of West Cliff Drive, or would just like to enjoy some peace and quiet in a serene environment-- you've come to the right place! Walk to the farmers market on Wednesdays and make yourself a gourmet meal in the large fully equipped kitchen. Everything we mentioned is in walking distance, you won't even need to rent a car! The home is located in the heart of downtown Santa Cruz, but you wouldn't even know it! So peaceful and serene
host_about:
Hello, I am Rex Solway! I have lived in Santa Cruz my entire life and know the town like the back of my hand. I enjoy traveling, fine dining, photography, and the ocean -- I wouldn't be able to live far from the beach! I would like to call myself an avid sushi lover, die hard Survivor fan, adore cats (but no worries if you have allergies, no kitties live here!), and often find myself critiquing the films and shows I watch with friends and family. I worship the sun, but thrive under the moon and the stars when it's dark outside. I’m always looking for the next adventure that awaits around the corner. 

I am personally dedicated to providing the best possible experience for you and your family, and will do my best to create a unique experience you'll never forget!

name: Be part of our family!
description:
Walk to everything! Private Room in 100 year old Victorian in the Seabright neighborhood of Santa Cruz. Only 15 minutes from the World Famous Santa Cruz Beach Boardwalk!!

Be our guest! Our new puppy, Butter will greet you at the door and our 8 year old son will happily sing to you over breakfast :)

The space
Walk to everything! Harbor- 15 minute walk. Beach- 12 minute walk. The Famous Santa Cruz Beach Boardwalk only 12 minute walk. Pacific Avenue shopping area only a 20 minute walk. Market about a 5 minute walk. Gym 10 minute walk.

Room has a queen sized bed, reading chair as well as a small TV with DVD player.

Guest access
We are a multi generation family, ages 5-78, living together in our 4 bedroom Victorian home. We are all sociable and love to learn about our guests. That being said, we appreciate our guests respect the family atmosphere. This means quiet after 10 pm, no additional guests brought to th
neighborhood_overview: We are in a great area-within walking distance of all your needs!  If you are not a walker, 5 minutes by car gets you downtown and 15 will get you to the Redwoods!
host_about:
Mom and wife and lover of travel!  
 
My husband, Austin own a wellness spa in Santa Cruz, CA.  We met on a wine tour. <3
Five and a half months after this meeting we ran off to Las Vegas to get married!
We honeymooned in Hopkins, Belize and loved it so much we built a vacation home there!  


We both have a love for adventure and plan to travel the world with our 3 year old son as much as possible!  
About five years ago we took off for Europe for ten months with our then 3 year old son.  We stayed almost exclusively at Airbnb's and so enjoyed the experience that we decided to become hosts once we returned home.  

We now have 3 generations living on the property.  My mother lives in the home with us and my husband's mom lives in the unit in the backyard.  We also have a 4 month old Golden Retriever puppy named Butter.

We look forward to meeting you!
The Traveling Twohigs!

name: Walk to beach, boardwalk, downtown!
description:
You will be a 15 minute walk to Main Beach, Boardwalk, and to downtown. Four bicycles available with deposit. This house sleeps six in three double beds with a large kitchen with a beautiful view of a safe backyard for kids and pets. 1 wk min stay.

The space
This home has many large windows with lots of natural light, a large kitchen and outdoor space.

Guest access
Washer/dryer, dishwasher, four bicycles, big fenced backyard, off street parking. Boogie Boards are on the front porch.

Other things to note
Contact person is Robert Lemon next door if we're not home. Inflatable mattress available.
neighborhood_overview: Walkable to beach and downtown, with its many wonderful restaurants street musicians and shops.
host_about: Stephen and I are teachers - he teaches math and physics, and I teach elementary school Spanish.  We have twin daughters and love living by the beach, thai food, and seeing new places!  We enjoy playing beach volleyball, swimming, surfing and reading.

name: Ricketts' Retreat
description:
Cozy And Private Beach Bungalow, Hot Tub, Dog Friendly, 3 Short Blocks To Beach, Crow's nest and harbor.

The space
Named after local Marine Biologist, Edward F. Ricketts, the Ricketts' Retreat House has a classy Monterey Bay feel with an enclosed private yard, and naturally, you can see the ocean from the driveway. In 3 blocks, you could be at the fire-pits of Twin Lakes Beach, sailing a boat at the Harbor, or grabbing a bite to eat at the Crow's Nest or Cafe El Palomar. In one mile, you could be riding the Giant Dipper at the Santa Cruz Beach Boardwalk. Additionally, the famed Steamer Lane surf spot, West Cliff, Capitola, and UC Santa Cruz's Seymour Marine Discovery Center are within a four-mile radius of the house.

The House is furnished in good taste with all essential amenities including linens, towels, and paper products. The bedroom has a comfortable queen bed, desk, dresser, closet, adjoining bright bathroom (with windows) and walk-in showe
neighborhood_overview: SANTA CRUZ HARBOR is just a 5 min walk from the house. Full-service marina with concession-operated charters offering sailing, fishing, whale watching, eco-tours, kayaking and more. Landside, enjoy restaurants, beach, and retail shops.

name: Sunny Private Downtown Studio
description:
Beautiful, sunny, high ceiling studio with sleeping loft located in downtown Santa Cruz. This is a great home base for day trips to the beach, exploring the arts scene downtown, or enjoying some of the wonderful restaurants and farmers' markets. There are no cooking facilities. There’s no mini fridge or microwave.
This listing is best suited for one guest or a couple. If your group is more than two, contact host to make special arrangements. There are additional fees for more than two guests.

The space
Private garden studio located in the heart of Downtown Santa Cruz. Set back from the street with its own entrance and bathroom. High, pine ceilings, natural light, and garden views.
The beach is a few blocks in one direction and downtown cafes, restaurants, and shops around the corner.
The studio can accommodate two people and guests can enjoy the sunny backyard as well. The sleeping loft has a comfortable queen size mattress and large skylight to
neighborhood_overview: Vibrant neighborhood full of students and artists. Perfectly situated to explore downtown or take a 10 minute walk to the beach and famous surf spots.
host_about:
Santa Cruz has been my home for the last 30 years. I love its small-town feel, amazing events, vibrant food culture, and breath-taking scenery. 
In my spare time I enjoy gardening, deepening my yoga practice, cooking with family, and taking my dogs on walks along the water or in the mountains.
Welcome to Santa Cruz. I hope you love it as much as I do!

name: Pleasure Point Beach Hideaway
description:
Located in the heart of Pleasure Point and nestled along a hidden creek, this very private beach cottage waits for you and your guests to relax and enjoy a restful stay. All walking distance to East Cliff, Pleasure Point & Capitola.

The space
A wooded creek is your backyard and the ocean is a short walk down the street. There is lots of natural light that invokes a sense of well being. The bedroom is outfitted with a foam queen size mattress and down comforter. The bedroom has a sliding glass door that is pleasant to leave open while you sleep to hear a million tiny creek frogs croaking in the evening. There unit is stocked with all amenities for cooking and BBQ.
There is an outdoor hose to rise off after a dip in the ocean and rinse those sandy feet after walking on the beach.

Guest access
You'll have complete access to the rear bedroom; which includes one bedroom with an additional garden room space that has a couch that converts int
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is comprised of fairly young people. The empty lot immediately adjacent to the creek and the driveway was once the epicenter and final party place of the famed pleasure point bike race - however, since the last residents moved out the home has since been torn down and the party is held in another part of the neighborhood. Its now an awesome, make-shift dog park and if you have a doggie, Im sure they will find it full of smells of the neighborhood dogs. The beach is literally 3 blocks down the road and the sunset walks a must for everyone on the block - we all grab a glass of wine and head down to the cliffs with doggies in tow. We have a very loving, communal group of neighbors and we all watch out for one another.
host_about:
Hi There!
My name is Courtney and Im excited to share my cozy beach shack with new friends!

name: The Cottage Getaway by the Sea
description:
The Cottage Getaway by the Sea is a single level one bedroom stand alone home on a cliff over Rio Del Mar Beach w/ 180 degree WOW views of the Monterey Bay. Seasonally enjoy dolphins, whales, & great sunsets! Located in a peaceful neighborhood, this is a perfect place for a quiet romantic getaway or just to read, relax, & enjoy. We are one of the few airbnbs with a California King Bed! Pricing is for one; a second person is $25.
PERMITTED vacation rental #181420 expires 11-21-23

The space
Approximately 50 yards below the main house on the property, the cottage offers some nice privacy. For those who love the look and sound of the ocean, this is THE spot. There are four steps from the driveway down to the paved path to the cottage, one step into the cottage, and no steps within the cottage. Note: We have one California King Bed and prefer one or two quiet guests which works best with our neighbors and the cottage plumbing.

Guest a
neighborhood_overview: The property is in a residential neighborhood of mostly elderly folks.  The nearest grocery store, Deluxe Foods, is fantastic (gourmet, with sandwich bar, hot food bar, salad bar, sushi counter and a nice selection of beer and wine) and is right off Hwy. 1 as you head towards the cottage. There is a liquor store next door.  The  nearest beach access is Hidden Beach, about a 3 minute drive or under a 10 minute walk.

name: Ocean Front Beach Home Steps to the Beach & Ocean
description:
The beach and ocean is your backyard at this 3 bedroom, 2 bath townhome (sleeps 8). Relax and enjoy the ocean, beach, and breathtaking sunset's. Watch the dolphins play in the waves and the whales swim by one of Santa Cruz Counties longest semi private beaches. An ideal location for social distancing while enjoying the beach. Our cleaning team follows the Center for Disease Control Covid-19 cleaning guidelines and thoroughly cleans in high use and touch areas. The safety and comfort of our guests is our first priority.

The space
The property is ocean front. All 3 levels have ocean views.

Guest access
You can access the entire home. Easy access to the beach.

Other things to note
-Our Cuisinart coffee maker allows you to brew fresh coffee everyday of your stay!

- If your group has extra cars and there is not enough room in our driveway to park, you will not need parking passes to park on our private street.
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is private, quiet, safe and secure.
host_about: I'm friendly, enjoy the outdoor's and love meeting new people. I have always had an affinity for the ocean and Lake Tahoe.  I want my guest's to experience the serenity, peace and tranquility offered in these scenic areas.

name: Private Suite, Garden View, Hot Tub
description:
This large suite - 600 sq. ft. includes a full bath with shower, a second sink, a small refrigerator and a microwave. The private deck has a garden view. A second pair of double doors can open at the opposite end of the suite for breezes and another view. Your deck has a gas barbeque and gas outdoor stove top. It has easy, private access to our garden spa/hot tub. Ten minutes or less to ocean, parks, hiking, biking, wine trails and great restaurants. It is a very quiet and relaxing location.

The space
A cozy and romantic fireplace will greet you in winter or on other cold days.(It is thermostatically controlled for room temperature adjustments.)
The kitchenette has a refrigerator with ice (and we can always give you extra from ours). It has a large microwave, a toaster, an electric tea kettle, electric drip coffee pot and a Keurig automatic coffee machine. Outside on your deck you will find a nice small gas barbecue and a tabletop burner. The kitchen area ha
neighborhood_overview:
Private and welcoming to long walks and cycling.
Our road forms a comfortable, scenic 3 mile walk through an apple orchard and wooded areas. You can hear a small waterfall from Valencia Creek as you walk though the orchard area. Our home and guest suite are very private and surrounded by redwoods and oaks.
host_about: I am a practicing fine artist. I work in both paint and print, with an etching press. Additionally I still occasionally do landscape architecture and design projects. I love to garden and cook as well. My husband and I have been living here in the Monterey Bay Area for more than 25 years. I grew up in the San Francisco Bay Area. We like to greet our guests when they arrive to familiarize them with details about the place. We have been avid tennis players but now spend more time with golf. We have two small Scottish Terriers. They are friendly and let us know, most of the time when guests arrive. We try to give our guests as much privacy as possible and that's pretty easy since the suite is not only private because of it's design, but because the area we live in is restfull and quiet.

name: Cozy, Bright & Perfect Location!
description:
A sunny, spacious and comfortable updated farmhouse with full kitchen and a spacious backyard. Great location, 1.5 miles to Sunny Cove and Twin Lakes Beach. Easy access to Pleasure Point, the Boardwalk & downtown SC.

The space
We've recently renovated our home, an old farmhouse built in 1930 in one of Santa Cruz's friendliest neighborhoods. This is a comfortable, plant-filled and spacious home-base for you to enjoy all that Santa Cruz has to offer!

The rooms...
Guest rooms have lots of natural light with full and queen sized beds. A blow up mattress is also available.

Additional features:
- fully stocked kitchen with Viking appliances
- BBQ and outdoor redwood table
- fresh lemons & oranges from our fruit trees
- fresh herb garden
- WiFi access
- Fenced in backyard for relaxing and letting the kids play
- Roku (with Netfiix, HBO Go, and Hulu plus) on the flat screen
- Backyard chickens (in a
neighborhood_overview:
This is a great sunny, quiet neighborhood, with access to so many things! You'll feel like a Santa Cruz local. There is a neighborhood dog park and pump track across the street. There is street noise noticeable from in the living room, which quiets down in the evening.

-Short distance to Capitola/41st St. stores and restaurants (Whole Foods, Trader Joe's, New Leaf Markets)
-3 miles from downtown Santa Cruz
-Local beaches (Sunny Cove, Twin Lakes State Beach)
-Close to Pleasure Point surfing, walk/bike path, and shops
-Several great coffee shops nearby
-Easy access to the Boardwalk & Harbor
-Biking distance to some of Santa Cruz's best mountain biking trails!

name: PELICAN COTTAGE SEASIDE ESCAPE
description:
Just minutes from Capitola's pristine beach, quaint downtown shops and delectable eateries. This newly remodeled and immaculately-maintained house has open floor plan, fully equipped kitchen, and native floral garden/patio. Close proximity to fruit stand, Gayle's Bakery/Deli, major grocery/drug stores and restaurants.
Includes 2 FREE passes to Monterrey Bay Aquarium ($100 value!).
Min 30 days. Maximum # of adults - 6. Maximum # of people - 8.

The space
Just a short walk to the beach, this cottage comfortably accommodates with style and ease. With queen size beds in two bedrooms and two twin trundle beds in the third "bunk room", this cottage ideally serves 6 people, maximum 8.

Kitchen features all modern appliances, including a double oven, which makes cooking for large groups "a breeze".

Monterrey Bay Aquarium --- Day Passes for two people ($100 value). Bring the passes with you to the Aquarium, where they will be scann
neighborhood_overview:
The neighborhood has a "beachy" feel. Pelican Cottage is situated among other cottages with floral gardens and a relaxing, vacation vibe. It is also just around the corner from the Zagat rated Gayle's Bakery and Rosticceria and a fresh Fruit/Vegetable Market and an easy, few minutes walk to a major grocery chain.

Ideal location:
1-2 minutes to Capitola Beach.
15 minutes to Santa Cruz Beach/Boardwalk.

SPECIAL EVENTS:
Every Wednesday evening during the summer (6/15 - 8/31) ---
FREE TWILIGHT CONCERTS from 6-8 pm on the Esplanade Stage.

FOR MORE SPECIAL EVENTS CHECK OUT --- Capitola Village Events
From movies on the beach/wharf to the Wharf Footrace (7/24), there's lots of fun to be had in festive Capitola!
host_about:
Teri is a loving wife, mother and grandmother.  She founded Summerhill Property Management, Inc. in 2005 after working more than 20 years in property management.  For her, the fun of property management is to connect great owners with great tenants.  She strives to ensure that everyone receives excellent service and that properties are well maintained.

Teri is an Airbnb SUPERHOST, with two listings:  
   - A newly renovated 3b/1.5b cottage in lovely Capitola
   - A 3b/2b condo in the heart of Mountain View

Deb is an established Airbnb SUPERHOST with a room listing in her home in Mountain View.  Deb manages communications with guests on the Airbnb platform and directly if needed.

name: La Selva Beach Gazebo Room
description:
Ocean view family home with backyard Garden View Gazebo Room & its separate private Bathroom. Backyard Gazebo Room with Garden view has a comfortable Queen size bed for 1 person or couple. (Price increase for 2nd person). Gorgeous State Park Beach / Campground is an enjoyable path walk (approx 10 min) down from neighborhood roadway.

The space
La Selva Beach Gazebo Room is a small, octagonal, vintage structure with large windows, Queen size bed, dresser, table, mini-fridge, micro-wave & heater & is a backyard separate structure on our property. The Gazebo Room's private bathroom with shower is approx 70' away from Gazebo Room, down a solar lit pathway. Gazebo Room has a relaxing, open - air feel & 2 outdoor seating areas for guests to relax & snack. Please enjoy viewing all our photos while you acquaint yourself with the layout of this rental prior to a reservation request.

Guest access
Driving towards your Gazebo Room: Please, take you

Our State Beach posts warnings when Ocean conditions are unsafe.

name: Midtown to All Things Santa Cruz
description:
Upgraded craftsman home in sunny Midtown comfortably sleeps two. Enjoy a chef-appointed kitchen, luxe furnishings and amenities, and a landscaped porch. Convenient access to beaches, trails, downtown, restaurants, UCSC and everything Santa Cruz has to offer.

Santa Cruz City requires 11% Occupancy Taxes. Currently not safely set-up for guests 12 years and under.

The space
Our single family home is cleverly divided by a lockable sliding door, converting it into a “duplex” where we each have private living spaces.

These photos show your front half of the house which includes a bedroom, bathroom, full kitchen, and continuous living and dining areas. It was designed to make 500 sq ft feel open, bright and cozy without feeling cramped. We furnished it for safety, comfort, function and style.

Amenities include high-speed WiFi; Streaming HDTV (no cable TV); breakfast starter kit; cooking oils, spices and condiments; central
neighborhood_overview:
Our neighborhood is a residential area mostly occupied by homeowners, and not by the partying types, so it tends to be peaceful and quiet. We cannot offer you private parking since our access is through the driveway but there is plentiful safe street parking.

We are a stone's throw away from local faves such as Charlie Hongkong, the Buttery, Vivas, Rio Theatre, Crepe Place, Tacos Moreno, Lilian's, Akira and many others. Around the corner are Whole Foods, Shopper's Corner, and Staff of Life.

The Boardwalk, Wharf, Harbor, Downtown and beaches are less than 2 miles away, as are many hiking and biking trails. UCSC is a straight shot, less than 5 miles. You see, midtown to everything!
host_about:
Dane and I are a semi-retired couple from the tech industries.  We love to surf in warm waters.   When landlocked, I swim, yoga, hike with our dog, and garden.  Dane hits the single tracks on his bike and tinkers with cars.  

Our travels have taken us to Asia, Europe, The Americas, and Africa.  Where have yours?  We look forward to exchanging travel experiences with you.

name: Stay by the Beach near Capitola!
description:
A cozy two bedroom new manufactured home, with two bathrooms.
Granite , stainless steel appliances, close the beach, downtown Soquel, shops (antique stores galore), washer/dryer inside home. Close to Cabrillo College. Fantastic neighborhood!

The space
This house has an open space feeling..with a fantastic kitchen, cozy living room and very modern bathrooms.

This house has quite a bit natural light with many windows it has!

Guest access
You are welcome to use whatever you would like in the house.
neighborhood_overview: Located In the heart of Soquel Village! Walk to many restaurants, post office, park, The Ugly Mug (coffee house), Antique Shops...and the best night life spots..Froggys...JJ's, Beer Thirty and Barchettos Winery!
host_about:
Fun, Outgoing person who has a love for life.
I live for my walks on the beaches of Santa Cruz with my beagles.
I enjoy attending live music events and enjoy traveling!
Gardening is also a passion!
Did I mention...THAT I LOVE TO DANCE!!!!
Love to meet new people!
I work at a University and love helping students achieve a higher level of education!

name: Magical Mount Hermon Cabin!
description:
If you're looking for a nice comfortable place to stay near Santa Cruz, our cabin is ideally located in Mount Hermon/Felton near Scotts Valley just 8 miles from the world famous Santa Cruz Beach Boardwalk.

We have 2 bedrooms with queen beds, 2 full bathrooms, newly carpeted living room, new hardwood floors and appliances in the kitchen, and a large covered deck with redwood tree views. It's a warm and cozy cabin in the woods at beautiful and magical Mount Hermon!!!

The space
Prime location on Forest Road just above Conference Drive and the Mount Hermon Post Office. A short walk across the redwood grove and wood bridge over a natural spring creek brings you to our cabin.

Guest access
Guests will have access to the upper level of the cabin called "Upper Heather" with 2 available off street parking spots.

No keys to lose or to return! This property provides secure, keyless entry with an August Smart Lock. You can lock

name: Walk to the beach from this classic cottage
description:
Welcome to Rio Del Mar! This classic beach cottage is not too large yet well appointed with a very private and luscious backyard, a recently updated kitchen and two comfortable seating areas with a fireplace in the living room. It takes less than a 10 minute stroll to get to the ocean on quiet neighborhood streets and a beach path. The bedroom has a tropical décor with its own bathroom, a reading chair and desk space.

The space
Guests are welcome to park in the driveway.

Guest access
Guests will have access to the kitchen, living room, front and back yard, except the garage. The second bedroom is not accessible.

Other things to note
A very friendly retriever will likely greet you exuberantly. His two cats have been relegated to the laundry room.

name: Seacliff Beach Suite: Private Entrance & Sunroom
description:
Perfect Central Coast location to explore all of Monterey Bay's treasures, the Santa Cruz Beach Boardwalk, beautiful old growth redwoods, Santa Cruz mountain wineries, the Monterey Bay Aquarium, trail rides thru redwoods, and just a five minute walk to our own Seacliff Beach. Cyclists touring thru can store bikes safely and chill out.

The space
Attached to the main house, this private entrance to your own personal retreat includes a queen size bed, private bath, plenty of closet space, and access to the attached sun porch. The adjoining sun porch is a great place to enjoy your morning beverage or an afternoon glass of wine. We'll provide a coffeemaker with Keurig pods, teas and hot chocolate, mini-frig and microwave. Netflix, Pandora, Amazon Prime and more are available through Roku streaming as well as iPod-ready connections.

This is a quiet family neighborhood close to local restaurants (see guidebook), with a short walk to Seacliff State Beach on M
neighborhood_overview:
Just south of Capitola and Santa Cruz, this is a quiet neighborhood within walking distance to Seacliff State Beach and wharf leading to the Concrete Ship. Popular restaurants, Manuel's (Mexican), Ambrosia (Indian), Route 1 (Pizza), Hole In The Wall (American breakfast and lunch) and Marianne's Ice Cream (yum!), as well as a convenience store are all down the street in a few minutes walk. Another couple minutes walk or short drive leads to a shopping center with Safeway supermarket (big), coffee shops, deli, bakery and other shops and eateries.

COVID 19 has made it necessary to shut down these venues for now:
For music in the area, the main venue's are Kuumbwa, Moe's Alley, The Rio, The Catalyst, Flynn's (formally Don Quixotes) and Golden State Theater, and in the summer the Santa Cruz Beach Boardwalk has free concerts, then there's also the local Santa Crux Derby Girls. Some highlights for incoming local events can be found in the local Good Times newspaper and the ve
host_about: We love traveling, meeting other people to learn about them and where they're from, cycling, music, wine tasting and playing outdoors. What's not to like about that?

description: Monthly rental only.  Great location for access to beach, mountain biking and hiking trails, and as a base for exploring Monterey Bay.  No phone in unit - guest must have cell phones.  Fully furnished with all kitchen needs.
host_about: Retired from Silicon Valley and living in hometown of Bozeman, Montana with a vacation home in Santa Cruz, CA.  Avid cyclist-road, mountain, & cyclocross, sometimes triathlete and nordic skier in winter. Foodie that loves exploring new eateries with friends and family. Like active vacations with lots of hiking, cycling, skiing, or water sports.  Love both mountains and sea shores.

name: Romantic getaway to Seascape Resort
description:
Lovely villa at the luxurious Seascape Beach Resort, Monterey Bay. End Unit villa with 2 master suite upstairs. Gorgeous views of the ocean and pool. Walk to the beach, enjoy the outdoors! ** COVID restrictions - usage of pools may be limited to number of people. Hot Tubs are closed during the pandemic.

The space
We carefully considered many other units before buying this unit. The end unit villas in this building has the most privacy. We do not have another unit below us or above us. There is no neighbor on the right side so we have many many windows which let in a lot of sun and breeze. Compare this to the middle units which have no windows even in the bathrooms or kitchen.
This unit is conveniently located near the pool and has views of the pool, ponds and the ocean. We have remodeled the unit (March 2018 and March 2020). Enjoy beautiful wood-tile floors downstairs, sparkling quartz fireplace surround, updated kitchen with stainless steel appliances. All
host_about: I come from tropical Malaysia. I live in West San Jose. My passion is real estate so it is only natural that I am a real estate broker. I started managing my own rental properties since 2004. I also manage rental properties for my clients. I want every rental experience to be a good one.

name: Brite n cozy bungalow near downtown
description:
1920's bungalow located within easy and safe walking distance to boardwalk, beach and downtown. Quiet and peaceful back yard with hammock, hot tub, outdoor shower and a trampoline for the kids. Off street parking for two vehicle included.

The space
Hardwood floors, pocket doors, laundry, open floor plan and a cozy loft with a queen mattress make this space unique. Hot tub and outdoor shower with hot water a bonus!

Guest access
You'll have the entire house and yard.
host_about: Married with a loving family.
amenities: ["Long term stays allowed"]

name: Romantic Treehouse in the Redwoods
description:
Suspended in a fairy ring of giant redwood trees, this treehouse is the ultimate romantic retreat. This large two room suite designed by an architect has spacious decks for lounging, a living room with a skylight and a luxurious four poster king looking out over the trees. Your stay includes a "wake up tray" delivered to your hoisting basket daily, a full farm breakfast, complimentary chocolates, sparkling water and flowers. Perfect for special occasions, honeymoons, and romantic reconnections.

The space
We have high hygiene standards at our very small 4 room BnB. In response to COVID-19, we are following best practices of increased cleaning and disinfecting from the CDC, Santa Cruz Health Department and the California Hotel and Lodging Association. We use approved CDC cleaners and steam sanitization of soft goods like pillows and comforters. Public spaces are disinfected frequently during the day. Guestrooms and entries are widely separated and breakfast servic
neighborhood_overview: Very rural area with pastures and redwood forests. Do not attempt to find this on your own, call for directions in advance. Just 3 miles to Pacific Ocean Beaches, 20 minutes to the conveniences and dining of Santa Cruz. Farm markets and U-Pick Berry farms close by. Hiking trails with views of the ocean or deep exploration of the redwoods close by. Or just walk over to the local vineyard for wine tasting.
host_about:
My love of food, cooking, wine and art has lead me on a lifelong journey. Years ago, I was a restauranteur in Chicago, then a full time studio potter, then a career in corporate sales and marketing.

I've traveled extensively, usually on a quest to find indigenous, traditional regional foods. Desert beans in India, grilled squid from a street vendor in Hong Kong, fresh rambutan in Thailand, black mole in Mexico, and hay soup in Austria are just a few memorable tastes. I am inspired by these experiences and I cook with international flavors.

A few years ago, I began to dream about having a farm where I could produce more of the foods, meats, and wines that I love. That dream came true when we bought FlipJack Ranch. Ranch life suits me, waking up to gather fresh eggs, cuddling the baby chicks and baby bunnies,  walking out to see the garden with a cup of coffee in hand. The whole 'farm to table' thing is real here on the ranch and the sustainable, organic and free range food products are my inspiration for daily menus. I love to forage too, here or nearby,  bringing back mushrooms, salad greens or mussels for the table. 

As a traveler myself, I value warm hospitality and those little things that make a stay memorable. I love it when I can go to a place and just unwind, assured that everything is there and I can just relax. I hope to make your stay with us memorable.

name: 500 feet from the ocean/Rio del Mar
description:
The Coast Queen is a wonderful house for a pleasant getaway to the coast for the weekend. It's a short 2 minute walk to the beach providing a great anchor for days at the beach, yet it's only a few miles from Santa Cruz. We're two minutes from a deli, restaurant, coffee shop, and corner store. Only a little bit further you can find many more restaurants, a grocery store, and Aptos Village. We're also very close to Nisene Marks and other wonderful hikes.

Guest access
This is a stand-alone home, and it's all yours!

Other things to note
We are open to allowing pets, but you must contact us prior to booking to discuss details. We do have a pet policy that you must adhere to. NOTE: If you bring a pet but do not ask us in advance, you will be fined a minimum of $200.
neighborhood_overview: Rio Del Mar beach is two flat minutes away, as are a few shops. Close by is everything else you might want!
host_about:
Combined Myriam and Mikey have lived in Santa Cruz for over 35 years. We have 3 young children ages 3, 5, and 7, and spend a lot of our free time tromping in the forests here in Santa Cruz, running, going to the beach, gardening, and reveling in large cooking projects using our local bounty of available foods.

We purchased this property  to have as a getaway for us and our friends, and vacationers like yourself. This property is so close to Rio del Mar beach, so it's just a short 2 minute walk back home if you forget sunscreen, or you want to cook up lunch, etc. The house is comfortable, with modern, brand new amenities. An extensive total remodel was just recently completed, so all of the appliances, bathroom fixtures, etc are nearly brand new.

This house is a perfect home for a family or 1 or 2 couples to have a relaxing weekend so close to one of the best (if not the best!) beach on the central coast. You can walk this beach for miles in either direction, it is not very crowded, and the weather here is never too hot and never too cold. Rio del Mar feels like a small beach town, yet it is 10 miles to Santa Cruz, and less than 40 miles from the Silicon Valley.

name: Downtown Santa Cruz Walk Up
description:
Welcome to our Shangra La on the second story of our beloved building. A set of 24 stairs brings you to our upstairs artist flat. Enjoy the energy, music, shops and dining. PLEASE NOTE: Our building was built in the 50's. THIS SPACE IS OLD AND FUNKY AND NOT FOR EVERYONE. Cracks in walls, paint splatters on floor, used furniture. Can HEAR THE music from unit next door. Walls are thin and sound travels from neighbors. Please DO NOT BOOK WITH US if you need a perfect home.

The space
NOTES REGARDING COVID-19:
We are offering our home for short term rental. Your safety and the safety of our team and community is paramount to us right now. We have taken the added precaution for deeper cleaning after every stay. If you are concerned about who has been in the flat before you then we advise to hold off on booking. We are all doing our best to provide an exceptional experience and a home away from home right now. And as we all know, please wash hands and stay home saf
neighborhood_overview: OUR NEIGHBORHOOD ROCKS!!!! Cathcart Street is the center of town for those who work and live here. Go to Lupulo craft beer house for a fun atmosphere and great tapas. Hulas next door is fantastic with everything you need for a California-Hawaiian surf experience with great food and drinks. The 515 restaurant at the end of Cathcart has an outstanding happy hour and food. Go upstairs and lounge with the best mixologists in town. Rent a bike at Spokesman or get a treatment at Rare Bird Salon. Our neighbor Old School Shoes is fantastic. Please mention Ahnalisa from the Cathcart rental sent you! Santa Cruz Farmers Market across the street every Wednesday. We have a list of additional, excellent shops and dining adventures in the unit. Everything downtown is lively and fun. Shuttle to Beach Boardwalk every 1/2 hour in front of New Leaf Market on Pacific Street a block away from April through September.
host_about: Coastal Californian. Lover of travel, design, art, music, film, garden, food and many other forms of creativity. We design and build for a living in Pacific Grove between Monterey and Carmel. Weekends are spent hiking in Big Sur or Marin, exploring San Francisco, surfing in Santa Cruz and annual trips to the Sawtooth mountains in Idaho to ride Peruvian Paso's with family friends. Hard work pays off.

name: Clean and modern cottage in nature
description:
Our cute cottage has a sitting area, a full kitchen, a full bath with tub and shower, as well a private bedroom. The space is across the driveway from the main house, but it extremely private. Manresa State beach is 1 mile away.

The space
This special space is a great place to recharge. We're easy to find from the freeway but tucked away in nature. We're about 20-30 minutes from downtown Santa Cruz and the Beach Boardwalk.

Guest access
Enjoy coffee in the private backyard patio, or on the shared deck.

Other things to note
There's only room for one car. The studio can accommodate 2 adults. The couch folds down into a futon so additional children may be allowed.

Manuel's - Mexican
Burger - great array of burgers

Seascape market is a small grocery and is right next door to Full of Beans Coffee and a liquor store.
Deluxe Market is another choice with more options

host_location: Santa Cruz County, California, United States
host_about:
I am a professional circus performer and coach. My partner produces music and we love our quiet home in La Selva!  We love traveling to Costa Rica and Thailand and we spoil our 3 cats!

We love having adventures but also appreciate a quiet and comfortable place to have as a home base to recharge.
