name: Seacliff House -  near Seacliff Beach!
description:
A quiet and relaxing California beach house around the corner from the stepped path down to Seacliff Beach. It has 2 double beds in the back bedroom, and a queen in the master bedroom which includes a full master bath. There's a comfy sofa, gas fireplace, and flat screen smart tv in the living room. New refrigerator and dishwasher. The common bath has a shower over tub. Also has WiFi, cable TV, a gas grill & a sunny patio area in the backyard with outdoor furniture. Cert. #CO00593

The space
Welcome to our cozy beach house! This is a classic California beach bungalow (900 sq. ft.) situated above Seacliff beach. Walk out the front door, turn right at the next block and you will see before you the Beachgate path, which is a dirt path with steps down a hill to Seacliff beach. With the back windows open, you can hear the waves crashing at night. It is also only a short walk over to downtown Seacliff. There's just about everything you need there, from a gas
neighborhood_overview:
We love our quiet and friendly coastal neighborhood, and it's easy walking distance to the beach and to the hidden gem of downtown Seacliff with restaurants and other amenities.
You don't have to drive anywhere if you don't want to!
If you feel like hopping in the car, it's only a short drive to the Santa Cruz Beach Boardwalk, local wineries, and lots of other restaurant, shopping, and beach options in Soquel, Santa Cruz, Capitola, and Rio Del Mar. The Forest of the Nisene Marks State Park, and lots of other parks, as well as all the other wonderful beaches that this area has to offer are also within a 5 to 25 min. drive.
Our favorite spots within walking distance are Manuel's Mexican restaurant (great margaritas) at 261 Center Ave., Ambrosia India Bistro at 207 Sea Ridge Rd. (really good Indian), Sno White Drive In at 223 State Park Drive (a classic, and be sure to try the dipped cones and the milkshakes), Pizza1 at 253 Center Ave (by the slice or whole pies), and
host_about: We are an active family with the world's best kids.   We love to explore new places, and have traveled by plane, train, and bicycle in 17 countries around the world.  Long time small business and rental property owners.  I (we) are respectful of others' property and expect the same in return.

description:
Our spacious and comfortable beach house is a wonderful get away and just steps from the beach. The house is situated in a quiet community and is well appointed and decorated with everything you need to relax. Just bring your bags and enjoy the view.
You are renting two rooms with full use and access to the common areas in the house.( The owner will not be there.)

The space
Our beach house has been recently updated with new floors, paint and decorations. Its large and spacious. Good for a family or a small group of friends. We have two great rooms facing the ocean and a deck great for watching the sun rise or set. Great views!

Guest access
You will have full access of the house and may use any of our amenities, including wifi, cell booster, tv, and electric bbq.

Other things to note
Also, after you enjoy the ocean enjoy our outdoor shower for you to rinse off (thoroughly) before you come in the house. We have a s
neighborhood_overview: Our home is in a quiet neighborhood. The residents are either families or couples and tend to keep to themselves. While we have beach access (steps away), this is not a heavily traveled beach area as there is no beach access for those that don't reside here.
host_about: We are a family from the Bay Area.  By weekend we are outdoor enthusiasts and love what the California out doors has to offer.

name: Cozy Pied-a-Terre in Downtown Santa Cruz
description: Wake up feeling inspired by the cheerful interior of this bright home. The space features vaulted ceilings, a white and wood interior aesthetic, rich textures, contrasting patterns, pops of color, and access to a shared bamboo-lined backyard.
neighborhood_overview: The property is located in a vibrant neighborhood full of students and artists. The home is perfectly situated to explore downtown or take a 10-minute walk to the beach to discover famous surf spots.
host_about:
Santa Cruz has been my home for the last 30 years. I love its small-town feel, amazing events, vibrant food culture, and breath-taking scenery. 
In my spare time I enjoy gardening, deepening my yoga practice, cooking with family, and taking my dogs on walks along the water or in the mountains.
Welcome to Santa Cruz. I hope you love it as much as I do!

name: Charming Seacliff Beach Rental
description:
Private entrance to a small attached cottage,clean,safe,quiet,relaxing space. Max TWO ADULT guests *(NOT baby proof),ONE CAR. Furnished w/ love. DOUBLE bed in the bedroom & TWIN daybed/couch in living room, private bathroom, kitchenette w/microwave, fridge, electric water kettle & French press, *NO TV Great walking neighborhood @1/2 mile walk to Seacliff Beach & good restaurants.

***Please read more DETAILED DESCRIPTION (Space) before you decide to book. E-mail with any questions. Thanks.

The space
This is a great place to just stay in and relax or to use as an in-and-out home base for day trips for all the incredible activities our area has to offer. It is a small (270 sq.ft.), quiet, calming, comfortable and restful place to be. UNFORTUNATELY, we are not baby-proofed, so it is not a suitable environment for babies and young children. NO PETS, Please. Private entrance, small bedroom (80 sq.ft) with a DOUBLE BED, single TWIN daybed in living ar
neighborhood_overview:
This is a great, safe neighborhood. You can enjoy walking to the beach, going for a meal, a burger, pizza...or simply an ice cream cone. Whether you are interested in beach going, sightseeing, antique shopping, flea marketing, monarch butterfly viewing, or just good restaurants-you will find them all in and around our area you can walk, bike, drive or take public
transportation. It is a short walk down the street to a bench overlooking the ocean-great place to watch the sunset! We have added our own book of fun places in the neighborhood and beyond if you ever feel the need to venture out of your room!

name: 1 mi. to beach & 2 mi. to Redwoods
description:
** Please note a TOT (Transient Occupancy Tax) of 11% of your total, must be received in cash or check @ time of check in. Airbnb doesnt collect this charge for Santa Cruz City hosts.
We have built a beautiful, eclectic, comfortable home to live and for you to visit! Italian inspired plaster walls, quality recycled materials used to build and decorate. We add extra touches to help you feel right at home.
Front porch to relax after a long day

The space
We built our home from the ground up and take great pride knowing it is one of a kind. We've used recycled materials and paid great attention to originality and detail. We enjoyed collecting and decorating our home with original art pieces.

We have 2 non-allergenic dogs in our home; however your room is always off-limits to them. Your room has its own private entrance to our home (we always use the back door). We promise the futon (large double / slightly smaller queen) is as comfortable as
neighborhood_overview:
We live on a dead end street.
Due to that, parking can be interesting. There is non-permitted street parking.
Please do not park in our driveway- unless we have discussed a plan to share that spot.
We know all of our neighbors and we look out for each other. We feel strongly in this day and age, it is important to know and engage with each other.

We are a bike ride away from downtown and the historical Santa Cruz Beach Boardwalk. We are also only a short distance to some of the best mountain bike areas California has to offer! We are one mile to the closest beach and two miles from the redwoods.

Santa Cuz is known for its surfing, road and mountain biking, Monterey Bay sea life, artist community, sustainable and organic cuisine, and a laid back, yet responsible way of life. We hope you will come visit and fall in love with Santa Cruz like we have!
host_about:
We have lived in Santa Cruz for over 25 years and we know Santa Cruz inside and out.
We look forward to showing you some of our favorite spots!

name: Davenport Landing Beach: Windsurfer's/Pet's Dream
description:
Steps to a world-class surfing/windsurfing, tide pooling and dog friendly beach. Watch ocean sunsets, whales, surfers from this custom-built (2003), lovingly-used, pet-friendly, family home. Home located on the ocean side of Highway One. Warm retreat experience, yet only 10 minutes to Santa Cruz.

The space
Watch the ocean sunset from the jacuzzi on the upstairs deck. Walk just down the street to a quiet, but well-known beach for surfing, windsurfing, off-leash dog frolicking, tide pooling, beach glass collecting, bonfires, and cliff strolling. The home is surrounded by State Protected open land and has no fencing, which leads to an incredible feeling of expansiveness and privacy. The neighborhood has only 5 other homes on the sand. You have a 360 degree view of green, rolling hills, cows, wildflowers, and ocean.

The home was constructed around the view and the natural setting. Look for natural finishes (bamboo, slate, granite, maple, zebra wood, et
neighborhood_overview: House is walking distance (one mile) to the town of Davenport, which has three restaurants, wine tasting room, a neighborhood store, a church, art galleries, and a post office.

name: Heavenly Mediterranean Beach House - Sand & Surf
description:
Gorgeous, spacious, bright & lovely Mediterranean home with Ocean Views and lovely open floor plan, perfect for relaxing, entertaining, playing Pool, Foosball or strolling (1/4 mile) to the spellbinding beauty of Seascape Beach & Resort, Sand Dollar Beach, & Rio Del, with ocean, sand, cliffs & Cypris trees at every glance! Relax on the expansive beaches of Aptos, Rio Del Mar, La Selva, and Santa Cruz. Walk for miles and miles of sand or just enjoy a romantic sunset with a loved one.

The space
Stroll to the Beach, Seascape Resort and lovely Uplands from our spacious Backyard -- Where you'll find gorgeous homes, walking paths and an open space preserve with gorgeous views of Monterrey Bay! You'll also find convenient boutique shops, lovely foodie restaurants, cocktail bars, and the awesome Seascape Deli along the way. If you have little ones, you'll find the Seascape Park and Hidden Beach Park with swings, slides, benches and picnic tables just steps from the sa
neighborhood_overview:
Aptos is located on the “sunny side” of the Monterrey Bay in Santa Cruz County, and though it's one of the smallest counties in California, it contains the widest variety of beautiful scenery! We have magnificent mountains covered by towering redwood forests, long sandy beaches, and ocean cliffs. We are also a gateway to the Monterrey Bay National Marine Sanctuary. This area bordering the Monterrey Bay is truly nature’s playground. Learn what the name Aptos really means.

It is this incredible variety which makes the Aptos and the Central Coast such an exciting vacation destination with something of interest to everyone. Whether you stroll down to the Seascape Resort and shops visit one of our award winning wineries, hike in the Nisene Marks Forest (downtown), ride a roller coaster or a steam train, walk on the beach, or do it all, we wish you an enjoyable visit!

name: Lovely Tuscan Apartment Blocks from the Beach
description:
This is a lovely apartment with a separate entrance in one of Santa Cruz's best neighborhoods. With excellent biking and hiking ratings, our Tuscan-style "cottage" is quiet, yet only blocks from the beach and restaurants. Start with coffee in the morning from nearby Verge Coffee Roasters, and look from your private balcony to the courtyard below, with fruit trees and a fountain. Ideal for a couple, or two singles, or perhaps a family with up to two kids, the space is bright and cheerful.

The space
The Seabright neighborhood is one of the most desirable in Santa Cruz. It is generally the first to have the fog "burn off" in the summer, and has wide streets with a mixture of homes built over the last 100 years. Easy strolls to the beach, restaurants, the yacht harbor, and the famous Santa Cruz Boardwalk.

It is excellent for biking and hiking, with lovely trails within a 6 minute drive, or walk from the apartment to the harbor or Boardwalk. It rates very h
neighborhood_overview:
You're staying about five blocks from a broad sand beach nestled between the Santa Cruz Yacht Harbor and the Santa Cruz Beach Boardwalk. Easy walking distance to restaurants, pubs, and some groceries. About 5 minutes by car from Whole Foods and downtown Santa Cruz where you have lots of shopping and dining options. 10 minutes to Santa Cruz by bike. 12 minutes to Costco by car. Lots of organic food stores and chain supermarkets in the area.

Easy access to local wineries in the Santa Cruz mountains, several state parks, UC Santa Cruz, and wonderful hiking and biking trails. See: Wilder Ranch State Park, Henry Cowell State Park, and of course the Monterey Bay Aquarium.

UC Santa Cruz is 17 minutes away, and Cabrillo College is 12 minutes away. Monterey Bay Aquarium is 50 minutes south, and San Francisco is 90 minutes north.
host_about:
Susan and I live in Santa Cruz and we have raised five daughters here. We've been married for 33 years, and have been blessed as foster parents and adoptive parents for many years. 
We have been lucky to manage three properties that are a combination of personal and family homes. 
In Santa Cruz, we have a cute apartment on our property that has delighted guests for almost eight years. It gets rave reviews because of the location and the nice touches. 
In Aptos/Rio del Mar, we offer a beach house that my parents built in 1957. It's surprisingly contemporary, warm, and very reasonably priced compared to homes that are actually on the beach.
Finally, in Costa Rica, we have a gorgeous home that is on the beach, yet tucked away in the jungle. We have a great property manager in Costa Rica who helps our guests with any issues they have, as well as arranges tours.

We love to travel, and love using home swaps and Airbnb as a way to see the world. We've taken two sabbaticals to Europe, each time with four daughters. Great life experiences.

description:

The yard outside the entrance is fenced and well suited for dogs. Enjoy lemon/orange trees and our garden! On the other side of our fence there is an open greenbelt with walkways, perfect for dogs and people! ( Occupant must be able to walk a slight slope of slate steps to get to apartment.)

The space
We live on a private road so visitors that need to enter and exit at odd hours feel safe and secure in the neighborhood.

Guest access
The backyard is seldomly used by us and generally available as space for our renters. A washer and dryer is not available on the premises for guests, however we launder your linens and towels. You will text me and leave a basket at the bottom of our stairs and I will launder them in 24 hours. This helps renters to s
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is built in a circle with unique upscale homes on both sides of the street and a common area in the center. We are a little bit off the common thoroughfares, but only by about a mile.Neighbors are very friendly and nice. If you have a dog, it can play in the common area with other dogs under your supervision.We have great walking areas if you need to get some exercise.
host_about:
Jon and I have lived in California for over 35 years. We moved from Minnesota in our early 20's. We have lived in our home and this awesome neighborhood for over 25 years. We have raised three children, who are all currently  in college. We recently upgraded and remodeled the lowest level of our house into a separate unit.  We are excited to share this beautiful part of the country with others. The redwoods, the beach, great weather, (Website hidden by Airbnb) is all here! We are located just a mile and a half from  Seacliff Beach and 1/2 mile from Nisene Forest ...well known for its acres of hiking paths and bike trails in the redwoods. We live in a quiet neighborhood and this unit is best suited for 2-3 people who will give peaceful consideration to our gracious neighbors. We will consider pets. Our back yard is fenced in and the door of this apartment leads directly to this area.  We'd like to hear about them to evaluate if they are suited for the property.
As airbnb hosts we would like to provide our guests everything they need for an enjoyable and comfortable stay, including their privacy.

La Selva is a rare find as it contains a gated private beach including free private parking. The space
Enjoy a relaxing stay in a modern space with all the comforts of home. Only a short walk from the picturesque La Selva Beach bluff and ocean, our location is the perfect quiet and relaxing getaway in a classic Northern California coastal community. Centrally located approximately 15 minutes to the heart of Santa Cruz and 30 minutes from Monterey. When you aren't exploring the lovely surrounding areas, enjoy a spacious backyard patio complete with a large dining table, lounge chairs

name: quiet room w/kitchen; 3 blocks to downtown
description:
Cozy room with a comfy, queen size bed. Shared bathroom with one person: me. :) Free use of my spacious kitchen, dining table, living room, gas fire-place, balcony, and large front loading washer and dryer. Free parking space in a safe, gated lot and Free Wifi, (of course). A mere three block walk to the festive downtown-- a few blocks further and you're in the historic Boardwalk.

The space
No need to worry about keys - the lock is keyless. Show up at whatever time is convenient for you after 5pm, simply punch in the code and you are in. (Early check ins are possible if you let me know a couple days in advance.)

Once inside, feel free to relax and unwind on the sofa, maybe even turn on the gas fire place and get cozy in front of the fire... Just do keep in mind the longer you make yourself available, the higher chance you will have of a furry, feline friend joining you. (Spooky.)

**Special Note: Please be aware that I do no
neighborhood_overview:
My home is in a very convenient location: about a 3 1/2 block walk to the lively downtown area, and across the street from the sunny little River Street cafe that serves wholesome, organic meals till 5pm, as well as the Patagonia Outlet. I am also half a block from numerous eateries and shops, including Shun Feng Chinese Restaurant, Chipotle, Cost-Plus World Market, and Ross-- in case you need to grab anything for the beach last minute-like. The historic Boardwalk is a mere 15 minute bike ride away, (a 30 min walk) and Pogonip is a 5 minute car ride away-- Santa Cruz city's own local, hiking spot in the woods-- with quite a few scenic trails to explore.

My home is right off the freeway too, so it is extremely easy and quick to get to-- a relief when you are tired and just want to rest instead of drive through numerous mazes in town.
host_about: I am an elementary school teacher who loves to stay active-- whether its running along West Cliff, snowboarding during winter, hikes in the local SC woods, dancing with friends, or anything else that strikes my fancy.  My latest passion:  hot yoga! <3

host_about:

name: Aptos Vacation Home
description:
Welcome to our Aptos Home. This bright, private 3 bedroom, 2.5 bath home located in the Rio Del Mar area offers a retreat like setting with all the modern amenities. A great home base for Monterey Bay and Santa Cruz Area exploration and adventure.

The space
Our home features hardwood and tile floors throughout, vaulted ceilings, comfortable furnishings, modern kitchen plus master and guest bathrooms.
The upstairs is an open floor plan. Relax, enjoy the quiet and take in the wonderful mountain view.
There are comfortable sitting areas for conversation, reading, listening to music or watching TV. You can also use the brightly lit desk area. The dining table seats six.
The kitchen is modern with all the features to prepare great meals, from morning coffee or smoothies to gourmet dinners. If you prefer to BBQ, the grill is conveniently located on the deck behind the kitchen.
Downstairs you’ll find three bedrooms: an en suite large master b
neighborhood_overview: Our home is conveniently located with easy access to a wide variety of activities.  Close to Nisene Marks Redwood forest, (hiking or biking), to Seascape Golf Course and minutes to long stretches of white sand Aptos beaches.  You can also enjoy fine dining, local wineries and world class entertainment.  Each day promises a new adventure in every direction!

name: Quiet Cottage
description:
An inviting light and clean studio cottage getaway in the heart of the upper westside; easy access to the university, mountain biking, ocean and trees.

The space
Clean and well-appointed cottage nestled in our lovely backyard, away from street noise. This studio has everything you would need for a weekend getaway, post-doc short-term residence, or sabbatical. The cottage sits about 50 feet from our house. The backyard is a shared space where you may hear our children playing.

In the main room there is a queen-sized memory-foam bed, a large closet, small sitting nook and, a desk. The fully equipped gourmet kitchen is sunny and bright. There are two dining areas; both inside and through the french doors onto the private patio. The bathroom is clean and has a shower stall. All linens and towels are provided.

You will find our property situated on the upper westside of Santa Cruz. We are close to beautiful parks and all of the things that m
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is very quiet with easy access to the university, nature and downtown Santa Cruz. The best of all worlds.
host_about:
I live in Santa Cruz, CA where we spend a great deal of times outdoors; biking, swimming, and visiting the redwoods.  Before children, I traveled the world, something I hope to do more of when our boys 8 &10 are a bit older.   I  am a teacher here in Santa Cruz.

I love design, art, nature, good food, music, gardening, cooking, and being a parent.  I  pride myself on being very neat and organized. We take great care of our environment and find pleasure in doing so.

name: New Modern Light filled Studio
description:
Beautiful new private studio apartment above the garage of the main house. Great central Santa Cruz location just 1.5 mi from our sunny, warm Live Oak beaches with easy access to downtown and Capitola.

The space
We've recently renovated our place, and we think you'll be instantly comfortable here, and will enjoy all that Santa Cruz has to offer! You will enter through the garden and access the studio via the strairs. Once inside you will notice the openness and airy feeling of the 450 sq ft studio space which has a full kitchen and beautiful modern bathroom. We provide towels as well as linens for the comfortable queen sized bed. A futon couch folds out to accommodate one extra adult or two children. Washer and dryer is available to those staying 5 nights or more. Please note that there is no microwave and no TV though we do have very fast wifi so streaming to your computer is not a problem.

Guest access
The full studio is all yours.
T
neighborhood_overview: Close to the warm Live Oak beaches and world famous Pleasure point surf breaks. Minutes from great single track so bring your Enduro or your cruiser  for a tranquil ride along the cliffs.

Relax on the balcony with ocean view, enjoy the pool and spa, or spend the day at the beach. Restaurant on site, Seascape Village across the street.

Enjoy a round trip walk along West cliff drive or the roller coaster at the boardwalk, lunch on the wharf, or drive about 5 miles North on beautiful HWY 9 to Roaring Camp and enjoy a train ride through the Redwoods or a zip line ride. You can also enjoy some local wineries which are in walking distance,  variety of fine dining, and a unique outdoor mall along Pacific ave. Please note some of these activities may be seasonal and some will require driving to get there. Many beaches and beautiful drives to explore.

We are both very active...hiking, walking, biking, and camping with the horses. We enjoy cooking and eating healthy meals with a good bottle of wine. We also love to go to the movies and are also avid (Website hidden by Airbnb) favorite book so far " Girl with the Dragon Tattoo" trilogy.

name: Hawaiian Beach House-1 block beach-Family Friendly
description:
The dates of Mon, June 28th to Sat, July 3rd is a 5-day minimum. All other summer weeks are a minimum of 7 days.

Views of the ocean and 3 min walk to the beach. Two bedrooms, two bathrooms, a spacious layout with a large eat-in kitchen great room, formal dining room, living room with fireplace, along with an outside deck with a fire pit
This house is ideal for family get-togethers.
Discounted pricing on week-long stays is available.
On holidays (Xmas & New Year) we have a 7-night minimum.

The space
This stylish cottage beach house has a great room that walks out onto a split-level deck. Have dinner on the upper porch with a view of the ocean and lagoon. The lower deck has a BBQ and a large picnic table for additional dining.
Amenities include a full gourmet kitchen, fireplace, plasma TV with VCR/ DVD player, gas BBQ, washer and dryer, linens, down comforters, feather pillows and towels, both beach and bath towels. A security d
neighborhood_overview:
The house is centrally located to all the attractions in Santa Cruz.
Three miles away is the main attraction in Santa Cruz, the California Beach Boardwalk. The boardwalk has rides, events and attractions right on the beach. One mile away is Twin Lakes Beach. There you will find the Yacht Harbor, which offers beach volleyball, kayaks rentals and wonderful restaurants also on the beach. Two miles in the opposite direction is Capitola. Capitola is a quaint beach town, with many restaurants and boutique shops. Pleasure Point, which is a popular surf area and 41st Ave, which is filled with restaurants and surf shops, is 1 mile away.
Santa Cruz is apart of the Monterey Bay, which has endless possibilities for sight seeing. One of the most popular is the Monterey Bay Aquarium in Monterey and Carmel, which is 45 miles away.
Silicon Valley is 30 min to 1 hour away depending on which town you want to go to. The other benefit to the house is the new Levi stadium is 35 minut

name: Vintage Creekside Hideaway – Walk to Henry Cowell
description:
Do you love glamping? Our cozy vintage 1948 Boles Aero trailer is sheltered by a fairy ring of coast redwoods. In this charming creekside forest setting, you two will be just two blocks from the entrance to Henry Cowell State Park.

Walking distance from Roaring Camp, Fern River Resort, and Felton Guild outdoor cathedral for wedding guests.

The space
Our 14' vintage trailer is perfect for two people, with a brand new memory foam mattress (6’-2" x 4’-1", or 1.88m x 1.25m), dinette seating area, and the original icebox (not refrigerator), sink, and built-in match-lit propane stove/oven all in excellent working order.

The trailer is under cover and is hooked up to full power, including heat, and has its own fenced patio sitting area and garden. Private half bath with an open air shower/tub on connected covered porch, a few steps from the trailer's front door in your secluded garden.

Guest access
Living space within the
neighborhood_overview:
When staying in our trailer, you two will have easy access to the best Felton and nearby Santa Cruz have to offer!

Henry Cowell State Park: 5 min walk
Monty's Log Cabin, closest bar: 5 min walk
Wild Roots Market, health food store: 15 min walk (2 min drive)
The Cremer House, best restaurant in Felton: 15 min walk (2 min drive)
Hallcrest Vineyards, closest wine tasting room: 20 min walk (4 min drive)
Roaring Camp Railroads: 20 min walk (8 min drive)
Santa Cruz: 20 min drive via Highway 9
Davenport, closest beach with no crowds: 30 min drive via Felton Empire
host_about:
We are a young(ish) couple living in a 1937 summer cabin in the redwood forest and mountains above Santa Cruz. We have a daughter Lucy, born March 2019. She sometimes joins our travels.

Nate is engine house manager at a local railroad, Brianna is a transportation planner. We love tending vegetables and flowers, sailing, cooking lavish meals, long hikes with our puppy, getting lost, wine tasting (including in a brown bag), reading in the sunshine, and most of all traveling! We've visited dozens of countries all over the world, but are also excited to discover new places close to home.

When you stay in our trailer, expect to find a warm, laid back space with lots of old books, animals, sunshine, music on the record player, and way too many kinds of tea. We love our home and our land and are excited to share it with you.

name: Gorgeous View! Between Beach and Mountains
description:
Don’t miss this beach town favorite! Lovely 2-story home. Peaceful surroundings, very safe neighborhood. Breathtaking view of Corralitos mountains. 5 min. drive to beach & mountains, restaurants, shops, groceries. 20 min to Downtown Santa Cruz. Safe neighborhood. Comfortable beds! NOTE: no TV/dishwasher; 2-car limit; U need 1 review & must be 25 & up. Please See Homeshare description below: host lives in the home when it's not being rented.

The space
[***Welcome to a Great Home-Share! See below for what to expect if you haven't stayed in a Home-Share before*****]
This peaceful 2-story home is on a large property that’s restful, private, and surrounded by nature. The neighborhood is situated on a lovely hillside that looks out over the beautiful Santa Cruz and Corralitos mountains. Bedrooms are all downstairs; kitchen, dining room and living room are upstairs. 2 decks, One on each level. There’s a slightly narrower than average staircase. There are also 8 st
neighborhood_overview:
Wonderful neighborhood at the top of a hill overlooking the ocean and the mountains. Cul-de-sac is tucked away where few know it's here.No through traffic, nice and slow, everybody knows everybody and keeps an eye out for each other. Very safe, Very friendly. The Town of Aptos has several independent cafés, plus Pete's coffee and Starbucks. Some of the most beautiful beaches on the Central Coast are here: deep, wide, quiet, and bordered by beautiful cliff-scapes.
The quaint village of Capitola is a 10 minute drive down the Pacific Coast Highway. Dozens of cute shops and restaurants along a pretty beach and Harbor.
The beautiful forest of Niscene Marks State Park is 5 minutes from here. Hike all day in oak, Evergreen, and Redwood forest: gorgeous! Both easy and rigorous hikes there.
Famous and fabulous downtown Santa Cruz and beach boardwalk are a 20 minute drive down Pacific Coast Highway. Buzzing with activity, fine arts, music, movies, street performers, our best
host_about:
(profile photo: sharing famous Abbot Pizza "salad pizza" with my  niece in Venice Beach, California")
I absolutely love living in Santa Cruz -- how did I get so lucky? Sharing my home is a real pleasure, and so is getting to see a little slice of the world through the eyes of my guests. I enjoy playing tour director and socializing, or giving people space to bask in the peace and beauty of my home and gorgeous surroundings.
When you're here you can share lots of food I make available. Coffee, tea, toast, jam, and all your basic kitchen stuff like butter, olive oil, spices. Use cupboards / fridge for your food. Join forces and share occasional meals when we catch each other on the same schedule.  Lounge on the deck and wile away another day in paradise. It's a five minute drive to good food, deluxe markets, plain ol' safeway, lots of cafes, and best of all spectacular beaches and mountain hiking. Cute beach-village 10 minutes away is Capitola, tons of novelty shops, art, jewelry etc.
Hope to have the chance to host you for some R&R in our little slice of heaven.

description:
Your home away from home!!

Private sunlit studio-room attached to our historic farm-style family home. Located Downtown Santa Cruz, half-mile from the Beach Boardwalk, Main Beach, Municipal Wharf and West Cliff Drive.

*This is a Non-smoking property*

We pay the 11% transient tax which is included in your room rate.

The space
* Public Health links are below*

neighborhood_overview:
Located in a neighborhood at the south-end of Downtown Santa Cruz, close to schools, the beach, dining and shopping.

Leisurely walk to downtown, Boardwalk, Wharf, Cowell’s and Main Beach. Great groceries, farmer's market, cafes, and restaurants within walking distance. Fun bike ride to West Cliff or to the Santa Cruz Harbor. There are two bike shops close by offering bike rentals.
host_about: We are a family of four who enjoy hosting Airbnb guests from around the world! Our farm style family home is located downtown Santa Cruz. We are only a short 5-10 minute walk to the beach! We enjoy travel to Hawaii, Mexico and of course California!

***Please READ Detailed Description Space And Environment ***before you decide to book. E-mail with any questions. Thanks.

The space
We have a private apartment, attached to but closed off by a locked door for guests who would like a safe, clean, lovely spot to call home while they are visiting the Santa Cruz area. Unfortunately, we are not baby-proofed, so it is not a suitable environment for babies and young children. NO PETS, please. We will provide you with a folder of guest information with: good places to eat and visit during your stay and contact information. We will als
neighborhood_overview:
This is a great, safe neighborhood. You can enjoy walking to the beach, going for a meal, a burger, pizza...or simply an ice cream cone. Whether you are interested in beach going, sightseeing, antique shopping, flea marketing, monarch butterfly viewing, or just good restaurants-you will find them all in and around our area you can walk, drive or take public
transportation. It is a short walk down the street to a bench overlooking the ocean-great place to watch the sunset! We have added our own book of fun places in the neighborhood and beyond if you ever feel the need to venture out of your room!

name: Cottage over Mountain Pond!
description:
Enjoy a plush one bedroom bungalow with separate living room, full bath, rustic pinewood floors and wall paneling (harvested on property), perched on a hill next to our orchard, in a large park-like setting with a view of our pond.

The space
Enjoy healthy mountain living -- ten acres of native forests, meadows, a beautiful garden and a pond!

The cottage is on a little hill overlooking our own pond, and sits next to our fruit orchard. The living room and bedroom windows are west-facing and get plenty of light. There is lots of privacy and distance to the other units on the property. The interior is rustic but very new and bright, with your own wood burning stove and electric radiant heat.

There is no kitchen, but we do offer a microwave, small refrigerator, sink and coffeemaker with coffee.

Our water is tested clean -- delicious well water from our property.

For our cool mountain nights we can heat the cottage us
neighborhood_overview:
We are in the mountains surrounded by redwoods, meadows and a winery. 1 mile up the road is an ecological preserve with great hiking. It is 3 miles down the mountain to a nice beach. The roads around us don't have a lot of cars so the area is great for bicycling. Go north on Highway One and you are at Davenport, an old whaling town with a nice restaurant and another nice beach. Just further north on the coast is Ano Nuevo State Park, where the giant elephant seals raise their babies on the beach each spring. Also close by are Big Basin State Park (with old growth redwoods), Henry Cowell State Park and many other great parks.

And of course, we are only 13 miles north of the wonderful town of Santa Cruz.
host_about:
Hi, I'm Howard, the owner of the property.  My day job is investing in technology, and I do a lot of consulting business in China.  But my wife and I also have a magical place in the Santa Cruz mountains, amongst the redwoods, next to a great winery, and only 3 miles from the beach.   We have our own pond, and we have surrounded ourselves with fruit trees and floral gardens, which we hope you will enjoy.  When we are not around, our caretaker, Ed Olson, takes care of our guests.  

We hope to create a Shangri-la feel for our guests.  Totally relaxed in the mountains and nature, but with all the comforts of home.  We are also frequent travelers, so we know how important it is to feel at home when staying in new accomodations.

name: Zen Garden Sanctuary
description:
Catch the soft chime of a bell or lyrical note of water falling on water. Priv. entrance. Priv. bath, Sunny room w/ gated garden. Quiet neighborhood. Walk to ocean. UCSC, Marine Lab, wharf nearby. Wine tasting, pubs and restaurants. bike, hike, surf.

The price of this room includes a mandatory 11% occupancy tax required by the city of Santa Cruz.

The space
Enter the gate, passing through the Koi garden. Your retreat begins as you step into the secluded garden, open the sliding glass door and enter your sanctuary. You will find a kitchenette with fridge, microwave and coffee pot. Coffee/tea/snacks are available. A comfortable bed with natural bedding, a full private bath. A writing desk looks out the south facing window over the koi pond. Sunlight brightens the room through the day. Find yourself in a quiet space; listen to the music of water and chimes. Private keyed entry. Perfect for 1-2 people. Special arrangements can be made for longer stays f
neighborhood_overview:
Located on the far western edge of town, close to everything, but secluded from traffic and city congestion. This west side neighborhood is unique in Santa Cruz.

You will find great restaurants, enjoy picnics on the beach, discover local breweries and wine tasting within walking distance or a short easy drive. There is easy access to good food, weekly farmers market, yoga classes, meditation, hikes and ocean adventures.

Zen Garden Sanctuary is located just steps from West Cliff drive. A coastal promenade offering walkers, joggers, surfers room to move and observe the wildlife of the Monterey Bay.

Westside beaches, the Santa Cruz Wharf, the Light House, Steamers Lane, Natural Bridges State Park, and Seymour Marine Discovery Center are easily accessible by foot, bike or a short drive. Wilder Ranch is nearby with it's miles of spectacular hiking and bike trails and access to the north coast beaches. Downtown Santa Cruz is about 3 miles away, a short d
host_about: Arthur and I love sharing our environment with fellow adventurers. As frequent travelers, we  know what it is like to be on the road for long periods of time. Created  as a personal retreat, Zen Garden offers a peaceful place to return.  Coming home to the embrace of a welcoming, beautiful environment is always the best part of the journey. We offer our guests a safe, gentle place to land, to retreat and to explore–an environment you can enjoy as much as we do.  If Arthur is home, he  is  sure to share a moment with you or a tale of his recent travels around the world building community through rhythm. As a health care practitioner, I work to keep body, mind and spirit in balance. We are both writers and artists and enjoy sharing what we create with our visitors.

name: Santa Cruz Westside is the Bestside
description:
Our 1000 sq ft house (2b/1.5ba) is clean & comfortable. Indoors we have central heat, queen size beds in both bedrooms and a single fold out futon in the living room. Our sunny backyard has: a charcoal and gas BBQ, lawn, patio, deck, fire pit and a hot tub.

The space
House is recently remodeled and the open floor plan makes it feel larger than its 1000 sq ft. The kitchen features lots of counter space (recycled glass), dishwasher and a warming drawer (helpful when preparing multiple dishes). Flat screen TV in the living room is connected to a Mac Mini so you can easily access all your internet entertainment. TV channels are just the major networks (no cable, HBO, ESPN etc.). The full-bath has a shower (no bathtub). The half-bath is part of the laundry room. There is an abundance of outdoor living space with a 400 sq ft patio, 400 sq ft deck, plus a small lawn and two fire features (one gas and one wood).

Guest access
One off-street parking
neighborhood_overview: Santa Cruz is a vacation destination for just about every possible interest.  We have a great combination of easy access to the ocean and mountains.  The Monterey Bay National Marine Sanctuary is a playground for surfers and boating.  Monterey and its famous Aquarium are an easy day trip (only a 45 minute drive south). If forests and mountains are more your style, within a 30 minute drive from our house you can visit four State Parks and several county parks, including a world class disc/frisbee golf course.  Local farmers and restaurants specialize is organic and seasonal cuisine so we are also a foodie mecca - not to mention literally dozens of wineries (with at least 10 of those tasting rooms withing 1 mile of our house).  Downtown Santa Cruz has many shops and galleries, most of which are not chain stores which will help you find just the special something to remind you only of your vacation in Santa Cruz. San Francisco is also an easy day trip being only 80 miles/90 minutes away t
host_about: We like hiking, wine tasting and hanging out with our friends.

name: Fantastic Suite -- Ocean Ridge House
description:
Breakfast included. 5 minutes to a huge beach! Free pass to the many state parks and state beaches. Near Santa Cruz and Monterey. Deluxe master suite in a beautiful, unique, peaceful home. Spacious suite (291 sq. ft.) with private bath, high ceilings, skylights, desk and chair, HDTV with cable TV, and private view of trees. High open-beam ceilings, stained glass windows, gourmet kitchen, three decks with canyon views on 1/3 acre.

We have visitor brochures, maps and magazines for you to borrow.

The space
Welcome to our lovely home! We're perched on a hill above the Monterey Bay where you can hear the waves pounding at night, about a mile away as the crow flies. It is a 5-minute drive to the beach.

We offer a free pass to the local state parks and state beaches*. For one-night stays, guests can pick up the pass the morning of their arrival and use it for the day. The state parks and state beaches pass saves you a $10 parking fee at all state
neighborhood_overview: Quiet, tranquil neighborhood with natural beauty --  lots of mature trees including native oaks and Monterey pines. Wild areas are nearby and we have lots of bird life. We are on a quiet cul-de-sac (road with no outlet) so there is almost no traffic. We're on over 1/3 acre that is beautifully landscaped and has oaks and pines. The town just north of us is Aptos, which has cafes, several restaurants, grocery stores, Seascape Beach Resort (restaurants and shops) and Seacliff State Beach. Manresa State Beach is at the bottom of our hill (1.5 mile, 5-minute drive).
host_location: La Selva Beach, California, United States
host_about:
Hello! We live in Santa Cruz County near Manresa State Beach, and are excited about sharing our beautiful home and helping you enjoy the all that the Monterey Bay area has to offer. 

Ray loves to go out with his camera to capture local life, including surfers in Santa Cruz. Cathy is an artist, illustrator, and graphic designer. We both enjoy music, traveling, cooking good food and meeting fellow travelers.

name: Private suite in artist's home
description:
Beautiful views overlooking trees & water, private bedroom, private bath, private kitchen/sitting room.
We are in an ideal location for bird-watching and exploring nature. Seeing Great White and Snowy Egrets right in our Slough and along the nearby Trail. 10 minutes to the beach, 10 minutes to mountain trails, 15 minutes to Elkhorn Slough, 20 minutes to Santa Cruz, 30 minutes to Monterey. Sorry, no pets or children!

The space
The entire upstairs of our Townhome is yours, with its own bedroom, full kitchen, and full bath. The entrance to the Suite is through our main front door, and the upstairs hallway is open to our living room below. The bedroom, bathroom, and kitchen/sitting room each have doors for privacy.

Guest access
Access the home through our shared front door; the entire upstairs is at your disposal.

Other things to note
We have a resident cat and a small dog.
neighborhood_overview: There are many shops and parks within walking distance. Our home also borders a protected Slough with walking trails and some of the best birding in the world.
host_about: We are two artists, happy to share our home with sensitive and responsible adults. Sefla is an Open Studios artist focussed on abstract figurative painting in acrylics. She teaches and gives workshops locally, and her work is exhibited widely. Fred is a Teaching Artist, using string figures as performance art to enable children to become self-directed learners, and caring and compassionate peace-builders.

NO ANIMALS & NO SMOKING

neighborhood_overview: Santa Cruz is only 60 miles from San Francisco, 40 miles from Half Moon Bay, 27-30miles from Monterey and Carmel.  So, day trips to other interesting and beautiful places are very doable from our home.
host_about: We were born and raised in Southern California, near the beach,  moved to Sacramento, got married, and have raised our 4 children in the Sacramento area. After 20 years, it was time to get back to the ocean. So, we co-own this wonderful house in Santa Cruz with Lenore, Ken's mother, where we can all escape to for the wonderful weather and beautiful beaches. Santa Cruz is a fun and friendly town with so much to see and do. We look forward to having you as guests at our retreat by the sea!

Seascape Beach is located between Rio Del Mar beach and La Selva beach. Watch dolphins and sea otters at play during your morning walk, surfing during the day and enjoy bonfires on the beach at night.

This non smoking home is newly built and beautifully decorated with an excellent open airy floor plan. Master bathroom has double vessel sinks and a jetted tub with rain shower head. Wrap around slate balcony with outdoor furniture is waiting for you to enjoy a glass of wine or a morning cup of coffee. Kitchen is well equipped with gas stove, microwave, dishwasher and refrigerator with ice maker. Remote controlled gas fireplace in living room, built in flat screen TV, whole house audio system, dvd player, polish

description:
Entire top floor of the house served by a private entrance on top a set of stairs. A darling, bright, spacious apartment with all amenities.
I live here part of the year and then travel. My home is your home when I am gone.

The space
The apartment is located on the second floor and has a nice deck that take you to the front door. This is a No shoes house, so please leave them outside. Once inside there are windows or doors on almost every walls, which brings a lot of light into the space. The kitchen opens up to the dining room and the living room. There are not a lot of furniture just enough to bring you comfort. The second part of the house is a master bedroom with a large bathroom with tub. The laundry room is located on the bottom floor, at the bottom of stairway. Trash are also located downstairs to the front of the house under deck area. The trash is shared with downstairs tenants.

Guest access
You will have access to the entir
neighborhood_overview: The ocean is straight down the street. You can almost walk your eyes closed to the ocean. Aptos  beach one of the longest in Santa Cruz County. Never too crowded because there is so much space.
host_about: I am a genuine product of japan, born, raised, educated and lived the first half of my life there. In 1980, I moved to California with my now ex-husband and raised 2 children, and was adopted into the American culture. I appreciate expressions of all kinds – music, visual arts, dance, words.I like things that are aesthetically pleasing in shape, form, color and texture which I think is reflected in my cooking, my home and my garden. I love the creative process of taking different elements and creating something tasteful and elegant.

name: Privacy and Quiet in the Santa Cruz Mountains
description:
Quiet, private studio detached from main house. Located in a residential neighborhood in the Redwoods, close to Loch Lomond recreation area, Roaring Camp, and Henry Cowell State Park. A 20-minute drive to downtown Santa Cruz and local beaches. Shared bathroom in main house.

My partner Chris is a professional glass artist, so if you are interested in lessons or a tour of his Santa Cruz studio, that is available as an add-on!

The space
We call it the Zen Room because it has a shoji screen and a small collection of books that focus mainly on Buddhism but also include some other spiritual traditions. Microwave and teapot in room. Bathroom in main house. Use of the kitchen in the house is not included.

Perfect for a personal retreat, writing, thinking, and reading, but also located within a short distance to town and Santa Cruz area attractions.

Guest access
The room is completely private and removed from the main house.
neighborhood_overview: We're not far from downtown Felton, a charming little mountain community with  several restaurants, 2 markets (one is a  natural foods store with fabulous organic local produce), a great music venue (Don Quixote's), and a sweet new age shop/bookstore (Mountain Spirit). There is an amazing farmer's market on Tuesdays May - September. You could hike for days and days at the local parks and recreation areas, or enjoy a stroll through this mountain neighborhood if you don't feel like driving to a trailhead.
host_about:
Recently, my main travel destinations have been the Bay Area and the Eastern Sierras (usually for hiking). Last year I visited India for the first time, which was a real bucket-list destination for me. Other travel goals include Peru, Argentina, Bali, Greece, and Nepal. 

My day job is managing an honors program for first-generation university students. I love my work and feel so fortunate that I actually get paid to advance diversity and inclusion in higher education. My other interests include  yoga, meditation, literature, and the arts. 

I love travel and new experiences, but I'm a terrible traveler, because I can't stand to give up my habits (for instance, I insist on bringing my favorite loose-leaf tea, chocolate, two or three books....). I also pine for our two cats when I'm away from home, so I tend to rent accommodations where the hosts mention that they have pets or other animals on the premises.

neighborhood_overview: The house is in the surfing destination of Pleasure Point, Santa Cruz. A beach is two blocks away. Ride bikes to the cute beachfront town of Capitola. There are hiking and mountain biking trails around Santa Cruz, and Big Basin State Park is nearby.

name: Secluded Mountaintop Retreat With Ocean Views
description:
Fabulous family ranch on a REMOTE mountain meadow with plenty of space to enjoy the outdoors. Distant ocean views from every room in this retreat-like sanctuary in the Santa Cruz mountains. Great wildlife viewing and awesome sunsets. Good WiFi and privacy options for work-at-home guests.

The space
This family ranch is located in the beautiful hills above Corralitos in south Santa Cruz County. Hacienda de la Colinas, or Hilltop Hacienda, offers stunning views of the sea and the redwood-studded mountains. This is a retreat-like property perfect for guests seeking peace and serenity in a natural setting away from the hustle and bustle of city life. Please note that the ocean view is a distant one, and may not be visible if there is fog on the Monterey Bay coast. Summer can be particularly foggy along the ocean, although the hacienda is often above the fog bank.

There are three bedrooms, two and a half bathrooms and a large living space divided into
neighborhood_overview: The hacienda is located at the top of a sparsely populated mountain road.  We share the mountain top with a rafter, or flock, of wild turkeys that frequently visit our meadow.  There is a bobcat who hangs out on the meadow, while deer and hawks abound.  The hacienda itself is surrounded by a fence that encircles the house and gardens, so the wild life generally stick to the meadows and leave the garden areas for us humans.
host_about: Martin is a techie from England and Anne-Marie is a journalist from California.  We have two kids, two dogs and two cats.  Love to hike, bike, read and garden in our spare time.  We are international travelers, and have lived overseas for a large part of our lives.

neighborhood_overview: Feel like a local in our neighborhood.  The bungalow is in Seabright or  Midtown, one of the best locations in Santa Cruz.  Listen to the waves and sea lions during the quiet evenings.  Approcimately 10 minute walk/5 minute bike ride to the Santa Cruz Harbor, Arana Gulch open space for hiking, Frederick Street Park, and excellent local restaurants, entertainment, natural history museum, grocery store and all needed amenities. Seabright beach is close by too (15 minute or so bike ride).  Santa Cruz Beach Boardwalk and downtown are also a 15 minute bike ride/30-40 min walk away. Fun, Sun, Sand, and Surf are awaiting you.
host_about: I am a fifth generation native Santa Cruzan. I divide my time between my painting studio and my art therapy practice, which usually keeps me pretty busy. name: Beautiful Japanese home w/private in-law quarters
description:
Located in the Santa Cruz mountains, our home is surrounded by redwood trees and manicured gardens. Shinobeau, a vegan chef of healing cuisine will prepare a healthy Japanese breakfast using local organic vegetables and selected natural condiments. Additional meals provided for $25 (lunch or dinner including salad & desert for one person). We speak English and Japanese. 10-15 min. drive to 1440 Multiversity.

The space
Large house in the Santa Cruz mountains just minutes from the beach and Silicon Valley. Guests stay in large, private in-law suite with a loft, fireplace and a private bathroom with a heated Japanese "washlet" (toilet). Leather couches, large windows and plenty of room to spread out and relax...or work. Large deck with outdoor furniture for lounging under the stars. Clean mountain air and redwood trees surround you in this quiet enclave. Lots of singing birds and butterflies during the day. Dress warm since it gets chilly in the mountains! Please
neighborhood_overview:
The Glenwood area is located in Santa Cruz County and is registered as California Historical Landmark #449. Majestic redwood trees and mountain streams surround this former ghost town. You may see deer, wild turkeys, foxes, raccoons and other wild animals so please use caution...especially when driving on the winding mountain roads. Typically, you can hear owls during the night and see many different bird species during the day.

Head south to beautiful Santa Cruz, Monterey and Carmel or head north to the Silicon Valley, San Jose and San Francisco. We are very conveniently located.
host_about: Japanese vegetarian chef and organic cooking instructor for the healing cuisine of Wanowa.  Married with one beautiful teenage son.  We live in a beautiful setting in the Santa Cruz mountains surrounded by fern & vegetable gardens and a small fruit orchard.  We enjoy the outdoors and appreciate the natural beauty of life in California.  I teach Japanese cooking classes on a regular basis at my home and across California.

name: 260-1 Harbor Views
description:
Harbor Views is right across the street from the water with ocean and harbor views.

The space
Tastefully decorated the interior features 2 full bedrooms and bathrooms. The kitchen is fully equipped with dishwasher and microwave. Living room has TV with Digital cable, DVD and slider door to balcony deck with a Gas BBQ and patio table/chairs to enjoy the full views of the Yacht Harbor, lighthouse and ocean breeze. You are two SHORT blocks to one of the best local beaches, complete with fire rings, restrooms and Crows Nest and Palamar at the beach. Enjoy a ride on the Yacht Harbor Taxi over to Aldo’s for breakfast. You are within walking distance to the Famous Beach Boardwalk, Santa Cruz Museum, Seabright Brewery, Betty’s Burgers, Pacific Edge Climbing Gym and MORE. Condo offers carport parking for 1 car plus 1 Parking Permit for the Street.

Guest access
whole condo

Other things to note
NO SMOKING ALLOWED. PETS AL

name: 404 Clam Hut
description:
Come down to the Clam Hut and enjoy a relaxing stay!

The main floor features two ocean view rooms that are perfect for enjoying the sites, sounds, and smells of the beach.

The space
A shared bathroom is accessible from both rooms—fully equipped with a shower and tub combo, as well as a stacked washer and dryer.
Walking down the stairs, the ocean meets the eye from the living room windows. All dining can be enjoyed at the large dining table, situated in front of one of the large picture windows overlooking the beach. Watch for otters or dolphins, as they regularly visit Place De Mer beach!

For convenience, there is a full kitchen, with a microwave, a convection oven, a stove/oven unit and dish washer. A gas furnace fireplace, cd/tape player and bath are located on this level as well.

Walk out on the deck and enjoy the warm ocean breeze or use the gas barbeque to enjoy your dinner, as you watch the sun melt across the water and

description:

The space
This single-level home with three bedrooms and two full baths is a joy for the senses. Relax in the great room next to the cozy gas fireplace or choose to be part of the hub of action in a beautiful kitchen. The home opens up to a spacious private backyard where an inviting curtained cabana waits for you, a cozy space no matter what the weather brings. The landscaping compliments the spa-like retreat with bamboo plantings, unique garden sculptures, fire pit and hot tub. Just steps from the front door gate is the famous Beachgate Path where you can take a leisurely walk to Seacliff Beach, with miles of sand, picnic tables and esplanade. Black Pearl Cottage is a uniquely designed, beautiful beach house with spectacular views of the Monterey Bay and walking to Santa Cruz Harbor and Beach Boardwalk!

The space
Black Pearl Cottage is a uniquely designed, beautiful beach house with spectacular views of the Monterey Bay. Located in the heart of the Seabright neighborhood, this home is among some of the most historic beach homes in the Santa Cruz area. Cottage has landscaped garden with flowers and little pathways, plus patio furniture for sitting outside and gazing at the sea. Living room offers River Rock wood burning fireplace and full ocean views. Flat screen TV with Cable and DVD Player in Living Room, Satellite Radio, and High Speed Wireless Internet are also provided.  The master bedroom also has cable TV. The Black Pearl Cottage is located on the West side of the Harbor just a few short blocks to ride on the Yacht Harbor Taxi over to the Crows Nest for an oceanfront lunch or breakfast at Aldo's

description:
The beach house is 2000+ sq.ft. which includes original hard wood floors throughout the main floor; 3 bedrooms and 2 full baths; fully equipped kitchen; dining and living room; 2 decks in front with enclosed backyard. Heated outdoor shower too!

The space
Bedroom 1 (see photo) has queen bed, couch, satellite TV and a peekaboo ocean view. French door leads to the enclosed backyard.

Hall Bath 1 (see photo) has vintage blue tile, shower, separate tub.

Bedroom 2 (see photo) includes a twin bed with an additional twin pull-out trundle bed, large desk and French doors leading to the backyard.

Hall Bath 2 includes a shower and exterior door to backyard.

Bedroom 3 (see photo) is upstairs with open beamed ceiling, queen bed, ample floorspace to accommodate queen sized Aerobed which is provided in upstairs closet. This room has many windows and a set of French doors to deck where you can enjoy the spectacular ocean views. Leave th
neighborhood_overview:
La Selva Beach is a quaint and quiet little village that you will fall instantly in love with! It is centrally located to enjoy lots of wonderful family activities; which include great Golf Courses, Santa Cruz Beach Boardwalk, Monterey Bay Aquarium, Shopping in Santa Cruz, Aptos, Capitola or Monterey and many others. Not to mention the many, many wonderful local Restaurants and Wineries!

The sweeping views of the entire Monterey Bay and Breathtaking Ocean sunsets await you! The night lights of both Santa Cruz and Monterey are amazing!

Surfing or Fishing anyone? Then bring your board and pole! Manressa Beach is noted for the best waves in the entire Monterey peninsula. It is one of the most popular fishing spots as well. Or take a romantic walk along the beach and collect shells and sand dollars!

name: Romantic Retreat with hot tub near the beach!
description:
Are you looking for a restful, meditative or romantic retreat? This fantastically located, atmospheric and private guest house boasts a sleeping loft with skylights from which to listen to the surf, and a cedar hot tub set under a pepper tree. We are a block and a half from the beach, so it’s a perfect spot for surfers and guests who love to be outside.

The space
Take a stroll down the street to the cliffs of Pleasure Point where you can surf or view the surfers below. During the low tides, enjoy the rocks and tide pools. After your walk you can rinse off in the outdoor shower before you soak in the cedar hot tub. Enjoy sitting under the pepper tree to the sounds of the surf and wind chimes. Swing in a hammock to cool off.

The bungalow boasts Mexican tile floors, a romantic sleeping loft with skylights and a queen sized comfy yummy bed from European Sleepworks. Please note that you cannot stand in the loft, which most guests find cozy.` The livi
neighborhood_overview: Pleasure Point was recently named in Newsweek magazine as a prime destination spot!  Come see why.  It’s a great spot for a staycation and for people who want to work while away from home.
host_about: I am originally from the east coast and have lived in Santa Cruz for twenty years.  I love to walk on the beach with my husband and dogs, do yoga, dance, cook and spend time in nature.  I am also interested in spirituality.

name: Peaceful apt., garden setting, in the redwoods
description:
We've renovated our downstairs apartment into a private 1 bedroom with full kitchen, bathroom, walk in closet, laundry and livingroom. We are 1 mile from Henry Cowell State Park. 10 minutes to Santa Cruz and beautiful Pacific Ocean beaches. Easy access to Hwy 17 and the Santa Cruz Mountains. Get away and relax in our quiet, friendly, neighborhood without being isolated from all of the fun that Santa Cruz has to offer. We value your privacy. We have complimentary wifi.

The space
This apartment has been a rental since 2002 when we purchased our home. The apartment is spacious and private. You will have quick access to State Parks, the forest & beaches. We have renovated the apartment to be more open and functional. The living room has new laminate flooring and new furniture. The bedroom has a new queen bed and a large walk in closet. The bathroom has been updated with new counter, sink, and vanity. It has all you need for a weekend or weeks long stay.

<
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is private and off the main road which makes it quiet and peaceful. It's not uncommon to a have deer sightings during the day. Our neighborhood road dead ends, which keeps it kid friendly and safe. We are only 1 mile from town with easy access to grocery stores.
host_about: We have an active lifestyle outdoors and our neighborhood is family friendly. We have lived in Felton since 2002 and love all it has to offer: Tuesday Farmers Market, Henry Cowell State Park, Mountain Biking, Fall Creek, Surfing, Skating, Hiking... the list goes on. I have raised my son here and enjoy how close our community is. Don Quixotes offers a great music venue just down the street. You can also visit historic watering hole, Monty's Log Cabin. Life is too short so live it fully!

neighborhood_overview:
A very quiet neighborhood only steps from the ocean. Take a walk along West Cliff drive to access a number of world-class beaches, the Monarch butterflies at Natural Bridges State Park, or Santa Cruz lighthouse.

Local shopping, bakeries, breweries, restaurants, wineries, farmers market are all walkable, or a very short drive away.
host_about: Santa Cruz local born and raised but nomad at heart. I've traveled all over the world but Santa Cruz draws me back. I am fortunate to live in paradise and enjoy sharing it with others. I hope that your stay at our home reflects the love and time we've put into our space.

name: Pacific Ocean Mtn Estate- Retreats and Weddings
description:
Chalk Ranch overlooks Ano Nuevo Island and the Pacific Ocean, along a strip of California's most pristine coastline. Star-studded night skies, sunny days, fresh air, magnificent sunsets, and beautiful ocean and mountain vistas are noteworthy here. Our goal is to make your stay a delightful, hassle-free and productive experience. Come visit us soon!

The space
We are primarily focused on Retreats, Corporate Off-Sites and outdoor weddings. An additional event fee, which can range from $4,000 to $15,000, applies to Weddings.

We may also consider short or long term vacation rentals depending on the circumstances.

Additional fees also apply to client attendees not staying overnight as well as requests for early check-ins or late check-outs.

A recent client, a group of busy executives, some of whom live out of the country, had these comments:

"We recently held our executive offsite at the remarkable Chalk Ranch. The propert
neighborhood_overview:
Most parts of the coast between San Francisco and Santa Cruz experience frequent foggy conditions. The ranch is located in an area known as a 'banana belt', which is a micro-climate providing sunshine when other areas along the coast are fogged in.

The Ranch is convenient and centrally located in the Bay Area. Easy to get to, we are within a 45 mile radius of San Francisco, Silicon Vally and San Jose, Santa Cruz, Carmel/Monterey, and both international airports.

The ranch in centrally located and very convenient to most San Francisco Bay Area locations including SFO airport, mid-Peninsula, San Jose and San Jose Airport. A little farther away are Monterey, Carmel, Big Sur and Napa Valley. Most of the drive time is along the scenic, traffic-free California Coast.

name: Beachbreak Bungalow
description:
Our charming cottage is perfect for a romantic getaway or a family vacation. This hidden gem is located on a quiet cul-de-sac just steps from the 26th Avenue and Moran Lake Beaches with a large, beautifully landscaped backyard.

The space
The home has 3 bedrooms and 1 bath, with a queen sized bed in the master, a double bed in the 2nd bedroom, and a double futon bed in the third bedroom. The bathroom has a shower with a full bathtub. There is also an outdoor shower with hot water - great for rinsing off after a trip to the beach, and the kids always love it!

The large, beautifully lanscaped backyard is wonderful for a relaxing family BBQ where you can enjoy the company of family and friends or just relax and listen to the sound of the waves. The house is immaculately clean and well furnished with everything you need when you want to get away from it all.

Downtown Capitola with it's lively beachside restaurants and shopping is a short 5 minute
neighborhood_overview: This neighborhood is a hidden gem close to Pleasure Point - a great location for world class surfing as well as a beautiful place to ride bikes or take walks along the newly constructed path along the cliffs, overlooking the ocean. The house is just two short blocks to Moran Lake Beach, down a beautiful tree lined path.
host_about: Santa Cruz is our home away from home. This cottage, which we bought in (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) , has brought us many years of joy at the beach with our kids and our dogs. name: The Cottage-  1.5 blocks to awesome beach
description:
The Cottage is a fully equipped one bedroom just 1.5 blocks from Black's Beach.

The space
The Cottage is a perfect affordable home for a couple or small family, with all the amenities you will need for a memorable Santa Cruz adventure. The living room is especially inviting with comfortable furnishings and ambient lighting. A separate dining room easily accommodates 4 people and the adjacent kitchen has everything you need to prepare meals. The bedroom has a very comfortable (based on past reviews) queen bed with a skylight overhead. There is a sleeping nook off of the bedroom with a day bed which is an inviting spot to curl up with your favorite book and perfect for kids. We have also added a daybed covered in comfy pillows for reading or sleeping in the living room.

Guest access
Beautifully landscaped gardens and lawn make for a pleasing view from the dining room and kitchen. Fully fenced backyard with gas grill is a great place to enjoy
neighborhood_overview: LOCATION: The Cottage is located near Twin Lakes Beach and the Yacht Harbor, midway between Capitola and downtown Santa Cruz (both 10 minutes away). There are six fabulous restaurants within walking distance, ranging from a Hawaiian grille to a high-end Italian restaurant, and our personal favorite, Southwest-inspired Nuevo Grill. A short stroll down the beach will bring you to the yacht harbor where you will find the popular Palomar Mexican restaurant and the Crow's Nest. The Crow's Nest is a great place on Wednesday to watch the sailboat races or enjoy the sunset, a glass of wine and a bite to eat. Great appetizers! Also within walking distance is a corner food store, liquor store, deli, coffee house, video store and a farmers market on Sunday

name: Private Airstream Studio on the Farm
description:
This is a wonderful private space located just 5 minutes from Scott's Valley Dr. and 15 min from Downtown Santa Cruz/ the beach. We are located in the Santa Cruz mountains.

This is a remodeled vintage Air-stream with an additional living space built onto it. The property features a vintage farm vibe with modern upgrades, it has a beautifully landscaped fenced in yard with a large deck. The deck offers a wonderful place to BBQ or just enjoy the tranquility of being in the coastal redwoods.

The space
This space consists of a fully equipped kitchen (pots, pans, knives, dinnerware, basic spices, coffee maker, tea, olive oil, toaster, microwave, gas stove ,fridge, etc.), a full bathroom with a shower/ bath, it featurse two closets to hang your clothes during your stay equipped with hangers. There is a quaint dinning space for two in the front part of the Air-stream living space, which over looks the beautiful yard and onto the 100ft garden on the property.
neighborhood_overview: This is a wonderful neighborhood. If you would like to take a nice walk you can take a left down bean creek and enjoy the beautiful redwood scenery, at the bottom of the large hill just past the camp (left) on the right across the bridge there is a beautiful little redwood chapel.
host_about:
Hello, 
I am an Event Manager for a Tech company in Palo Alto. When I am not in the office or a business trip you can find me wrists deep in the garden, or taking care of our 13 chickens, 2 goats, 2 dogs and our cat. I live in Scotts Valley, CA with my Fiance. I also enjoy playing music, painting and reading a good book.

name: Socially Distant Yet Close  Wildlife Habitat, Deck
description:
Grateful to be unaffected by the fire we are discounting reservations from evacuees, please ask. Modern, Ultra Clean, on 2 1/2 acres, park and trails yet easy access to everything. During these scary COVID 19 days, we are taking extra precautions for you and our staff with time blocked between each guest to sanitize in addition to our usual white-glove clean. In this
renovated ranch home, rejoice with the cook’s kitchen, and herb garden overlooking our meadow. Hot tub, outdoor living room.

The space
A Single Level County Home in the Hills about Monterey Bay and Santa Cruz. Ben Lomond Bungalow marries romance and adventure in a grand style and near Silicon Valley yet it a world apart in the historic San Lorenzo Valley.

THE HOUSE:
- Immaculate house with white glove professional cleaning.
- Cook's Kitchen for many hands and you can pick your own herbs while you see what is ready to harvest in the kitchen garden.
- Windows looki
neighborhood_overview: Many of our wonderful unique neighbors have called each other friends for forty years.  We share a road, one of the best water systems in the county, and hiking trails into the Quail Hollow Ranch Park. The sun shines year round, and it is often sunny even when a thick blanket of fog covers the coastal areas.  Even so, we are only 10 miles to some of the best beaches and the heart of downtown Santa Cruz and an easy drive to the entire coast between San Francisco and Carmel or inland areas such as Palo Alto, San Jose, Santa Clara, and Los Gatos.
host_about:
Nuts and bolts about us, we are a bit geeky, but well grounded.  Lindley, is Professor Emeritus after directing archeolgical field projects and teaching architectual history. He travels extensively and organizes tours for friends and extended family; always great fun.  Lolly tries to balance love for archeology, and maritime history with health challenges and patient advocacy.  We are bi-coastal, and on occasion live overseas so if you are looking for an extended stay, it never hurts to ask.

Of our three properties: the Ben Lomond Bungalow is in the Santa Cruz mountains on the central coast of California and is located  within an endangered species preserve; the Hilltop Home near Washington DC is surrounded by garden and tree top views but has easy access to metro downtown, and a vast network of bike trails; the Tall Timbers Cottage is an  Potomac River woodland beach property not far from the convergence of two rivers and the Cheasapeake Bay.  Tall Timbers in on the National Potomac Heritage Water Trail.

We enjoy helping people get to know these wonderful areas, but also treasure the relationships we have with our neighbors.  Our properties are great for quiet enjoyment but not the place to host large of noisy gatherings. With prior permission we do permit well behaved pets that are not left unattended unless they are kennel trained.
Life is short.

name: The Meadow House
description:
Set on 2 acres, The Meadow House offers you the peace and serenity of an elegant remodeled farmhouse, just 5 minutes from the beach with access to all Santa Cruz has to offer. The Meadow House offers deep rest and relaxation from the hustle and bustle of life.

The space
If you are looking for the peace and serenity of an elegant remodeled farmhouse, 5 minutes from the beach with access to all the amenities of town, The Meadow House is just right for you.

The Meadow House is one of the few remaining 2 acre Santa Cruz town properties that still exists. In the morning guests can step outside to the acre meadow while watching redtail hawks circling above, nesting in the eucalyptus trees; enjoy a meal on the picnic table set under the shade of the giant walnut tree; or read in the sun on lounge chairs while listening to the meadow’s vibrant bird life. In the winter, enjoy the romantic ambiance created by the lovely radiant heat of the gas fireplace and the
neighborhood_overview:
THE NEIGHBORHOOD
The Meadow House is 1.5 miles from the beach and is perfectly situated to explore Pleasure Point’s wonderful restaurants, shops, cafes, and famous surf spot, Steamer Lane. Walk along East Cliff Drive and you’re sure to see dolphins, seals, otters and in the right season, whales! Bike to The Cove at 17th Ave. or Corcoran Lagoon Beach. Do a morning lap swim at Simkins Swim Center, or hike the loops of Schwann Lake State park where white egrets, blue heron, mallards and cormorants make their nests; rent kayaks and sail boats at The Santa Cruz Yaught Harbor; or visit the charming shops and restaurants on the Capitola Esplanade. Enjoy the Capitola Art and Wine Festival held annually in September.
Downtown Santa Cruz is only 3 miles away, a thriving arts community and home to UCSC. On Pacific Avenue, dine and take in Indie and Foreign films at the historic Del Mar and Nickelodeon theaters. Santa Cruz features many arts festivals including the monthly Antique Fair
host_about: While house hunting 20 years ago, we were in a constant dilemma of whether to live in town or out of town when we came upon this property in 1996 and all our dreams were answered.  We have cherished it ever since. We are a family of dancers, theater improvisors and musicians and The Meadow House is where we have taught, rehearsed and created works of all kinds. We raised our son here and loved having access to all the town offered, while feeling we were out in the country when nestled at home. I have felt a personal guardianship of the meadow, never developing it, and now I would love to share it with you.

name: Canyon Retreat Close to Downtown
description:
Retreat in a luscious green canyon and discover the magic of Santa Cruz. We are perfectly located, surrounded by incredible nature & close to all the goodness Santa Cruz has to offer: dining, shopping, nature, trails, golf courses-all without having to navigate traffic to get there.

Our apartment is a great place for couples to focus on each other & relax into themselves; solo adventurers and business travelers will also find this apartment has all the home away from home goodies one could want

The space
Our apartment is a perfect retreat space, romantic getaway or base for adventure. Our intent was to make it feel like a home away from home & the feedback has confirmed that.

The canyon is green & luscious, the trees are so beautiful, the creek below is flowing and the fireplace keeps the space warm & cozy on cool evenings. The deck chairs offer an invitation to take it all in.

The full kitchen allows for your dining-in needs to
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhoods greatest gift is the peace of nature & the close proximity to town. Our house is also off the main roads enough to be able to avoid (for the most part) the summer traffic coming and going from downtown & the beach.
host_about: We adore our quiet retreat like setting in the canyon and are excited to share the magic of it with those called to visit Santa Cruz who want to have an awesome cozy home to come home to after a fun-filled day.  We value being able to cook our own food & eat the way we want to so having a place with a kitchen is what I am always looking for so it's what we offer.
