name: Beach House By the Bay
description:
**It is very important that you read "ADDITIONAL RULES" to be certain our home is a good fit. If you are looking to have a party-this is NOT the home for you!**We are nestled in the small neighborhood of Seacliff Beach, but located just minutes from everything you want to see and do in Santa Cruz! This spacious 1800 sqft, 3 bedroom, 2 bath house sits on a 10,000 sqft lot AND is a short walk to the beach! Plenty of fenced space for your kids to run free and outside patio area with BBQ grill

The space
Please read our reviews! Our family home is a breath of fresh air with skylights throughout the house for naturally lighted living space. It has a lot to offer the active, beach loving family! The kitchen and dining area is spacious and easy for food prep. In addition to the comforts of this sunlit home, guests can enjoy the fireplace on cool North Coast evenings. For the working vacation, we have a desk and wireless internet available throughout the house. Lastly, be
neighborhood_overview: Our centrally located home is nestled in the quiet neighborhood of Seacliff Beach, but close enough to all the action that Santa Cruz has to offer! We are a short walk to Seacliff State Beach (yes, walk!) Please ask us for the "secret access" way from our neighborhood. It's a 10 minute walk and then some stairs leading down to the beach. We are also conveniently located just minutes from the quaint town of Capitola By the Sea, Santa Cruz Beach Boardwalk AND not too far from the Monterey Bay Aquarium, beautiful Carmel By The Sea and Pebble Beach golf course. No need to get in your car-we are a hop, skip and jump from some of our local favorites: Marianne's Ice Cream (homemade in Santa Cruz since 1947!!), Manuel's Mexican restaurant or quickly grab a slice of pizza at Pizza 1. For your kiddos-Seacliff Village Park is right down the street! Again, no need to drive. Like to hike? Nisene Marks State Park is just minutes away! And don't forget...Surf's up! name: Private and clean! Perfect for traveling nurses!
description:
Our place is perfect for business travelers, traveling nurses and relocating professionals. Ideals for those seeking 30 days+. We prefer to meet with our guests prior to accepting bookings so we are assured we can offer the best match for our family. We have a clean and comfortable home. We are close to restaurants, beach, public transport, family-friendly activities, and nightlife. You’ll love our place because of cleanliness and central location. We may have another room open. Check dates?

The space
Private bath with shower and tub. Full size bed, view of back yard and large trees. Street parking on residential street. Street lights, walking trails nearby, Target, Staples, Ross, Applebee's, Big 5, Nob Hill, Safeway, Starbucks, etc. We also have one cat that is very friendly.

Guest access
Backyard to enjoy, access to kitchen, living room & laundry.

Other things to note
On Street Parking Only.
neighborhood_overview: Residential neighborhood
host_about:
We enjoy the outdoors and are grateful daily for the opportunity to own a cabin in the amazing Sierra Mountains. We have been successfully sharing our cabin as a vacation rental for over 8 years and have established relationships with people all over the world.  We have extensive experience as hosts and offer our renters expert advice about the area.  
We wish you many happy adventures in the Yosemite area and hope you return home with amazing memories of this unique area!

name: Cozy Loft in the Redwoods
description:
In a very natural, rural setting amongst the majestic redwoods, we are adjacent to thousand of acres of state park land right outside the door, with endless amazing hiking and mountain biking. You’ll love my place because of the coziness, simple beauty and tranquil natural setting, with great afternoon sun streaming in the windows and a deck. My place is good for couples and solo adventurers. This is a beautiful yet rural setting, please keep this in mind. Always fresh sheets greet you!

Guest access
Sleeping Capacity: 1 Queen Bed, 1 couch, 1 loveseat
SUPPLIES: The fully equipped kitchen is ready for you. Dishes (plates, bowls, glasses), pots & pans, cork screw, can opener, bottle opener, paper towels, silverware, sugar, french press for making coffee, tea
WATER: Enjoy fresh spring water right from the tap!
ECOLOGY: All of our gray water (from showers, laundry & sinks) is redirected to our landscaping.
WIFI: available for streaming your
neighborhood_overview:
We are located just ten minutes from Santa Cruz, where you can visit the famous Boardwalk, surf, play at the beaches, shop downtown, kayak, or see the monarchs at Natural Bridges State Park. My home in Bonny Doon is only two miles from Henry Cowell State Park, Roaring Camp Railroads. It is close by Big Basin State Park, Castle Rock State Park, for easy access to hiking, mountain biking, swimming.

For grocery shopping you can either drive to Santa Cruz or have easy access to Felton where you will find both a Safeway and New Leaf (natural foods) grocery stores. Big Basin State Park, Loch Lomond, wine tasting, and the Big Foot Museum are all in the area, too.

The afternoons bring sunshine to the back deck and into the dining room, kitchen and master bedroom. name: Homie's Hideaway
description:
Hideaway is 10 min walk to downtown, beaches or restaurants and close to famous surf spots like Steamer Lane, Natural bridges and more. Neary Lagoon Park, Cowell's beach, Wharf and Boardwalk are minutes away where you can enjoy the Santa Cruz life style. It is also a short drive to Capitola and SC wineries. Hideaway has great views. You’ll love this place because of the ambiance, the comfy bed, and light. Very quiet. Good for couples, families, solo adventurers, and business travelers.

The space
Whole house, Upstairs above 3 car garage. 1 bedroom w a queen bed, 1 bath house with living room/kitchen in one big space. 46' TV, WIFI that gives you access to all your favorite subscriptions and streaming services. The living room has a pull out couch (queen). 2 decks w chairs for you to relax. Great views and surrounded by trees. We share the drive way with the neighbors house and we have off street parking spaces available for 2 cars. Very secure and walking distanc
neighborhood_overview:
The location is very quiet and close to all the main places in Santa Cruz. You won't be able to tell how close you are from everything until you are there.
Aside from the sea lions barking noise, Hideaway is tuck away! Very quite but short walks from everything.
It is a gem.
host_about: Raised in Santa Cruz I have sailed and surfed all my life. I love traveling and have done it extensively. Love to meet people from all the corners of the world and exchange stories. My wife and I love staying @ Airbnb every where.

name: Cozy Cabin in the Santa Cruz Mtns
description:
*** Due to county ordinances we can ONLY host essential workers or medical workers at this time.

Our house is tucked in the redwoods in the Santa Cruz Mountains. We're twelve miles to Santa Cruz. It's close enough for a beach day or a trip to the Boardwalk, but also great for a peaceful getaway. Tons of mountain biking and hiking nearby.

The space
This cabin has a great open feel. It's a nice mix of old charming details, like the claw foot tub, and newer updates, like the laminate floors. There's a comfy full size bed and plenty of space for your belongings in the bedroom. There's also couch that converts to a full sized bed, a recliner love seat, and two leather chairs. We've stocked the shelf with some books, games, and movies for a relaxing visit. There's a flatscreen tv for movies and Apple TV, but no cable.

The kitchen had a fridge, gas stove, toaster oven, microwave, and dishes.

Guest access
Guests have access t
neighborhood_overview: Relax in our cozy cabin or on the deck. Or, go for a hike nearby in Henry Cowell or Big Basin, and stop for a bite at one of the nearby restaurants. Santa Cruz is just 12 miles away.
host_about: I've lived in Santa Cruz mountains for several years and I teach at the elementary school down the street. I love the beautiful redwood trees and our caring community. We especially enjoy all the fun outdoor activities nearby!

name: Shangri La Ocean Front Condo
description:
DISCOUNTS FOR EXTENDED STAYS
Remodeled 2nd level full ocean front condo located in Pajaro Dunes a private, gated community midway between Santa Cruz and Monterey, just a few steps from a quiet immaculate beach.
The condo is perfect for those wanting to ‘get away from it all’. It also meets the needs of those who want to be more active because of its proximity to the attractions of Monterey Bay and Santa Cruz; e.g. whale watching, surfing, kayaking, wine tasting, and the Monterey Bay Aquarium.

The space
The second floor allows full enjoyment, with no obstruction from dunes or grasses, as with some units. Pelican 37 juts out, affording privacy from the neighboring units, which are recessed to our right and left. Because the condo's location is at the end of the Point, the beach is often without another person in sight, except for early morning walkers along the shore.

Pajaro Dunes has on site staff available 24 hours as well as an on site
neighborhood_overview:
Pelican Point is located within the unique coastal environment of the Monterey Bay National Marine Sanctuary where the Pajaro River meets the Pacific Ocean. Relax to the sounds of the ocean and watch pelicans, sandpipers, otters and dolphins; search for sand dollars and seashells or go for long walks on the pristine beach.

Amenities available on sight are 5 Tennis courts, 2 Pickle Ball courts, 1 basketball court, Bocce Ball, Sand Volleyball, Table Tennis, Horse Shoes & a giant Chess Game; equipment is available in Gatehouse for all these activities EXCEPT for tennis.
host_location: San Juan Bautista, California, United States
host_about: We are hosting approved travelers per Santa Cruz Health Order e. g. NO RESTRICTIONS!  Beach fully open

name: Charming Light-Filled Carriage House Apartment
description:
Our 1928 carriage house apartment is walking distance to the Boardwalk, beach, wharf, basketball stadium, and downtown.
Cowells and Main Beaches, Steamers Lane, Boardwalk, wharf, and West Cliff Drive (path along the ocean) are all a quick 5 min walk from our house.
The apartment is located in a private garden setting, away from the main street, behind our home. There is a separate dedicated garden space for you to use. We hope you will love this historical neighborhood as much as we do!

The space
The space is on the 2nd story and has windows on each side, so it's very bright. In the early morning you can hear the sea lions from the wharf and sometimes at night you can hear the ocean if the windows are open.
It's a very secure space, surrounded by a garden and set back from the street.

Other things to note
The City of Santa Cruz charges 11% occupancy tax on all rent and cleaning fees. This is included in your stay; no add
neighborhood_overview: Beach Hill is a historic neighborhood within Santa Cruz. There are many interesting historic homes here all within a 3-block radius. It is also situated between the beach and downtown, so most things you may want to do are walkable.
host_about: My family moved to Santa Cruz from the Bay Area a few years ago and we love being here in this small beach community.  I especially like walking our dog Leo along West Cliff Drive and watching our 2 girls boogie board and surf at Cowell Beach.

name: 1 bedroom cottage. Walking distance to beach
description:
We have a little guest house on our property that we're blessed to share with family, friends, and the airbnb community. We're a 10-15 min walk to our private beach. Close proximity to both Santa Cruz and Monterey, and close enough to San Francisco to explore the city for a day trip.

The space
Our guest house is a very spacious 1 bedroom cottage with separate living room and kitchen. We call it Sand Dollar Farms because of all the sand dollars that can be found on the beach at the end of our block, not because it's an actual working farm. The house looks out onto 15 acres of native landscape from the living room (as well as some falling down greenhouses that used to be part of the orchid farm in the 80's) You can feed the chickens out your kitchen door, stroll to the beach at the end of the block, read a book in the sunshine and then cozy up in a blanket once the coastal fog rolls in. It's great space to unwind after a long day of exploring everything Santa Cruz,
neighborhood_overview:
We live in the country. Every time I step outside, I'm reminded of this in the animals I see right outside my back door. Deer, possums, hawks, owls, rabbits, mice, snakes, lizards, gophers, coyotes, you name it and you'll see it.... from the cute and awe inducing to the not so sweet and cuddly. There isn't a day that goes by that we don't see at lease one of the above mentioned critters.
Walk down to the beach and you'll be amazed at the shore birds, dolphins, otters, and whales that you can sometimes spot right from shore. We feel so lucky to live in such a magical place where we're constantly reminded of how amazing mother nature is.
host_location: La Selva Beach, California, United States
host_about: We are a fun loving family who snowboards in the winter and surfs in the summer. We love our daughter, our dogs (and cat, and chickens!) camping, eating & drinking, San Francisco, our garden, and our little slice of La Selva heaven.

description:
Bamboo groves and redwoods await at this sunny Felton love nest… My place is very close to parks, restaurants and stores in the historic Felton grove neighborhood right next to the San Lorenzo river, perfect for couples, solo adventurers or a small family. Henry Cowell Redwoods state park and Roaring camp railroads are minutes away. The Santa Cruz beaches are 15 minute drive.. Come enjoy the peace and quite of the Santa Cruz mountains, while your cares drop off like Autumn leaves!

The space
House is on a dead end street, very quite and right across from San Lorenzo river… Private downstairs studio, with gas fireplace.. I have upgraded the bed to a queen since the photo.

Other things to note
close to markets, pharmacy, restaurants, wineries

1700 sq. ft. three bedroom house with sunny rooftop terrace. Quiet and secluded setting. One block to shops, two blocks to beach and restaurants. Very inviting and perfect for families! The house accommodates six adults easily; up to eight people with younger children.

Beautiful craftsman cottage with huge organic garden. Tucked away on quiet cul de sac, lovely front porch and back patio. Peach, plum, lemon,mandarin, fig, apple & pear trees. Outdoor Bathhouse w/clawfoot tub. 11 ft ceilings, hardwood floors,fully equipped kitchen,dining room seats 8.Huge windows, art, antiques & vintage. Bonus room can be closed off w/ french doors w/a full-size convertible sleeper. About a mile to beach, 5 minutes to West and East Cliff surf spots, easy walk to downtown.

The space
Stone patio with built in fire pit. Outdoor bathhouse with huge claw foot tub. Outdoor surf shower. Barbecue and dining area with huge table (probably could seat 20). Hot tub. Garden path with large fountain. Huge front porch with comfy sofa and chairs.

The entire house is yours to enjoy while visiting. There is an unattached room behind the house that we also Airbnb.

Other things to note
Our big friendly
neighborhood_overview: We are in the Branciforte neighborhood which sits on a hill just above downtown (an easy 10 minute walk).  There are several shops, groceries, restaurants, bars a bakery and a  brewery all is easy walking distance on Soquel Avenue.  Our neighbors are friendly and most of them have lived on this block for decades.

Situated on half an acre, our place is close to town, Capitola beaches, local wineries, and Santa Cruz attractions. There is a private entry to the apartment with a view of towering redwoods and a peaceful creek. Our place is perfect for couples and solo adventurers.

The space
Separate apartment below home with private entrance (and kitchenette - no stove). There is a main room and one bedroom with en suite bathroom. Also situated on a creek and near local wineries (Soquel Vineyards and Bargetto), beaches, and several restaurants including Beer Thirty (local beer pub with 30 beers on tap, food window, plus space for dogs).

name: Quiet, Sunny & Spacious Room/Bath by Forest Trails
description:
My home is in Santa Cruz--a special place with lots of great views, a variety of marine life, redwood forests, beaches, the art and culture of a vibrant university town, home to a long-standing surf culture, the Boardwalk amusement park, many fine restaurants and lively music venues. Politics are progressive, the style is laid back and people are friendly. Most of the time we don't get the summer heat because of the marine effect.

The space
This is a nice home in a quiet and hike-friendly neighborhood that is a 10 minute drive to Santa Cruz beaches. It is also convenient for anybody wanting to connect with nearby UC, Santa Cruz. Outdoor spaces are available to enjoy in the front and back yards. Plenty of parking on the street.

Guest access
Guests are free to relax in the living room, play the piano, enjoy the garden spaces and hot tub and have light use of the kitchen (breakfast, storage, snacks). We do not permit pets, not even servic
neighborhood_overview:
There are a very few places where you can surf world-class waves before breakfast; hike among giant redwoods in the morning; enjoy a gourmet, organic lunch; work on your Ph.D. in biomedical engineering in the afternoon; catch whales frolicking off the coast; and then enjoy a bit of Shakespeare in the evening.

This city of 62,000 people on the Pacific coast of northern California, enjoys 250 days of sunshine annually in which to enjoy one of the world’s great surfing beaches. It’s also nestled next to the Santa Cruz Mountains, where spectacular hiking trails afford sweeping views of the ocean. And the iconic, ancient redwood forests provide another natural habitat that residents cherish and visitors gaze at in awe.

Recent article in California Today:
Want to be Happy? Move to Santa Cruz

Beaches, prosperity, and an intellectual zest. Maybe it's no surprise that the Santa Cruz region was the highest-ranked metropolitan area in the latest (March 20
host_about: Mathematics educator at the university level.  Love to travel, especially in Italy and Ireland.   Studied Italian for many years to travel there more easily.  Appassionata of the accordion and have played badly for several years now.  Two amazing daughters and four young grandkids.  Interested in so many things: science, music, art, culture, humor, running, water sports, literature, progressive politics, social justice issues.

name: Private Room in Country Home & Horse Stable
description:
Off the beaten path, 6 acres, majestic trees and spectacular views create a tranquil and serene hideaway. Unwind and relax in a secluded back yard, surrounded by nature and 3 friendly pasture horses.
Traveling with your horse? Bring them too! There's shelter & pasture for an additional fee of $35 ea.
Seacliff & New Brighton State Beaches 15 minutes, Santa Cruz Beach Boardwalk 30 minutes. Miles of redwood forest trails at Forest of the Nisene, Henry Cowell Redwood State Parks & Big Sur Coast.

The space
Private entrance, recently remodeled quiet and spacious back bedroom with vaulted beam ceiling, Cal King Tempurpedic mattress & private bathroom. Futon for seating or extra bed. Private backyard table, chairs & chase lounges provided for a relaxed morning coffee or an evening cocktail with open space views.

Guest access
Vehicle parking near the guest entrance door.
Truck and trailer parking at the barn area.

Ot
neighborhood_overview: You will feel as if you are miles away from the city. But you are only three miles from the nearest grocery store and restaurants.  The area surrounding the house is wooded with a variety of wildlife that wanders by our home. Besides deer, you may see coyote. There is an abundance of birds who vocalize throughout the day, beginning early morning, and nighttime brings owls.
host_about: When not busy renovating our 'little piece of paradise' we enjoy hiking, camping and traveling when time allows. Horseback riding is a passion for Kathy, and Rob is an enthusiastic kayaker & backpacker.

name: Bigfoot's Tiny House Getaway
description:
We are adhering to strict cleaning protocols, including the use of an industrial ozone generator which kills odors, bacteria, and viruses.
A mile away from restaurants and shops, close to Henry Cowell State Park, Fall Creek, and a short drive to Santa Cruz's beaches and downtown. Tiny House is cozy, a perfect getaway with a private deck. Great for adventurous people.
Our place is good for couples and solo travelers. If you're on Instagram look us up bigfoots_tiny_house for more pictures.

The space
COMPLETE STERILIZATION after every guest. Industrial Ozone Generator Air Purifier is used to eliminate any bacteria and viruses. All surfaces are sanitized and thoroughly cleaned. Tiny House sits on our property and peeks out to our house, pool and BBQ area, but guests do have a separate entrance and private deck.
Tiny House has a loft bed with STEEP steps, a bathroom, and a kitchenette with microwave, toaster oven, and fridge/freezer.
Du
neighborhood_overview: We are at the end of a dirt road with only three houses, but still in a neighborhood.  We are next door to The Cowboy Bat and Grill (yum!),  fully fenced in, walking distance from Henry Cowell State Park, and the little town of Felton.  We are a fifteen-minute drive down Hwy 9 thru the redwoods to Santa Cruz.  World class mountain bike trails and hiking minutes away.  The San Lorenzo river winds thru town.  There are plenty of trails and private little spots to relax and unwind.  Redwood trees as far as the eye can see.  Beginner to moderate hikes are just minutes away.  You will see some of the biggest Redwood trees ever.  Lots of wild life.
host_about:
My family and I take pride in making things by hand.  We value our friends and family, art and good food.
I like to travel but my husband is a homebody and our kids fall somewhere in between.  All of us love meeting new people and hearing of their adventures and lives.
We are Miyazaki lovers; each of us has a different favorite movie of his.
We are all music lovers, ranging from classical to heavy metal; we listen to it all.
We all enjoy various forms of art, from drawing, to sculpting to printing to ... just about anything!  
We hope people staying with us will find our place welcoming and cozy, clean and artful.  
We look forward to meeting new people and creating new memories.

name: 1st Responders  Welcome: View Guest House by beach
description:
This Guest House is the perfect getaway. Minutes from the beach yet feels secluded and private.Not another house in sight from the house and the view is the best in all of Santa Cruz. Southern facing,affording lots of light and fresh air.. There is only one bed!

The space
The house is tucked into the hillside overlooking Pogonip City Park , Henry Cowell State park and the greenbelt.While its only two minutes to downtown the house is surrounded by nature.Red tail hawks soar above the beautiful redwoods and the deer graze in the canyon below the house. You can see the ocean only on clear days above the eualyptus trees but always have a spectacular view of the forest and canyon!
The little kitchen is equipped with everything you need including coffee and tea and works well for light cooking. There is NO OVEN.
Amazing new queen size Tempurpedic mattress..fancy linens and down comforter. Nice flat screen with a great cable package including Netflix and P
neighborhood_overview:
The house is on a privately owned, cul-de-sak, with only 6 houses . Property is the last house on left with huge panoramic views of Henry Cowell State Park and rolling green hills.
Quiet and safe neighborhood. Easy parking! One mile to downtown and beaches!
host_about:
I am a local homeowner and I have been Hosting on Airbnb since 2015 .I love what Airbnb has made possible for me. I have met so many wonderful people from all over the world,including several "A" list celebrity's !
I am an avid gardener,  dog  lover and passionate horsemen.I am all about attention to details so be assured the house will be spotless and I  have implemented the "Covid  Cleaning Procedure" including 24 hours between guests. My team and I have always scrubbed the house from top to bottom including changing EVERYTHING on the bed down to the mattress pad between guests and I  have always received 5 Stars from every single  guest in this category,so please be assured that the house has been properly disinfected and will be spotless.
I welcome to you to come and enjoy the amazing beauty of Santa Cruz! The beaches and Parks here are some of the most beautiful in the world!

name: Succulent Garden House: Entire Home
description:
100 Paces to Pleasure Point - One of the best surfing spots in the world! The Point is also know for it's incredible sunsets and whale watching. Built in 2001, this Mediterranean Style, two-story home has 2,400 generous square feet. Wood floors, granite counters, fireplace, high ceilings, plus den/dining room.  A peak of the ocean from inside the house, but just steps to Pleasure Point, and the commercial up-and-coming area on 41st Avenue. Incredible succulent garden in front. Hot tub!!

The space
Just a 3 minute walk to all of the trendy shops, restaurants, coffee shops, and more! Enjoy your breakfast, lunch, or coffee from Chill Out Cafe (a local's favorite!) while watching surfers, wildlife and the gorgeous view from the Point. Later, go out to dinner at one of the highly recommended restaurants within walking distance; Suda, Zameen at the Point, KAITO, The Eastside Eatery, and so on. 

This home is ideal for large family gatherings and friend getaway
neighborhood_overview: Located right in the heart of Pleasure Point, close to surfing and dining, and shopping.

Exquisite country setting in beautiful Happy Valley only 10 minutes to Santa Cruz,15 to ocean,25 minutes to Silicon Valley custom-built Asian style home set in an oriental garden
This space adjoins our home and shares common walls yet has private entrance and is large over 450 sq

We have had a great honor of living on this sacred land for over 30 years ,super sunny yet on the edge of a magnificent redwood forest

name: Serenity In Seacliff
description:
Single level home with 3 bedrooms and 2 full bath. Convenient Seacliff Neighborhood location within walking distance of Seacliff State Beach and local dining (Maryann's Ice Cream, Manuel's Mexican). Also close to local boutiques, Nisene Marks for biking or hiking and Aptos Village for good eats and shopping. The perfect place to call home after a day exploring Santa Cruz County!

The space
Don't miss out on a long weekend at the beach in this great beach house!!!
This is a great 3 bedroom, 2 bath single level home situated in Seacliff within a short leisure walk to the Seacliff State Beach, Restaurants and Shopping. Enjoy casual dinner at Manuel's Restuarant, grab a quick bite to eat at Pizza One, or grab dessert at the famous Marianne's Ice Cream. Convenient location and again great for a family getaway. Seacliff State beach is known for its long stretch of sand, enjoy fishing off of the cement ship and don't forget to stop off at the museum.

C
host_about: Located just across the street from Rio Del Mar Beach in Aptos,  Bailey Property Management specializes in vacation homes throughout Santa Cruz County.  From large spacious homes on West Cliff Dr to Beach Cottages along the coast, we have something for everyone!

name: Beachfront Tranquility
description:
Our beautiful oceanfront condo is right on the beach at Pajaro Dunes, centrally located on Monterey Bay. This natural and secluded environment takes you far away from the stresses of everyday life. Access the beach right outside your door, and feel connected to it even while inside this relaxing space.

The space
Our freshly remodeled condo is a ground-floor unit and is so close to the waves, you can hear them crashing. We have a partial ocean view and a clean, bright, soothing atmosphere decorated in an ocean theme. Amenities include fully equipped kitchen with brand new appliances, cabinetry and quartz counters. We have a very comfortable queen bed, as well as a new sofa bed in the living room with memory foam mattress.

Guest access
Guests will have full access to the condo and all amenities our community has to offer, including tennis and basketball.
neighborhood_overview:
Pajaro Dunes is close to all the action but feels a world away, approximately 25 minutes South of Santa Cruz and North of Monterey. Our condo is located on Sunset Beach in the Shorebirds gated community.

Take long walks on the beach, as far as the eye can see. Relax on your private patio. Take a stroll around the lagoon, watching the birds in their habitat. Play a game of tennis or basketball. Head over to Santa Cruz, Moss Landing or Monterey for the day or just for lunch or dinner. Build a fire on the beach and roast marshmallows, then watch a movie. Let the sounds of the surf lull you to sleep at night.

For nearby shopping, Nob Hill Foods and Target are just 10 min. away in Watsonville.

Other features to note:
-24-hour gated security
-Store in complex for souvenirs and convenience items
-Sports equipment provided: tennis racquets, basketball
-Beach equipment provided: chairs, umbrella, beach towels, kite, frisbee
-2

name: Tranquil Getaway
description:
My place is close to private getaway nestled in the redwoods, short drive to UCSC, Santa Cruz Beach Boardwalk, Henry Cowell, Big Basin and Capitola beaches. Easy access to highway leading to San Jose, San Francisco and Monterrey. Beautiful spacious private entrance in the heart of Scotts Valley nearby 1440 Multiversity, movie theater, restaurants, shopping and parks. You will love my place because of the privacy and tranquility after a day of exploring.

The space
The room is above the garage and it has a private entrance. There is a stairway to the room but private from the house. There is a mini fridge, a room coolerfor those hot days, coffee maker, microwave, and iron. It is in the mountains but very close to the highway and 1440 Multiversity. We planned and furnished this room with our guest in mind. We created a space that provides you peaceful privacy, warmth, abundance and comfort. It is our hope that you will feel, during your stay, it is YOUR home.

name: Work Remote @Modern Beach Retreat-Free EV Charging
description:
This open and airy modern home is a 5 minute walk to Rio del Mar beach. Enjoy the clean design, large deck and indoor outdoor living. Numerous outdoor activities at your doorstep including golf, world class surf breaks, and renowned biking and hiking trails in the forest of Nisene Marks. Equipped with high speed internet, a projector and Sonos sound system. Our place comfortably hosts five and is good for couples, business travelers, solo, and families.

The space
Newly remodeled 2 bedroom, 1.5 bath home (1,300 sq ft), backs up to a creek providing a sense of privacy. Indoor outdoor living at it's best with 11' sliding glass doors in the living room opening out to the deck. People often tell us it feels as if you are in a treehouse!

Guest access
Entire house including outdoor shower, BBQ, boogie boards, surfboards, two beach Cruisers, child sized wet suits, and 2 electric car chargers (Tesla & Clipper Creek).

Other things to
neighborhood_overview:
COVID-19 RESPONSE: We want to assure you we are doing everything we can to make your stay relaxing and safe. We have increased our cleaning and disinfecting procedures as outlined by airbnb, which are based on the CDC recommendations. For example, we are increasing the time between renters to allow for ample time to clean and disinfect. For more details on our cleaning & disinfecting procedures, see the airbnb guidelines at:
https://www.airbnb.com/resources/hosting-homes/a/cleaning-guidelines-to-help-prevent-the-spread-of-covid-19-163
We are continually monitoring the county and states' direction and may need to cancel reservations based on their guidance.

The home is in a residential, beach neighborhood. Houses are in close proximity to one another so you are likely to hear neighbors, cars, pets when sitting outside on the deck. The house is close to the beach so there is both foot and car traffic on the road. Inside the house there is minimal outdoor noise.
host_about: Tracie and Dave love being near the ocean, eating and traveling. We enjoy walking on the beach, surfing, cycling, yoga and relaxing with a good book.

name: Santa Cruz, 5 mins to UCSC, Beach, Town,Hike, Bike
description:
Enjoy Beautiful Santa Cruz! Lovely Room, double bed-Nice Home & Family, No smoking, no animals. Dining Room, Living Room, Washer-Dryer, Kitchen all available. Baby Grand Piano to play. From front porch, we hear big waves at night & sea lions barking. Lovely view of green trees, sunrise & sunset. Centrally located: 5-10 mins by car/bus to UCSC, downtown, beach, hiking, biking, Hwy 1 & 17. Near town, yet quiet. Easy to ride bikes everywhere! Rent "Jump Bike!" Restaurants & bus nearby.

The space
The available bed is a double-sized futon couch (supported on frame, feels like bed). It's in my office which is used by us, but private when you're our guest. Closet & shelves available for clothes and storage. Up to 2 kids can sleep on the living room couch if they are small.

Shelf space in fridge, use of kitchen and washer/dryer. Please note: If you cook more than twice a week and use much more therms/wattage than is the norm (based on Pacifi
neighborhood_overview:
Beautiful neighborhood of classic homes and friendly neighbors is great for walking in. Favorite nearby restaurants are Cafe Gratitude (organic, raw & cooked vegetarian cuisine); Sabieng (delicious Thai food - very extensive menu); Pono Grill (yummy Hawaiian food & music, and also nice Hula dancing some nights); Mobo Sushi (excellent downtown sushi bar); The Hidden Peak Teahouse ( this "hidden" gem is a tranquil computer & cell phone-free sanctuary serving a wide range of excellent Chinese puehr & other teas, and satisfying finger foods/deserts); The Abbey Coffee House: great coffee and tea, wifi, comfortable indoor table & couch seating, and nice outdoor courtyard. Enjoy!
Many more restaurants...Our small town is restaurant heaven!
host_about:
I am a Psychic Sound Healer.  I use crystal bowls, my voice and other sound healing modalities to uplift people's frequency.  I work with depression, dis-ease and pains to uplift the vibratory field of body, mind, heart & soul.

I love the ocean as a scuba diver, sailor, kayaker and all the hiking/biking trails in beautiful Santa Cruz.  I've lived here since 1978 and can let you know almost everything about our incredible area.

description:
Welcome to the beautiful Santa Cruz Mountains and our home. Our private charming cabin is in midst a beautiful rustic garden setting. It is cozy and quiet, yet close to Santa Cruz, 9 miles through beautiful Redwood forest.

Enjoy the tranquility of our outdoor bathroom with claw foot bathtub and shower and environmentally friendly composting toilet.

Full kitchen with a two burner stove, fridge, and toaster/ oven.

Our place is good for couples, solo adventurers, and business travelers.

The space
Our home is located in the San Lorenzo Valley in the Santa Cruz mountains. It is a very unique area with Redwood and oak trees and many mountain trails great for hiking, biking, camping.
The San Lorenzo is flowing 5 min walk away from our house; great for a dip on a hot summer day.
The studio is completely dog/ cat free. A perfect space for people who deal with animal allergies.

A large de
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is made of single family housing in a oak/ redwood/ fir setting.  Ben Lomond is 5 min walk away with 2 awesome restaurants ( The Tyrolean Inn and Casa Nuestra), a great super market, a gallery/ art center, a fantastic feed and garden center with gift shops, post office and bar.  Highlands Park is 5 min drive away on Hwy 9 with free tennis courts and baseball field and easy access to the San Lorenzo river.
host_about: My name is Afrid Ghoffrani.  I live in California and own an import/ wholesale business which brings me to Asia twice a year.  I have been using airbnb for business travel here in the US and enjoy it so much more than hotel rooms!

Suite includes 1BR, 1 BR, 1 Living Room, & private deck.
When you are not out exploring the area our home provides a tranquil place to relax and unwind.
5 minutes to central Ben Lomond. 10 mins to Felton, 20 mins to Santa Cruz beaches, & Boardwalk, 45 minutes from San Jose.

Your private suite includes 1 bedroom, 1 bathroom, living room, and kitchen as well as your own private entrance, deck, and garden chill space.

name: Luxurious Getaway in the Santa Cruz Mountains
description:
Our peaceful and relaxing home is close to Henry Cowell and Big Basin state parks, the San Lorenzo river, and many beaches along the Santa Cruz coastline. You’ll fall in love with the serene natural setting, combined with all the luxuries of an upscale resort.

The space
Our home has a modern design in a rustic setting.

Master bedroom has king size bed with down pillows and comforter, 48 inch wall mounted flat panel TV and walk in closet.

TV room has Olympic queen sized memory foam sleeper sofa, and 65 inch wall mounted flat panel TV. There are 2 pocket doors for privacy.

Both TVs have access to Netflix, HBO Go, and YouTube.

For an additional $75 a night you can have access to a stand alone studio with a king size bed and full bath located in the back of the property, just beyond the main house.

Guest access
Key to the entry gate can be found in the lockbox on the column to the right of the gate
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood boasts a rural charm with friendly faces.  Local restaurants, shops, the river, and park are all within walking distance.  Peace and quiet are abundant.
host_about: Dan and I love to travel.  We seek  out and appreciate spots of natural beauty and peaceful energy. We try to provide this for our guests as well and hope you will experience it at our get away in the Santa Cruz mountains!

3 blocks to Twin Lakes State Beach, the Yacht Harbor & Crow's Nest restaurant. 8 blocks to the Boardwalk. You’ll love the landscaped & fully enclosed yard w/ lounge seating on the deck, gas BBQ, hammock, outdoor fireplace, large teak dining table & tropical outdoor shower w/ warm water. Perfect for outdoor entertaining. Beach chairs & umbrellas are provided, all you need to bring is your bathing suit! A great place for couples, families (w/ kids), girls' getaway, pet friendly*.

Pet Friendly

name: Ocean beachfront Pajaro Dunes Watsonville CA
description:
"OUR HOME WILL NOT BE AVAILABLE FOR RENTAL THROUGH THE SPRING DURING OUR REMODEL. CHECK BACK EARLY SUMMER FOR AVAILABLE DATES" Comfortable ocean front home on beautiful Monterey Bay with easy beach access & spectacular ocean views. Take long walks on our quiet, beautiful beach; enjoy the abundant ocean life including sea otters, dolphins, whales, sea lions & many bird species. Great central location-you may not want to leave the house and our pristine beach! Perfect for families & mature adults.

The space
Our home is all about location, location, location. Sitting on the sand dune overlooking the beach, there are amazing 180° views from our kitchen, living and dining rooms, master bedroom and decks.

Guest access
Beach access (stairway) is a short 3 minute walk. Our beach is clean and often feels private, particularly weekdays; it goes on for several miles to the north. Pajaro Dunes offers 3 tennis courts, basketball, pickleball, bocci ball
neighborhood_overview: Located on the coast in the agricultural town of Watsonville. Make a stop at a road side market for delicious strawberries or local artichokes. We are 10 minutes from Nob Hill grocery store and Target.
host_about:
Your hosts, Carol and David, have a love of cooking, wine, traveling, hiking and  movies. Carol is an avid reader, David enjoys dabbling in photography. We enjoy a variety of traveling styles; some luxury; sometimes we rent a car and explore without reservations finding the places we enjoy as we get there; other times we book well located Airbnb's to give us a haven after hours of touring. We particularly enjoy not having to eat out 3 times a day, preferring to use the kitchen in our Airbnb for at least breakfast and/or lunch. 

One of our life mottos is: Things happen for reasons.

This property is an ideal place to rest & recharge while you enjoy your stay. The renowned bakeries and restaurants, wineries and breweries are within walking distance. My home is a mile from the beach & close to the surfing.

name: Magical Private Beach Cottage, Steps to the Beach
description:
The Beach Cottage is very private, and tucked away in an amazing setting. Moran Lagoon is out your backyard, with the beach just a very short walk on a paved path. The views from the Cottage are OUTRAGEOUS. The yard and garden is fenced and gated for your privacy. Relax in your own hot tub, letting your worries melt away. Pleasure Point is a wonderful place to live. World renowned for it's surfing, with a feel of a true Beach Town. Great Restaurants and fabulous Coffee houses near by.

The space
A lovely and private Beach Cottage with an amazing gated and fenced yard, with your very own hot tub to enjoy. The Cottage is filled with light and a since of openness, with wonderful views throughout. The Cottage is situated on a private road in a great neighborhood with lovely neighbors. The views from the Beach Cottage give you the feeling that you are on a movie set. Unbelievable.

Guest access
You are welcome to enjoy the entire Cottag
neighborhood_overview: Rarely do you have the good fortune to stay in a place that affords you the view of not only a lovely beach and ocean, but a quiet and quaint Lagoon right outside your back door.
host_about: I am happily married to my wonderful partner of 34 years.  We have three children, and one super grandson.  We are actively raising our fabulous 16 year old boy/girl twins. They keep us young, and informed.  Every summer we leave our home, and travel up to Echo Lake Ca. to spend the summer in our high mountain rustic cabin.  We love the mountain life, filled with hiking, boating, canoeing and water play.  Love that clean fresh air.  We are blessed to be able to spend time between two of the most beautiful places in California, Santa Cruz and Echo Lake. We thrive on fresh air and open space.

description:
Bluff top 3/2 with fantastic views of Monterey Bay. Gourmet kitchen, filtered H20 & luxurious accommodations. Indulge in the sights & sounds of the bay: birds, whales, flowers, vistas and ebb and flow of the tides. Short walk to Seacliff State Beach, beach toys and chairs provided. In the evenings cozy up in the hot tub & watch the coastline lights. Relax to the serene sounds of the breaking waves as you take in nature's lullaby!

The space
Recently remodeled and well cared for home and garden. Modern amenities, new beds and fully equipped kitchen including spices and condiments. Sunny and light filled space with breathtaking views.

Guest access
Guests will have full access to the home, surrounding gardens, and ocean view deck. Owner occupied fenced private cottage on property.

Other things to note
Ocean View Retreat thanks you for honoring our no shoes in the home policy. Please bring your favorite slippers or help
neighborhood_overview: A quiet and tucked away neighborhood however a close and easy walk to the beach and quaint Seacliff Village. Coffee, ice cream, markets and delicious restaurants all within 3/4 of a mile. State Park pass provided allowing  free parking at local beaches.
host_about: I'm a lover of nature, gardens, animals and people. I enjoy sharing my home with others who take in the beauty and tranquility of this retreat that teases and delights the senses.

You’ll love our place because of the proximity to everything and the quiet and quaint modern cottage-like atmosphere. This adult getaway is ideal for couples, solo adventurers, and business travelers. We live next door, so we are available to help you should you need it.

This cute 650 sq ft one bedroom is well appointed in the sunniest part of Santa Cruz in a duplex. There is a small outdoor space for quite hangouts in the sun but please note, this is a non-smoking property.

There is a lockbox for 24 hr check-in. You have your own private entrance.

This is suited best for two adults sleeping in the comfortable queen bed however there is a sleeper couch in the li
neighborhood_overview: It's in a quiet neighborhood just a short walk to the harbor. We think our neighborhood is one of the best in SC. When it's foggy in most parts of Santa Cruz, the sun clears here first! It is close to all the best grocery stores and is centrally located to most everything.
host_about: We work and live in Santa Cruz with a 15 year old son. When we're not working on our business, we enjoy the natural beauty that our area has to offer.

name: Modern Pristine Beach House with an Ocean View
description:
Bright, pristine, modern Beach House with an ocean view. Walk to the beach in minutes. Dine al fresco in the landscaped backyard (BBQ and table for 8). Quiet neighborhood near parks, restaurants and shopping. Enjoy the view and fire pit from the second floor deck or gather a group for a movie on the giant couch in the family room! Multiple family rooms and 4 bedrooms on two floors. Our home is good for couples, business travelers, families (with kids), and bigger groups.

The space
Our home is light and bright and furnished beautifully! It's our family beach house and we use it regularly so it is fully equipped. The location is fantastic. It's a quiet neighborhood but there are restaurants and grocery stores nearby. It's a short walk to the beach. The beach goes for 10+ miles in one direction so it's great for running or walking.

Other things to note
Exit Checklist:

If you have time, strip beds and leave sheets and towels i
neighborhood_overview:
Seacliff State Beach:

Stairs at end of Beachgate Way (3 blocks away).  Walk 2 blocks back down Seacliff toward State Park Drive.  Right on Coates, follow it as it curves around to stairs at Beachgate.

3 mile running loop:  start from cement boat wharf and run North to cliffs at New Brighton Beach and return.

Use outdoor shower upon return, if necessary.

Capitola:

Take Hwy 1 North one exit to “Park Avenue”.  ~ 3/4 mile

Left at Exit (West”) onto Park Ave.  Follow Park Ave until it ends at Monterey / Bay Road.

Left onto Monterey down hill to downtown Capitola (good luck parking!)

Other Attractions:
Simpkins Pool: Huge public pool, fun pools for kids.  Take 1 North to Soquel and head west on Soquel. Take frontage road south until it hits 17th.

Monterey Bay Aquarium. Head south on 1 until you see signs for downtown Monterey and aquarium.

513 Seacliff Drive, Aptos:  Nearby rest
host_about: My husband and I are Bay Area natives.  I grew up in Berkeley and Palo Alto and he grew up in Santa Cruz and San Jose.  We love the beach and doing things outdoors so we bought our beach house back in 2000.  Two of our kids are in college and with only one teenager at home we are enjoying more travels and adventure just the two of us.    We know you will love a vacation in Santa Cruz and we are happy to share ideas on things to do and places to eat!

description:
In a very natural, rural setting amongst the majestic redwoods, we are adjacent to thousand of acres of state park land right outside the door, with endless amazing hiking and mountain biking. You’ll love it here because of the coziness, simple beauty and natural setting, with great morning sun streaming in the windows and apple orchard right outside the door. My place is good for couples and solo travelers. This is a beautiful yet rural setting, please keep this in mind.

Sleeping Capacity: 1 Queen Bed, 1 sofa bed
TV with HBO NOW, Netflix, Amazon Prime Video, etc, all on a RokuTV.

WATER: Enjoy fresh spring water right from the tap!
ECOLOGY: All of our gray water (from showe
neighborhood_overview:
We are located just ten minutes from Santa Cruz, where you can visit the famous Boardwalk, surf, play at the beaches, shop downtown, kayak, or see the monarchs at Natural Bridges State Park. My home in Bonny Doon is only two miles from Henry Cowell State Park, Roaring Camp Railroads. It is close by Big Basin State Park, Castle Rock State Park, for easy access to hiking, mountain biking, swimming.

For grocery shopping you can either drive to Santa Cruz or have easy access to Felton where you will find both a Safeway and New Leaf (natural foods) grocery stores. Big Basin State Park, Loch Lomond, wine tasting, and the Big Foot Museum are all in the area, too.

name: 4 Bedroom Felton Home
description:
4 bedroom home in Felton, partially furnished.

It's a nice place to hang out, relax out on the patio, cook a meal, play games, or watch movies on the couch.

Well suited for a family, friends or coworkers, locals as well as travelers.

The space
Fully furnished master bedroom has a queen size bed, armoire and dresser drawers. It is complete with a private bathroom with shower, walk-in closet, ceiling fan and hardwood flooring.

2nd bedroom is furnished with bunk beds, a full on bottom and twin on top (sleeps 3) and a hutch for clothes and belongings.

Other bedrooms are unfurnished, but have air mattresses and bedding.

Dining room table and chairs
Kitchen fully stocked with dishes, pots and pans. Gas stove & oven, fridge, microwave, dishwasher and coffee maker.

Large sectional sofa and big screen TV in living room (HDMI cable).

Main bathroom has jetted soaking tub.

La

Centrally located in Felton, walk to downtown restaurants / pubs /shops, Henry Cowell, Roaring Camp, Mount Hermon, Covered Bridge Park, Fall Creek, library and churches,

Short drive to Big Basin, Santa Cruz Beach Boardwalk, Santa Cruz Wharf, Natural Bridges, Capitola Village, etc.

5 minutes to Scotts Valley

name: Cottage/studio with private entrance and parking
description:
This newly remodeled studio is spacious, very private and comfortable. Inviting California king bed with duvet, sheets and pillows. Amenities include electric kettle, toaster, french press, plates, cutlery, cups glasses, etc. I do not offer breakfast but there's a selection of snacks, tea and coffee and anything you might need to open a bottle of wine or two. The patio and comfy outdoor gazebo is also for you to relax and hang out. A gas barbecue is available to cook on if you wish.

The space
Nestled in the inner sanctum of the Monterey Bay coastline, away from the fog zone, this comfy cottage studio is the perfect quiet and private getaway. Close to some of the most spectacular scenery in California and excellent restaurants, wineries and breweries, you will never be short of something to do. Close by are miles of beautiful beaches, whale watching, sailing, kayaking, biking, hiking, birding, sunset gazing and people watching. What's not to love about this p
neighborhood_overview: Watsonville is a unique farming community, with wonderful organic and large scale farms.  There are some of the best Mexican restaurants around and we are just a short distance going north to Santa Cruz (20 minutes) and south to Moss Landing (10 minutes),  home to the famous Phil's Fish House, Monterey and Carmel (30 minutes).  A drive to Big Sur takes about 45 minutes.  You will find great seafood restaurants, wineries and stores throughout the area.  The closest supermarkets are Safeway, Nob Hill and Staff of Life Health Food Store.  There is a wonderful local winery called Windy Oaks that has picnic sites and spectacular views of the bay.  Corralitos Brewery is just around the corner.  The Wooden Nickel, funky bar on Freedom Blvd has the best burgers around (the Nickel Burger is my personal favorite) and Cafe Rio at Seascape Beach has fine dining a coffee shop to enjoy morning coffee with a walk on the beach after breakfast.  There are two of the best sushi restaurants around in Wat
host_about: An energetic woman with a great sense of humor, who loves to travel and discover the mysteries the world has to offer.  I am an avid reader and member of two book clubs. I love movies, good food and enjoy everything about this part of California. An afternoon sailing on the Monterey Bay with friends is one of my most favorite things do.

name: Bonny Doon Studio -Private space above barn.
description:
*Only for those who want to unplug and unwind * No Wi Fi* *no cell reception there is a land line to use in emergency*
Large one room on second floor of barn in the Santa Cruz Mountains. Looks out on a "fairy ring" of redwood trees. This is a barn so horses do sleep below you at night.
We clean ourselves and DO NOT CHARGE an extra fee but it is a Barn - more glamping than motel/hotel . Sorry not amenable for self check in. For safety need to greet/orient you to property.

The space
It is very much like a tree house . All you can see from windows are the large trees and sky . Small deck outside room to observe the night sky. The beds- 2 queen size air mattresses covered with foam toppers good quality sheets and quilts. Beds are regular height off floor and there is on one double futon ( very firm)
Almost no car traffic . also the forest muffles sounds making for a very quiet environment , but might hear horses shuffling in stalls below you.
host_about: Frequent traveler, camped and hiked in many of the National Parks in North America, but love visiting San Francisco and other major cities too. Bluegrass music is our favorite but love all good music jazz, folk , rock , opera , C&W, classical.

description:
My place is OCEANFRONT AT THE BEACH IN SANTA CRUZ - close to Beach Boardwalk, Pier, Great Surfing, Lighthouse, Downtown, UC Santa Cruz. Come experience this dog-friendly west side neighborhood.

You’ll love my place because IT'S OCEANFRONT! Prime location along majestic West Cliff Dr. This single-story beach home fronts the best beach and boasts an oceanfront patio, enclosed backyard, kitchen with breakfast area, 2 fireplaces, 2 car garage, WiFi, 4 TV's, comfortable, clean, private.

The space
THIS IS ONE OF VERY FEW OCEANFRONT HOMES WITH A FULLY ENCLOSED BACKYARD. PERFECT FOR COUPLES OR FAMILIES. BEACH, TIDE POOLS, AND PAVED OCEAN PATHWAY THAT EXTENDS FROM NATURAL BRIDGES TO SANTA CRUZ PIER & BOARDWALK IN FRONT!

FRONT PATIO ON OCEAN SIDE:
Brick patio offers an outstanding place to relax in the front yard. Enjoy the view from majestic West Cliff Drive. Sit in the sunshine, or under the covered porch. Private beach with tide pools to the left. Extraordinary Ocean Views. In the evening, guests have use of a self-contained fire pit. 3-mile Ocean pathway connects Natural Bridges State Beach and Park to the Santa Cruz Beach Boardwalk. name: 825/Seacliff Sunset House *HOT TUB*
description:
Seacliff home over looking the Borregas Creek Open Space! *HOT TUB* 3 Night Minimum Off-season/5 night minimum Holiday/Summer Season. Available monthly at 3 months max.

The space
Escape to this tranquil, light-filled mid century modern three bedroom, two bath house.  Relax and bird watch on the expansive 3 level deck which overlooks the lush Borregas Creek Open Space.  Lounge on the outdoor daybed with a glass of wine, while taking in the magnificent sunset.  Stay cozy after sundown, stargazing with the outdoor gas fireplace.  There’s an outdoor hot shower and sunken hot tub for total relaxation. 
The interior of the house is a curate mix of modern and vintage furniture.  There are wood floors throughout (no shoes please) and hotel quality beds.
 The dramatic living room with 12' ceilings and flooded with natural light, is where everyone comes together for dinner, drinks and good conversation with friends and family (please note NO TV in living room).
neighborhood_overview: Great quiet neighborhood just a short walk to the famous Beachgate stairs to the Seacliff State Beach, resturants, and shopping.
host_about:
Kendall & Potter was established as a real estate company in (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) The brokers Skipper Kendall and William Pottermoved to Aptos to fulfill their dream of working in a small town in Santa Cruz County. In (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) , they expanded their services to include property management and relocation from Santa Cruz to Monterey Coast.

Kendall & Potter continues to be seen as one of the leading forces in Santa Cruz Property Management and Real Estate.

The Real Estate Division of the company was sold in (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) Kendall and Potter remained brokers of the Property Management Department until (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) Rita Law, DRE# (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) , now owner/broker, purchased the property department in (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) and has been on site ever since.

Rita has worked for Kendall & Potter in the property management and the Santa Cruz real estate industry for 20 years. A Board Member of the Aptos Chamber of Commerce, past Board Director of Santa Cruz Tourist and Convention Center and Vacation Rental Managers Association. Current member of California Association of Realtors CAR and National Association of Property Managers, NARPM.

Kendall & Potter Property Management offers a variety of home services – including complete property management services, leases on unfurnished properties and rental homes in Santa Cruz, as well as Monterey Coast & Santa Cruz vacation rentals management and corporate housing.

description:
My place is a block to Seabright beach, Santa Cruz Yacht Harbor, Whale History Museum, eateries, public transport, and several other local shops. You’ll love my place if you surf, enjoy water activities, local wineries and breweries, or just hang on the beach. You will love the neighborhood. Easy walk to the boardwalk, Wharf or downtown.

My place is good for couples, elderly (no steps), solo adventurers, families and business travelers.

Price includes county TOT tax of 11%.

The space
My home was built in 1895 and made of all redwood. This room is the master bedroom and a large shared master bath. The bedroom walls are lined with virgin (non stained, non sanded) redwood. There are two large skylights that allow plenty of sunshine and blackout shades that can be pulled to keep the room dark if desired. Private entrance and easy self check in. Nice patio space and area where surf boards or bikes can be stored. This room has a mini fridge and
neighborhood_overview: Friendly, peaceful, view of ocean from street

The kitchen is well equipped for preparing a home cooked meal and the enclosed courtyard with covered patio seating is a great place to relax, dine and BBQ. name: Tropical Seabright Beach and Boardwalk Getaway
description:
Come soak up the sun and positive vibes of Santa Cruz in our private, adorable, tropical 2 bedroom space. All the amenities of home. Walking distance to the beach, The Boardwalk, Yacht harbor and tasty eateries. Complete with extras for the beach. The perfect location for couples, friends and families alike!

The space
**ATTENTION!** Per Santa Cruz City law, we are required as Airbnb hosts to collect the Transient Occupancy Tax (TOT) SEPARATELY from your Airbnb transaction. The TOT is 11% of the entire booking (before Airbnb fees). To make the process easier we will send you a request for the tax through the Airbnb resolution when we send check-in information. If you prefer, we can collect this in cash or check upon check-in or checkout.**

Located 4 blocks from the yacht harbor, only six blocks from the beach and a short walk or ride to The Boardwalk, our sunny, tropical getaway is a great place to relax and close to many delicious restaurants and coffe
neighborhood_overview: Uniquely located in the “banana belt” of Santa Cruz, our Seabright neighborhood sees significantly less fog than other low-lying areas of the city due to its close proximity to the Santa Cruz harbor.  We are less than seven blocks from the beach, less than 0.8 miles from The Boardwalk and a bike’s ride from downtown.
host_about: We are an adventurous, outdoorsy couple born and raised in California. Toby is a Filmmaker and Cinematographer and I (Chels) am a Registered Nurse at the local hospital in Santa Cruz. Toby is an avid surfer and both of us enjoy rock climbing, mountain biking, hiking and traveling the world. We are always looking for new experiences and enjoy meeting new people!

name: Beautiful Canyon Views, private suite in Soquel
description:
About this listing:
Our home is located in the quiet hillside neighborhood of Monterey Bay Heights in Soquel, just 2.7 miles from Capitola Village and Beach. Enjoy redwood canyon views and still not be far from town.

You’ll have your own parking spot, a private entrance, spacious living room to relax, and a cozy bedroom with comfy queen bed. Our place is perfect for individuals and couples. Infants who are not crawling yet are welcome. Nosotros hablamos español.

The space
Our unique space offers room for comfortable relaxation. Along with the lovely views, you may see quail or deer walking by the entrance door, or hear coyotes yipping in the distance. Hawks and ravens are known to soar across the canyon, and sometimes you can hear the hooting of the Great Horned Owl at night.

Relax with coffee in the morning, or sip wine on the balcony off the living room in the summer and fall afternoons. We offer use of a State Park Poppy Pass u
neighborhood_overview:
Our neighborhood is a friendly, settled area with many young families and older folks combined. It is generally very quiet. We have plenty of redwood, bay and oak trees, and across the street is a small nature preserve of the Coastal Prairie habitat.

Please practice social distancing if you go for a walk, and use a mask when passing other people.
host_about:
We are Karen and Darren, a married couple with 3 decades of living in Santa Cruz County. We have three adult children, and are now empty nesters looking to have guests in the private  downstairs level of our lovely Soquel home. 

We are musicians in the Coastal Prairie Band and play at many weddings in the area.  We also love running and hiking, and as long-time members of the Santa Cruz Track Club, we have lots of information to share about places to run.

We are generally quiet people who enjoy small gatherings with friends and family. On work nights we usually spend the evening reading or binge watching good shows on TV. 

Karen is a recently retired teacher with 33 years in the great local public schools. She taught Spanish, and Darren works in the legal field. Both are fluent Spanish-speakers. We look forward to traveling to Spanish-language countries in our retirement.

We love our community--its people and its natural beauty. We are happy to be able to share a retreat for those looking to experience this area.

name: Romantic & Historic Spanish Style Home with Bicycles For Two
description:
Curl up with a book in your red leather armchair in your beautiful living room featuring down Restoration Hardware furnishings and a gas burning fireplace. In the evening, take a seat on your patio beneath a leafy pergola and enjoy a cold drink at this historic, Spanish-style home. The Apartment is private and completely separate from the main house. You will have your own separate entrance and patio area with a peek of the ocean; we look forward to hosting you!

Please note: The city collects an 11% Transient Occupancy Tax. We will bid you for payment via Airbnb 1 week prior to check-in.
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is set in this Spanish-style home, which is one of four “Spanish Sisters” that were built in 1929 by architect L.W. Miller. Downtown Santa Cruz’s bakeries, grocery stores, wine tasting, the beach, pubs, and restaurants are all a short walk away as is UCSC. Please note that we live upstairs so you may be somewhat aware of us. However, your apartment is very private, and we cannot hear you unless you want us to. We don't have children or dogs, so relax and enjoy this special spot!
host_about:
I am a native Californian, happily married and live in the Upper West Side neighborhood conveniently close to my downtown Santa Cruz salon suite. 

In my free time I enjoy entertaining, Pilates, tandem bicycling with my husband Gavin, hiking, dining in our many local restaurants, traveling and reading in the company of our ginger catToby.

name: The Tetradecagon Treehouse
description:
The house gets its name from its unique 14-sided shape & stunning mountain location. Surrounded by 6 acres of forest, blissfully insulated from the outside world, our home is a sunny oasis of calm & relaxation. Guests get the entire first floor, including: private entrance, option of 1 or 2 bedrooms, spacious family room with coffee station, and private bath. Located minutes from both wineries & Boulder Creek downtown, and only a short drive from Big Basin Redwoods State Park & Santa Cruz.

The space
Your space is the entire ground floor of our home. It has a private entrance and is closed off from our living quarters for your privacy and comfort: if you only require one guest room, the other will not be rented. Please note - if only two persons but you desire both bedrooms, please add $50 per night for the second bedroom. Each room accommodates up to 2 persons and both offer real beds and blackout curtains for peaceful sleep. The Red Room has a queen bed and
neighborhood_overview:
Away from the hustle and bustle of San Francisco and San Jose, the Santa Cruz Mountains are an oasis with fragrant redwoods, stunning views, and star-filled nights. The mountains provide an ideal climate for vineyards, and wineries are plentiful, many with tasting rooms.

Boulder Creek has just about anything you need, with two grocery stores, a post office, gas station, drug store, hardware stores, antiques, boutiques, hair salons, beauty spas, and numerous places to grab a bite to eat or quench your thirst. There are also watering holes and restaurants with live music in the area, and seasonal outdoor festivals of every description.

The mountains are full of redwood, fir, oak, bay, madrone, blackberries, and ferns, and wildlife abounds: numerous songbirds, wild turkeys, peacocks, owls, and deer (who can occasionally be found napping under the deck), plus smaller creatures like butterflies, vociferous crickets, and the infamous banana slugs (UC Santa Cruz's belo

neighborhood_overview:

name: Coastview Beach House w/ Ocean View, Hot Tub
description:
Steps from the beach, with incredible views of the ocean and lagoon from the spacious front patio with BBQ and hot tub, this classic Santa Cruz mid-century beach bungalow is the perfect home-away-from-home for your beach vacation.

Please read the 'House Manual' to assure the property is a right fit for you and your friends/family. This is a quiet neighborhood, and not a 'Party House'. Thank you!

The space
We are located just a couple hundred yards from renowned Santa Maria beach, this mid-century, beach bungalow is perfect for families and groups of friends looking for a home-away-from-home for their beach vacation. From the patio, hot tub, kitchen, and living area, there are sweeping views of Corcoran Lagoon, the towering Eucalyptus grove and surrounding wildlife, and the beach on the other side of East Cliff Drive - just a two minute walk away, and a popular hangout spot for dolphins, seals, and otters, surfers and boogie boarders alike. Since the ho
neighborhood_overview:
We're located in one of the sunniest parts close to the coast in Santa Cruz and steps away from (what I believe is) one of the best beaches in the region. Our beach home was one of the the first properties right on beautiful and quiet Corcoran Lagoon. The road is private and gated, so only the cars of the residents are able to come in. The close by beach is wonderful, large, and perfect for long strolls or finding a peaceful spot to people watch, relax and reflect. Dolphins, seals and otters can be spotted in the waves, and surfers and boogie boarders frequent several breaks along the beach.
In addition, our East Cliff neighborhood offers restaurants, shops and places to visit.
host_about: A long time resident of Santa Cruz and Big Sur, I purchased this home in 1991 and raised both my sons here. The stories and memories of my family, world travels, and careers in film, music, tech and art collecting, are present throughout the home.

name: Vibrant home with breathtaking views & convenient location!
description:
The space
You'll be right in the heart of vibrant, but laid-back Santa Cruz when you stay at this cute and cozy beach getaway, just a short walk from the famous Santa Cruz Beach Boardwalk! With two bedrooms, two bathrooms, and room for six, this Central California Coast condo will be a perfect home away from home, with one-of-a-kind Boardwalk, Wharf, and ocean views!

Located seventy-three miles south of San Francisco, this Boardwalk Dream is ideally situated for exploring a long stretch of coast both north and south. Head up to the City by the Bay for a day trip, or drive just over 40 miles south and wander the ocean exhibits at the popular Monterey Bay Aquarium. If you want to stick closer to home, you'll be right in the desirable Beach Hill neighborhood, with shops, galleries, restaurants, and of course the beach, easily walkable and right nearby!

This Boardwalk Dream vacation condo boasts tall ceilings and an open floor plan, w

We like to think we offer the best of both worlds: you can enjoy a one-of-a-kind vacation experience in a unique property, without compromising on service and convenience. name: Charming House- walk to harbor, beach, restaurants
description:
This house is walking distance to the Santa Cruz Harbor, Twin Lakes Beach, and some of the best restaurants in Santa Cruz. It's a comfortable one bedroom home located upstairs (above the garage) in a quiet neighborhood. The sofa in the living room folds out into a queen size bed to accommodate up to 2 more guests.

The space
This is a one bedroom house located upstairs (above garage). It has a sunny deck with BBQ and hardwood floors. I provide wifi and a 32 inch smart TV. Pandora music is available free of charge on the smart TV. Other streaming services such as Netflix, Amazon and Hulu can easily be accessed if you have an account. The bathroom has both a shower and bath tub. Beach and bath towels, shampoo, conditioner, body wash and a blow dryer are also provided. The kitchen is equiped with dishes and appliances including a coffee pot, toaster, blender, and waffle maker. Oil, sugar, and spices are also provided but you should plan on bringing any other food i
neighborhood_overview: If you decide to eat out there are many options available within walking distance. The Crows Nest, Cafe El Palomar, Johnny’s, The Harbor Cafe (amazing breakfast), and L&L Hawaiian are all great dining options.  During the day you can walk to the harbor, which is a great place to rent stand up paddle boards, take a motor taxi, or go sailing on the Chardonnay. Twin Lakes Beach is a beautiful beach that offers beach volley ball nets, is dog friendly (on leash only), and allows bon fires until 10:00 pm.
host_about: I love to spend time with my 3 kids at the beach, or vacationing in Tahoe during the winter months. We often rent houses through airbnb when we travel and appreciate the “at home” experience has provided my family. Renting a house with a kitchen and great location to experience the location of your travel experience offers so much more than a hotel room. I love sharing our small, cute house with visitors that want an affordable, memorable vacation close to the beach.

The space

neighborhood_overview: We are close to everything but nestled away on a quiet, sunny street. A few minutes walk to the ocean. Walk to Santa Cruz local favorites Dharma's restaurant and Fast Eddy's Billiards and Bar, The gorgeous and famous Shadowbrook Inn Restaurant, Whole Foods, CVS, Capitola Village, the Capitola Mall, East Cliff. name: Private Suite in the Redwoods with a View
description:
Our location is on a quiet dead-end street in the beautiful redwood forested mountains above Felton. We have an intimate private suite (bedroom with Queen bed, sitting room and bath), with its own entrance.

We have a wide view of the San Lorenzo Valley, and are only 2 miles from downtown Felton. Access to hiking, mountain biking, coast trail and surfing is within minutes.

We are taking the current coronavirus situation very seriously, and have implemented advanced cleaning procedures.

The space
Your non-smoking and flame-free suite includes a bedroom with pillow-top Queen size bed, a sitting room furnished with a work/eating table and chairs and two lounge chairs, and a private bath. Secure WiFi is provided.

This cozy space on the ground floor of the house includes a microwave, coffeemaker, electric tea pot, and mini-fridge, along with an assortment of teas and coffee. There is also a full compliment of silverware, dishes, and gl
neighborhood_overview:
Our place is great for hiking and enjoying the redwood forest. We are just a couple of minutes from Henry Cowell State Park, Big Basin State Park, and Roaring Camp Railroad. We have hiking access to Fall Creek with no need for driving. We are also just a short drive from Santa Cruz beaches and the Boardwalk, as well as coastal trails and whale watching at Wilder Ranch State Park. You’ll love our place because of its quiet location with little traffic, and a wonderful view of the San Lorenzo Valley.

We're only 2 miles from downtown Felton, where you can find grocery shopping, a brewery, and several great restaurants. Within a couple of miles you can find Mexican, Chinese, breakfasts, burgers, Cal cuisine, Italian, pizza, and sushi. Felton is also home to a well-known and very cool international music venue, as well as an excellent coffee house.
host_about:
After 20 years in marine biology I changed careers to being a custom furniture designer/maker. I'm also a semi-pro photographer.

My wife, Sally, works for an international scientific instrument company, and is an avid painter and gardener.

We love to travel whenever we can.

neighborhood_overview: Whether you're visiting for pleasure or business, you'll find everything you need for a pleasant stay at our Capitola Village townhouse. Capitola is California's oldest ocean side resort and offers visitors a chance to relax and unwind during any season of the year. Plan your visit around one of Capitola's fun-filled festivals. An art and wine festival and a begonia festival are held each September. Movies are shown on the beach during the summer, music fills the air on Sunday afternoons and memorable activities take place during the holiday season as well.  If you want to get your feet wet, paddleboard, surf or rent a boat. The location of our townhouse puts everything at your fingertips. It's only a short walk to the sandy beach and steps from the delicious restaurants, art galleries and eclectic shops in the village. Just leave your car in the private parking area and get around on foot during your stay! Two bedrooms and two bathrooms will accommodate four guests comfortably. So com

Relax under the stars on the outdoor lounges chairs, and don't miss the chance to have your morning coffee on the sunny patio, half a block from the beach and in the HEART of beautiful Capitola Village! A washer and dryer and WIFI are available for guest use as well.

Capitola is a historic and atmospheric little coastal town with plenty of surf spots, boutique shops and a whole host of commercial and entertainment outlets for
neighborhood_overview: Plan your visit around one of Capitola's fun-filled festivals. An art and wine festival and a begonia festival are held each September. Movies are shown on the beach during the summer, music fills the air on Sunday afternoons and memorable activities take place during the holiday season as well.  If you want to get your feet wet, paddleboard, surf or rent a boat. The location of our townhouse puts everything at your fingertips. It's only a short walk to the sandy beach and steps from the delicious restaurants, art galleries and eclectic shops in the village. Just leave your car in the private parking area and get around on foot during your stay!  So come explore Capitola Village and see why so many people chose to vacation here year after year.
host_about: I enjoy spending time with my family, going for long walks on the beach with my husband or cheering for the kids in their various sports events.  My favorite activities are surfing, swimming, and hot yoga/ pilates.

name: Seacliff Beach Flat: Coastal Vibes, Walk to Beach
description:
Surf’s up at this breezy getaway, located just a ten-minute stroll from Seacliff Beach. Sunshine pours into open living spaces—there’s plenty of room here for the whole family to kick back and chill out. Once you’re ready to explore, you’ll find scenic bluff beaches, trails through redwoods, and awesome eateries within walking distance.

The space
Find your zen in this airy 2BR with coastal California vibes—part of a small fourplex in charming Aptos.

A bright living space features plenty of seating and a flat-screen TV with Hulu and Netflix. Shake off the sand and settle in for snacks and conversation after a day on the beach.

Calling all anglers: the full-size kitchen is perfect for making a feast from whatever you catch off Seacliff Pier. A table for five offers the perfect spot for long and lazy family dinners together as the sun goes down. Once dusk settles in, head outside to the shared gazebo to toast some marshmallows around the fire p
neighborhood_overview:
If you’re visiting to experience coastal beauty, you’re found the right spot. Just a ten-minute walk away is Seacliff Beach. Visit to swim, sun, hike, or fish—and to see the famed SS Palo Alto, a concrete ship where sea birds, fish, and marine mammals come to feast.

For outdoor fun even closer by, Seacliff Village Park—a quaint neighborhood park with picnic tables, a playground, and skate park—is right at the end of the block.

There’s a whole array of eateries within walking distance, ranging from drive-ins to Indian fare to Mexican spots. Or grab groceries from the nearby Safeway for meals at home, then treat yourself to a sundae from Marianne’s, a favorite local ice cream joint just down the block (don’t leave without trying one of their unique flavors like 1020 or Heaven!).

Drive just 10 minutes to Santa Cruz for countless shops and restaurants, plus a famous boardwalk with vintage rides and fun events. For a change of scenery, drive 5 minutes to Nis
